sentence_text: We support the holding of an independent , fair and objective investigation into the incident .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: We also call on all parties  to coordinate and cooperate during the investigation .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: The recent situation in Ukraine remains turbulent .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: Armed conflict and incidents of violence frequently occur ,  causing loss of life and destruction of property .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: China is deeply concerned about the situation .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: We hope  that the parties concerned will take into account the well - being of the entire population of Ukraine ,  focus on maintaining regional peace and stability ,  stay calm and exercise restraint  to prevent the further escalation of the conflict and confrontation .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: I shall not take up much ofthe Council 's time .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I should just like to say two things .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: First , the representative of Ukraine is far too easy in characterizing his own people as bandits .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The Right Sector and those who say  the demonstrators should be killed  are not bandits ;  they are simply the political elite of Kyiv .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Are not those who are protesting in eastern Ukraine able to do so without Russia 's say - so ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Do they need Russia to say  that events in Kyiv are unacceptable before they are able to grasp that ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: When radicals come to tell the miners  of that region that they will establish their own order  - surely the miners can understand that without a hint from Russia ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Are the protesters able to understand how bad things have become  only when Russian agents come to explain the situation to them ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Do their own life experience and understanding of the situation in their own country count for nothing ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: How will those things influence them ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Secondly ,  with regard to the statement made by my American colleague Ms. Power ,  she did not mention her view on the decree to use armed force in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I hope that ,  as the Ukrainian representative has called for ,  following today 's discussion some Western colleagues and partners will pick up the telephone  and call their leaders and those in Kyiv with whom they enjoy influence ,  who may not act  unless they get the green light from Western capitals .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I would ask my colleagues to give them the red light  and tell them that problems can be resolved through dialogue and not military confrontation .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Fourthly , a few times , the representative of the Russian Federation has described   what is happening in the eastern cities as protests and demonstrations .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: I would refer back to my French colleague 's comment   that those claims are rooted in some idea   that the Internet does not exist   and that people can not see for themselves   that they are not protests   and they are not demonstrations .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: They are professional forces carrying weapons   - Russian - made weapons , as it happens -   and carrying out sophisticated , coordinated military operations across a substantial number of eastern Ukrainian cities .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: They are not demonstrations .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: They are not protests .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: They are military operations .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Finally , the credibility of the Russian Federation has been gravely undermined .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: That said , we remain eager and willing to talk about how to de - escalate the situation .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: That will require that the Russian Federation pull back its forces ,   which are ominously stationed and massed at the eastern Ukrainian border .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: It will require that the Russian Federation work to de - escalate the situation in the light of the armed takeover of those buildings .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: If , in fact , the Russian Federation is interested in peace and in upholding its role as an enforcer of international peace and security ,   then it will engage quickly and with a wholly different degree of conviction , urgency and truthfulness   than it has up to this point .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Many words have been spoken  and many pronouncements made here today .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: But the first impression I would like to share with my colleagues is that they have not been looking at the clock .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It is now 9.30 pm .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: our time ,  which means that in Ukraine it is about 3.30 am .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: That means that in a couple of hours it will be Monday morning , 14 April .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: That is the date  when it has been agreed  that Mr. Turchynov 's criminal decree  sending Ukraine 's military forces  to suppress the protests  will take effect .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: We have heard many unfair pronouncements about Russia today ,  but of course the most unfair of all came from our Ukrainian colleague ,  who accused  Russia of terrorism .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Why did he not accuse those who terrorized his Government for months on end , up to 21 February , of terrorism ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: They were people who really did terrorize the forces of law and order ,  who really did attack police  and shoot at them and at those protesting against the authorities  and seemed to be attacking their country .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Why were they not called terrorists ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Indeed , they have been exempted from any responsibility for the criminal activities they conducted for several months .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Women are not just victims of terrorist groups ;  they have multiple roles to play .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: I am convinced  that the women and peace and security agenda must be fully integrated into counter - terrorism strategies .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: The fight against terrorism and violent extremism is a common undertaking  and ,  to be effective ,  no stakeholder should be neglected .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Women are an integral part of the fight against terrorism  and it is essential to provide them with the necessary means to play their parts .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Finally , and thirdly , we must redouble our efforts to reintegrate women associated with armed groups .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Women who have suffered the violence of conflict are often marked by a considerable post - conflict stress :  they bear the stigma of sexual violence .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: We must ensure that they are able to return to their societies and their communities of origin .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: That return is often violent .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Husbands , families and the labour market all reject them .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Therefore , it is crucial that women who are liberated from those armed groups should enjoy  -just like men or soldiers -  disarmament , demobilization and reintegration ( DDR ) programmes .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Similarly , it is necessary for security sector reform ( SSR ) programmes implemented in post - crisis situations to take into account women and gender issues .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Without that proper rehabilitation , women will remain marginalized and represent a gap in the rebuilding of societies .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: It is time for DDR and SSR to become more female - oriented .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: During the entire course of the crisis in Ukraine , Russia has never advocated aggravating it  or destabilizing the country .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: We have absolutely no interest in doing such a thing ,  since for us Ukraine is too important as an economic and political partner and a country that is very close to us in many ways .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: We do not desire its destabilization .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: We are not to blame for what has produced the results that we are now witnessing .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Mr. Fernandez - Taranco said  that it was on 6 April  that the actions were first observed  whereby residents of south - eastern areas of Ukraine were seizing certain administrative buildings .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: And in this , of course , they learned from the experience of the Maidan in Kyiv ,  where for weeks and months administrative buildings were occupied ,  and which for some reason our Western partners saw as demonstrations of democracy .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Third , several questions continue to be absent from our debate ,  such as the suffering of women who are living under foreign occupation .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: I point out also  the exaggeration of the link with human rights and international humanitarian law ,  because it weakens the means for providing available protection in times of peace as well as in times of war .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: I reiterate  that there is the problem of politicizing some of the issues linked to the two regimes of international law  that I have mentioned .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: There are also problems with regard to the infringement of national sovereignty ,  and sometimes we rely on information that is unofficial and lacking precision .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: That distracts our attention from the issues that concern us , to their detriment ,  in particular the participation of women in conflict prevention and resolution .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: Fourth , problems and weaknesses persist with regard to the appointment of women to senior level and leadership posts in political missions .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: Fifth , our programme of action completely fails to take into account cultural particularities in its implementation ,  which negatively affects the participation of women in conflict prevention and resolution .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: Sixth , it is important that discussions continue within the Special Committee on Peacekeeping Operations ,  so that we can confront the challenges and problems standing in the way of the full participation of women in peacekeeping activities .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: The international community and members of the Council should not be fooled by the pronouncements of the likes of Yanukovich and his corrupt cronies .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: The independence , sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine are being threatened ,  and that threat is a threat to the security and stability of the whole region and Europe ,  with serious international repercussions .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: We urge the Russian Federation  to call back its troops from the Ukrainian border ,  to stop supporting separatist groups  and to cease all other actions aimed at destabilizing Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: The meeting among the United States , Russia , Ukraine and the European Union foreseen for 17 April in Geneva wold offer a viable chance for dialogue and diplomacy .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: We call on Russia  not to waste that opportunity .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: This appalling attack occurred in the context of a crisis  that has been fuelled by Russian support for separatists through arms , weapons and training ,  by the Russian failure to follow through on its commitments  and by its failure to adhere to the fundamental principles of the United Nations Charter .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The tragedy only underscores the urgency and the determination  with which we insist that Russia immediately take concrete steps  to de - escalate the situation in Ukraine ,  support a sustainable ceasefire  and follow the path towards peace that the Ukrainian Government has consistently offered .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: This war can be ended .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russia can end this war .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russia must end this war .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The first proposal is the establishment as soon as possible of an international coordination mechanism ,  comprising all the parties concerned ,  in order to explore means for the political settlement ofthe Ukrainian crisis .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: Secondly , in the meanwhile , all parties should refrain from taking any action  that may further escalate the situation .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: Thirdly , international financial institutions should start to examine how to help to maintain the economic and financial stability of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: I would like to thank you , Mr. President , for convening this meeting .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I also thank Under - Secretary - General Jeffrey Feltman for his briefing .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I would like to start by expressing my Government 's sorrow and deep condolences to all the Missions whose citizens were killed in the terrible crash of Malaysia Airlines Flight MH-17 .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Ukraine shares the pain of their loss and grieves with their bereaved families and friends .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: My country extends its profound sympathy to those affected by the accident .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Today , all of Ukraine is mourning .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Ukrainians are visiting the Embassies of the Netherlands , Malaysia , Australia , Indonesia , the United Kingdom , Germany , Belgium , the Philippines and Canada  in order to leave flowers and express their sorrow .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The Ukrainian authorities have already called on international organizations ,  including the International Civil Aviation Organization , Interpol and others ,  to undertake a thorough international investigation of the accident .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: We believe that an impartial investigation will reveal the truth  and that all perpetrators will be punished .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Yesterday , the Ukrainian leadership announced a basic version of what happened with the flight :  it was an act of terror .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The position of our Government is based on converging data from different intelligence and open sources ,  which show that the aircraft was shot down over territory controlled by terrorists .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Two Ukrainian jets were shot down near the same location several days before ,  with terrorist leaders claiming responsibility for those acts .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Intercepted telephone conversations between the terrorist leaders and their coordinator - Russian military intelligence colonel Vasili Geranin - confirm  that terrorists are behind this crime .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: That conversation was recorded ,  and the Secretariat has promised to convey it to members of the Security Council .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Ithank Assistant Secretary - General Oscar Fernandez - Taranco for his briefing .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: The Republic of Korea is closely watching the recent developments in the eastern part of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: We are deeply concerned over the escalation of tensions in various cities of eastern Ukraine ,  including the worrying seizure of key public buildings in Donetsk and Slovyansk by force .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: Those actions will only further exacerbate the already tense situation ,  and we condemn any use of force to change the situation on the ground .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: As Ukraine moves towards critical elections in May ,  we believe that political differences must be addressed in a non - violent way through a legitimate process .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: United Nations States Members should respect that process ,  and there should not be any influence exerted by outside forces .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: We reiterate our strong support for the sovereignty , territorial integrity and independence of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: The future of Ukraine should not , and can not , be up to anyone else but the Ukrainians themselves .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: We should support the Ukrainian authorities in organizing elections , under the best of conditions , that ensure that everyone is represented .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Our message has always been clear  that the presidential election scheduled for 25 May must be free and transparent and guaranteed by the presence of international observers .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: We reiterate our commitment to the territorial integrity of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: We call on Russia commit to de - escalation and to condemn , along with the rest of the Council , the attempts at destabilization carried out by armed groups in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: We also call on Russia to fully assume its role as a permanent member of the Security Council .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Russia is a guarantor of peace and security in the world , both in the larger world and in its immediate neighbourhood .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: There can not be two different standards .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Russia must today put its full weight behind helping Ukraine regain stability .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: It must show itself up to the task ofplaying the role it wishes to play as a pillar of Euro - Asian stability .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: We hope that the proposed meeting on 17 April among Russia , Ukraine , the United States and the European Union will be held and that it makes it possible for solutions to emerge .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: This is a crucial stage  and we call on all parties to exercise calm and restraint .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: In conclusion , I would like to raise a final warning call .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: The danger that now faces us is the failure of all our concerted efforts to build an international order that is not based on force ,  for today it is force alone that is seeking to impose the law .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: So I think  that it is very , very strange  to hear Member States call on the one hand for more aggressive action or more accountability  and then try to punt the issue to a body  that for years has been unable to come to a consensus ;  and with several countries ,  again including countries on the Council ,  trying to water down what happens in the General Assembly ,  no reasonable person could expect a different result .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Let me conclude with two messages .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: To the tens of thousands of troops and police who serve honourably in United Nations peacekeeping operations ,  we salute them unequivocally  for putting their lives on the line , with little fanfare or recognition , for people who live in countries far from their own .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We and the civilians that they protect with their bravery are completely indebted to them for their service .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: As I did yesterday ( see S / PV.7642 ) , I would single out those members of the Council that have contributed so many peacekeepers ,  including Egypt , Senegal , China , Uruguay and , of course , the United Kingdom ,  which is becoming involved again .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: As a country that does not contribute a lot of troops ,  we are in awe of their service .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: To the victims of sexual exploitation and abuse by United Nations peacekeepers ,  we pledge  that we will do better .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The United Kingdom is gravely concerned by events in eastern Ukraine ,  which have escalated over the past 48 hours ,  with armed men seizing control of Government buildings and erecting checkpoints and barricades in six different cities .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Street protests have given way to violent action .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: That is a dangerous escalation of an already dangerous situation .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: We have all seen the video footage of events over the weekend :  professional , well - armed and well - equipped units wearing identical uniforms conducting coordinated military operations against Ukrainian State institutions .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: That is a pattern that is all too familiar .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Coming just weeks after Russian troops illegally deployed to Crimea while wearing uniforms without insignia ,  these events point clearly to Russia once again interfering directly in the internal affairs of Ukraine while using manufactured pretexts and military force .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Such actions are contrary to international law ,  have already been condemned by the international community  and have been declared invalid by the General Assembly .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: As a Member of the United Nations , and as a permanent member of the Security Council , Russia is obliged to refrain from the threat or use of force against the territorial integrity and political independence of any State .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Yet satellite images show that there are between 35,000 and 40,000 Russian troops in the vicinity of the border with Ukraine ,  equipped with combat aircraft , tanks , artillery and logistical support units .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: That is in addition to the 25,000 Russian troops based illegally in Crimea .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Just as six weeks ago Russia denied  deploying its troops to Crimea ,  it also now denies  that it has amassed troops on Ukraine 's eastern border .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: It claims  that the publicly available satellite images illustrating that troop deployment were taken in August 2013 .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: That is false ;  additional images released on 11 April show clearly that the build - up started in early March of this year .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: With the shooting down of a civilian airplane carrying civilians ,  the Ukrainian crisis is no longer a conflict between the Ukrainian military and armed separatists .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: The conflict has crossed a red line  by endangering all our lives ,  as if did in the case of the men , women and children from different countries who were aboard Flight MH - l7 .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: We condemn in the strongest terms  this reckless attack  and call  for a comprehensive , independent , international investigation in accordance with international guidelines ,  as agreed in the press statement adopted this morning .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: Such an investigaton should establish responsibility  so that the perpetrators can be held accountable .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: In that context , we further urge all parties to cease fire ,  to fully cooperate with the investigation  and to grant unhindered access to the crash site  in order to allow international investigators to carry out their work .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: It is unfortunate that this tragic event comes at a time when national and regional efforts are under way to find a political and diplomatic solution to the Ukrainian crisis .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: This act undermines valuable initiatives of the trilateral contact group of senior representatives of Ukraine , the Russian Federation and the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe ,  who were making all necessary efforts for a resumption of consultations with separatists in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: On Tuesday , the group reconfirmed  its support for President Petro Poroshenko 's peace plan , as well as its commitment to a sustainable ceasefire ,  as stated in the joint declaration issued in Berlin on 2 July by the Foreign Ministers of Germany , France , the Russian Federation and Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: In reality , nothing will come of those pathetic efforts  - certainly not the basis for any legal reasoning .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: The vetoing of a text that is nothing more than a reminder of the basic principles of international law and the Charter of the United Nations is clear proof of that .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: The headlines can be simple :  Russia has vetoed the Charter of the United Nations .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: In desperation , therefore , Moscow invokes the pretext of protecting Russians who are supposedly threatened in Crimea .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: I am sure that neighbouring countries that host Russian minorities appreciate this right to interfere  that Russia has suddenly claimed for itself .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: But again , they are out of luck .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: There has been no violence ,  as confirmed by journalists and noted by the High Commissioner on National Minorities of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe ,  and no trace ,  as confirmed by the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees ,  of the hundreds of thousands of refugees that were predicted .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Where have they gone ?
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Do not worry ;  they never existed .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Let this tragedy at least serve as a warning to all the parties .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Once the bullets have been shot ,  they strike indiscriminately and escape all control .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: We have reached such moment .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: It should still be possible to avoid the worst .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Finally , the draft resolution noted  that the planned Crimean referendum ,  scheduled for tomorrow ,  has no legal validity  and will have no legal effect on the status of Crimea .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: From the beginning of the crisis , the Russian position has been at odds not only with the law , but also with the facts .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russia claimed  that the rights of people inside Ukraine were under attack ,  but that claim had validity only in the parts of Ukraine where Russia and Russian military forces were exercising undue influence .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russia denied  that it was intervening militarily ,  but Russian troops have helped to surround and occupy public buildings , shut down airports , obstruct transit points and prevent the entry into Ukraine of international observers and human rights monitors .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russian leadership has disclaimed any intention  of trying to annex Crimea ,  then reversed itself and concocted a rationale for justifying just such an illegal act .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russia claims  that its intentions are peaceful ,  but Russian officials have shown little interest in United Nations , European and American efforts at diplomacy , including Secretary of State Kerry 's efforts yesterday in London .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russia has refused Ukraine 's outstretched hand  while , as we speak , Russian armed forces are massing across Ukraine 's eastern border .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Two days ago , in this very Chamber ,  Ukraine 's Prime Minister appealed  to Russia to embrace peace ( see S / PV.7134 ) .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Instead , Russia has rejected a draft resolution that had peace at its heart and law flowing through its veins .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We set out a number of other arguments in favour of the legality of the Crimean referendum at the Council meeting on 13 March ( see S / PV.7134 ) .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: In conclusion , we wish to confirm  that we will respect the will of the Crimean people during the referendum of 16 March .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: How should the problem be solved ?
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The answer is simple :   Russia has to implement the Geneva agreements .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: First , Russia should withdraw its army from Ukraine 's borders .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Secondly , it should make a high - level statement   calling on its prote'ges to free all hostages , to disarm and to vacate all seized administrative premises .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: It also has to condemn all terror and violence committed by those groups   and to disassociate itself from such activities .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Thirdly , it should stop its war - like rhetoric   and start to act in a constructive and civilized manner .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Last , but not least , Russia must refrain from any actions aimed at undermining the 25 May presidential elections in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Egypt is proposing  an amendment to paragraph 2 of the draft resolution ( 8/2016/235 ) that has been submitted to the Security Council .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: This is the paragraph that details the conditions  under which a contingent would be repatriated in the case of an allegation of sexual exploitation and abuse .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: The amendment consists of a slight modification to the language in the paragraph , to be put to a separate vote .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: The original language  proposed by the United States delegation  would allow taking arbitrary and unobjective decisions  amounting to collective punishment against hundreds ofpeacekeeping personnel .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: That would undoubtedly have severe and negative impacts on the morale of personnel  and tarnish the reputation of troop - contributing countries .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: Our proposed amendment is aimed at addressing that loophole in the draft resolution  by specifying the conditions that would have to be met  in order to take action with regard to an entire contingent .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: Those three conditions are :  a failure by the troop - contributing country to investigate allegations of sexual exploitation and abuse ;  a failure by the troop - contributing country to punish those guilty of sexual exploitation and abuse ;  and a failure by the troop - contributing country to inform the Secretary - General of the measures taken against those who commit acts of sexual exploitation and abuse .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: We reiterate the need  to safeguard due respect for Ukraine 's conduct of its internal affairs without interference  - whether military , political or economic 4 in matters under its jurisdiction .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: Argentina seeks to promote full respect by everyone for the principles of international law and human rights law as enshrined in the Charter of the United Nations .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: These are sad and difficult times .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: Argentina therefore calls for prudence .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: We will not join in using the language of geopolitical disputes .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: We will not join in a pointless blame game .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: This is a time for sorrow , reflection and an urgent search for the truth behind the incident to determine those responsible .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: May the victims rest in peace .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: Since the beginning ofthe Ukrainian crisis , Chad has consistently expressed its commitment to the territorial integrity and unity of Ukraine , in accordance with the Charter of the United Nations .
speaker: Mr. Cherif

sentence_text: The intangibility of borders and territorial integrity of States is a sacred principle  set forth in the Constitutive Act of the African Union .
speaker: Mr. Cherif

sentence_text: Chad 's vote in favour of the draft resolution contained in document S/2014/ 189 reflects that commitment .
speaker: Mr. Cherif

sentence_text: Chad takes note with great concern  the persistence of the escalation of the crisis in Ukraine ,  which is taking place despite the repeated appeals of the international community , and particularly the Security Council , for restraint and calm .
speaker: Mr. Cherif

sentence_text: We believe that it is still possible for the parties to open the way towards national reconciliation  and maintaining Ukraine 's unity  by engaging in inclusive dialogue among the various components with respect for diversity , human rights and in particular the rights of minorities .
speaker: Mr. Cherif

sentence_text: Chad reiterates its call  for respect for territorial integrity , the non - use of force and the peaceful settlement of disputes , in accordance with the Charter of the United Nations .
speaker: Mr. Cherif

sentence_text: Also , we would like to once again call  for calm and restraint .
speaker: Mr. Cherif

sentence_text: We believe  that the solution to the crisis can only be a political and negotiated one .
speaker: Mr. Cherif

sentence_text: I thank the President for convening today 's meeting .
speaker: Mr. Percaya

sentence_text: As a matter of priority ,  on behalf of the Government and the people of Indonesia ,  I wish to express our deepest condolences to all affected nations ,  especially our good neighbour Malaysia ,  over the deaths of the 298 civilian passengers and crew aboard Malaysia Airlines Flight MH-17 ,  which crashed yesterday  as it was flying over eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Percaya

sentence_text: As the Council may be aware ,  12 Indonesian citizens were confirmed among the deceased .
speaker: Mr. Percaya

sentence_text: Our thoughts and prayers are with the families of the victims .
speaker: Mr. Percaya

sentence_text: Allow me also to take this opportunity to sincerely thank the delegations that have expressed their sympathy and condolences to Indonesia .
speaker: Mr. Percaya

sentence_text: According to various sources and reports ,  the airplane was presumably shot down by a surface - to - air missile .
speaker: Mr. Percaya

sentence_text: If that is indeed the case , such a heinous act is tantamount to a grave violation of international law ,  in particular international humanitarian law .
speaker: Mr. Percaya

sentence_text: In that regard , Indonesia calls upon the Security Council to take immediate steps  to enable a thorough , transparent and independent international investigation to be conducted upon this horrendous incident .
speaker: Mr. Percaya

sentence_text: Indonesia stands ready to join and support such an investigation .
speaker: Mr. Percaya

sentence_text: If the investigation concludes that the crash was indeed intentionally caused by human factors ,  be it a missile strike or otherwise ,  Indonesia demands that the perpetrators of such a heinous and inhuman crime be brought to justice to the fullest extent of the law .
speaker: Mr. Percaya

sentence_text: As a precautionary measure , yesterday my President instructed all Indonesian airlines to exercise the utmost caution  and to avoid the airspace in and around conflict areas ,  including that of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Percaya

sentence_text: I thank you , Madam President , for this opportunity to speak before the Security Council .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I thank Council members for understanding the critical situation in Ukraine and for their support .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Before getting into the substance of my statement this evening ,  I would like start by mentioning that today Christians worldwide celebrate a great holiday , the day of the entry of our Lord into Jerusalem , Palm Sunday .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Unfortunately , today the celebration is falling under the shadow of aggression and bloodshed in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: On the eve of the holiday , terrorists coordinated by agents of the Russian Federation seized control of State buildings in several cities of the Donetsk region .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The current situation in Ukraine is highly complex and sensitive  and has regional and international repercussions .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: The international community should together engage in pushing through a political solution to the crisis in Ukraine  so as to truly maintain peace and stability in the region .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: What we are seeing Ukraine today is the result of a complex intertwinement of historical and contemporary factors .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: The situation in Ukraine ,  which seems to be accidental ,  has elements of the inevitable ,  and therefore calls for a comprehensive and balanced solution .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: China always respects the sovereignty and territorial integrity of all States .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: Those are long - standing and fundamental elements of China 's foreign policy .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: At the same time , we note that foreign interference is also a significant factor ,  giving rise to violent clashes on the streets of Ukraine  and resulting in the crisis in the country .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: The failure to implement the 21 February agreement has further exacerbated the turmoil in Ukraine , with serious social and economic consequences for the country .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: We condemn and oppose all extreme and violent acts .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: At the domestic level , let me highlight  the drafting process of our national action plan on women and peace and security .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: We are striving to elaborate an effective plan  to address the four pillars of the agenda : prevention , protection , participation , and peacebuilding and recovery .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: This will include  but will not be limited  to measures to increase the percentage of female peacekeepers ;  to foster the participation of women in all peace and security processes , including in our Foreign and Defence Ministries ;  to further improve relations between troops and civilians , particularly women and girls , in peacekeeping operations ;  and to fortify humanitarian assistance and technical cooperation initiatives on gender issues in conflict and post - conflict situations .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: Since the women and peace and security agenda is not solely a Government matter ,  we have established a broad - based working group comprising representatives not only of relevant ministries and the armed forces ,  but also of academia and civil society ,  to debate and draft our national action plan .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: In conclusion , let me reiterate Brazil 's firm commitment to both the promotion of peace in Africa and the crosscutting campaign on gender equality and women 's empowerment .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: We will continue to advance these inseparable agendas at all levels of the United Nations .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: Groups of provocateurs in the hundreds ,  supported by pro - Russian militias ,  are attacking buildings of Ukraine 's State institutions  and declaring independence from Ukraine ,  as well as announcing plans for new referendums on joining Russia ,  in spite of the fact that recent opinion polls clearly show  that the predominant majority of people in the region see their future inextricably linked to Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: In fact , about 65 per cent of the region 's residents ,  according to opinion polls ,  have expressed their desire to remain part of Ukraine ,  while only 18.2 per cent want to join Russia .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: The situation in Ukraine has rapidly unfolded .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: We are concerned that the rhetoric of , and pressure from , many actors have blinded us from carefully analysing the situation and understanding the root causes ,  thereby preventing us from finding a suitable solution  and , in the process , de - escalating the crisis .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: Why , then , did we vote in favour ?
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: The draft resolution contains important principles  on which we all agree : respect for the independence , sovereignty and territorial integrity of countries and the need for a de - escalation of the crisis .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: Most important to us is the fact that the draft text calls for a Ukrainian inclusive political dialogue .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: We believe  that the crisis in Ukraine can be settled primarily by a more vigorous campaign  geared towards winning the hearts of all Ukrainians  and ensuring the protection of all .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: To date , we have not seen such steps .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: There has not been intercommunal dialogue .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: It is time for Ukrainians to listen to their hearts .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: It is time to see statesmen on all sides helping their communities  to identify that silver thread that has kept them together as a united and prosperous nation for all these years .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: And yet , in defiance to the Budapest Memorandum ,  whereby the Russian Federation reaffirmed  its obligation to refrain from the threat or use of force against the territorial integrity or political independence of Ukraine ,  contrary to the Treaty on Friendship , Cooperation , and Partnership between Ukraine and the Russian Federation of 1997 ,  which affirms  that both countries agree to respect each other 's territorial integrity  and confirm the viability ofthe borders existing between them ,  and in violation of the obligations and commitments  undertaken by Russia during its accession to key regional and international organizations ,  Ukraine is about to be carved up .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: While the United Nations , the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe , the Council of Europe and individual world leaders have been trying hard in the past few weeks to get Russia to engage with Ukrainian authorities  in order to avoid a veritable crisis over Crimea ,  and while the Ukrainian authorities repeated their readiness  to accept international monitors and mediation efforts ,  Russian troops and equipment were being amassed in Crimea ,  accompanied by aggressive anti - Ukrainian propaganda and hurried anti - constitutional acts by the Crimean Parliament  to prepare the ground for an illegal referendum and eventual annexation of Crimea by Russia .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Tomorrow a farce of a referendum will be held , in flagrant violation of the Ukraine and Crimean Constitutions and international law .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: With regard to the Ukrainian crisis , international institutions have not risen to the occasion .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The reason lies with our Western partners .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Much has been said ,  but nothing has been done to resolve the situation .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: We are working hard in the OSCE .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: In the Security Council , the Russian delegation proposed three times the serious drafting of a resolution that would put an end to the violence in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: But Western colleagues responded to our proposals with blatant cynicism .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It seems that whatever the Ukrainian Government arbitrarily does is judged favourably ,  but the victims of the geopolitical ambitions of the Ukrainian regime are actually an entire nation - the people of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The punitive operation in eastern Ukraine must be stopped immediately .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Negotiating a resolution to the crisis is still possible ,  but the right choice must be made .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Today , however , we must urge the parties   to return to a constructive dialogue .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: The difficult situation facing Ukraine can not be resolved through unilateral actions of any sort .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: It is essential that we strictly abide by the principles of the Charter of the United Nations   and not intervene in matters under the domestic jurisdiction of States in any way , including military , political and economic .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: We have already said that ,   and we have not come here to repeat things .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: We have come to say   that it is understandable that the Council is meeting today .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: The other reason we are here is to reject violence involving two concrete events , namely , the attack against the Mayor of Kharkiv , in eastern Ukraine ,   and ,   as requested by the Secretary - General ,   Argentina calls   for the immediate and unconditional release of the military observers of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe   who are being held hostage .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: Again we reiterate   that the Council meets in order to promote peace .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: With a pen in hand and with our good faith , we stand ready to help Ukraine emerge from this difficult situation   so that it can achieve the peace that its people deserve .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: On behalf of the United States , I should like sincerely to thank those countries  that voted in favour of resolution 2272 ( 2016 ) ,  which was adopted today .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The resolution underscores  the Security Council 's responsibility  - our responsibility -  to address the scourge of sexual exploitation and abuse in United Nations peacekeeping ,  which has been allowed to persist for far too long .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Impunity for such abuses clearly undermines our efforts to promote international peace and security .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The resolution makes clear  that it is our job to ensure that there is accountability  when men , women and children are abused by the Blue Helmets whom the Council has sent to protect them .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The resolution signals the Security Council 's strong support  for the zero - tolerance policy of the United Nations  and for the ongoing efforts by the Secretary - General to strengthen this institution 's response , reporting and remedial measures  to prevent and combat sexual exploitation and abuse among United Nations peacekeepers .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The resolution underscores the fact  that peacekeepers found guilty  - not those accused ,  those found guilty -  of committing sexual exploitation and abuse  do not deserve to serve in United Nations peacekeeping missions ,  and sends a clear message to troop- and police - contributing countries that fail to take action to prevent or punish credible allegations of sexual abuse and exploitation ,  as well as to all States Members of the United Nations and to United Nations bodies ,  to ensure that these investigations are carried out thoroughly , promptly and impartially .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: I should like to take this opportunity to thank Angola for organizing this important debate , and Minister Delgado for presiding over it .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: We also thank the briefers for their insights .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: We have made significant progress in the 15 years since the Security Council adopted its landmark resolution 1325 ( 2000 ) on women and peace and security .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: The fundamental importance of addressing the impact of conflict on women and girls is now widely acknowledged .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: We have agreed frameworks in place .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: However , practical implementation lags behind , particularly with women 's participation in conflict prevention and resolution processes .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: Meaningful participation is the exception rather than the rule .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: That was evident at last week 's open debate on conflict prevention in the Great Lakes region ( see S / PV.7653 ) .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: Empirical evidence confirms  that the meaningful participation of women during all stages of conflict resolution contributes strongly to preventing escalation and sustaining peace .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: Including women works .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: Failure to include women in peace processes perpetuates inequality .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: It makes breaking the cycle of conflict more difficult .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: We know this ,  and yet we continue to hear arguments  that women 's participation is peripheral rather than essential .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: We hear cultural justifications for the exclusion of women from the negotiating table or mediation roles ,  and we are asked to delay women 's involvement until the reconciliation phase ,  often after an agreement has been reached .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: These outdated attitudes and approaches must be challenged .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: A thorough and independent international investigation ,  involving , among others , the International Civil Aviation Organization ,  must be conducted immediately .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: Whoever is responsible for the tragedy must be held fully accountable .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: If this incident turns out to have been caused by a deliberate attack ,  the Republic of Korea ,  itself a former victim of hostilities against a civilian airlines ,  believes that the international community should do everything in its power  to bring the perpetrators to justice as quickly as possible .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: No one should be allowed , for any reason , to get away with killing so many innocent people ,  who had nothing to do with what is happening on the ground .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: We support  the ongoing efforts to bring stability to Ukraine ,  in particular the efforts of the United Nations , the European Union , the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe and bilateral partners .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: Such efforts ,  aimed at de - escalating the violence in eastern Ukraine ,  should continue despite the daunting challenges .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: I would like to thank Mr. Jeffrey Feltman for his briefing on the latest events in Ukraine  and for expressing the constant willingness of the Secretary - General to contribute to peace and dialogue  The Government and the people of Argentina express their profound sadness , pain , solidarity and deepest condolences to the families of the victims of yesterday 's tragic Malaysia Airlines crash .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: We also express our condolences to the people and the Government of Ukraine and to the Governments and the peoples of the other countries whose citizens lost their lives .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: In particular , we ask  that our colleagues among the Permanent Representatives of the countries whose citizens were aboard that flight convey our condolences to the families ,  especially to those who saw the hopes for their children 's futures extinguished .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: The severity of this event clearly demands action .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: Like our colleagues , Argentina calls  for an impartial international investigation that objectively and unequivocally establishes what happened .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: Responsibility and the facts must be determined as soon as possible ,  and investigators must be granted immediate , unhindered access .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: Although it is not today 's topic ,  I should like to say  that ,  while there had been encouraging indications that the crisis in Ukraine was entering a phase of waning tension ,  fears that violent confrontation would continue have not dissipated .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: But the topic today does involve calling once again for the armed groups to cease their violence  and demanding that they halt unilateral actions and their violations and trampling of human rights ,  which do nothing but deepen the crisis and worsen the situation ,  especially for the civilian population and for the innocent .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: The Permanent Representative of the United States blamed Russia  for illegally pursuing its ambitions .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: That does not apply to us ;  it is a phrase taken from the foreign policy arsenal of the United States .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Ms. Power spoke of truth .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The world would be very interested to know  if Washington , DC , would in fact tell the truth about its role in the development of the crisis in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Finally , Ms. Power spoke  of dreams and aspirations .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: But why has she negated the right of the people of Crimea to express their will tomorrow during the referendum ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: To conclude , one of our colleagues said  that Kyiv had extended a hand to Moscow  and that we had refused to reciprocate .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: But the problem is not with Moscow ;  it has to do with the fact that Kyiv should have been the one to extend a hand to its people and regions ,  instead of intimidating them with repression and banning the use of the Russian language .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Why , for instance , was the constitutional assembly not convened ,  and in reality , in the course of the constitutional process , it was not proved that the ideology and practice of radical nationalism did not prevail in Kyiv ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It is unfortunate that much time has been lost .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Nevertheless , we would appeal to all to put an end to the confrontation  and to begin constructive cooperation with a view to a long - term settlement of the situation in Ukraine , in the interests of all of the people , including those in the eastern and south - eastern regions .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Russia has used its veto as an accomplice to unlawful military incursion .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: That very veto was given nearly 70 years ago to countries that had led an epic fight against aggression .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: But in so doing , Russia can not change the fact that moving forward in blatant defiance of the international rules of the road will have consequences ,  nor can it change Crimea 's status .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Crimea is part of Ukraine today .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: It will be part of Ukraine tomorrow .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: It will be part of Ukraine next week .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: It will be part of Ukraine  unless and until its status is changed in accordance with Ukrainian and international law .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russia prevented the adoption of a resolution today ,  but it can not change the aspirations and destiny of the Ukrainian people ,  and it can not deny the truth , displayed today , that there is overwhelming international opposition to its dangerous actions .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight MH - l7 in Ukrainian territory on 17 July has shocked the world .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: We have witnessed the tragic death of298 people .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: There were 28 Australians on board Flight MH-17 .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: Our nation is in mourning for all the victims .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: The news that the lives of 80 children were lost is devastating .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: Tomorrow , flags will be flown at half - mast across Australia .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: We extend our heartfelt sympathy and condolences to the families of all the victims of the tragedy and to their countries of nationality .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: Our particular thoughts are with the Governments and the people of the Netherlands and Malaysia .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: There is mounting evidence that the crash was caused by a missile strike  and that the aeroplane was brought down over territory not controlled by the Ukrainian authorities .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: There is increasing credible information that that was conducted by separatist militia groups ,  acting with the assistance of others .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: We owe it to the victims of this tragedy and their families  to unequivocally establish the facts behind the incident  and to find out exactly what happened and who is responsible .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: If ,  as appears increasingly likely ,  Flight MH-17 was brought down by a missile ,  then that is ,  as Australia 's Prime Minister Tony Abbott has said ,  " an unspeakable crime " ,   and the perpetrators must be brought swiftly to justice .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: I will be brief ,  but in response to my colleague from the Russian Federation ,  I would like to say just a few things .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: First , the United States has constantly called for de - escalation  and urged restraint .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: That has been our consistent policy .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Our consistent statements have made clear that military force is not the answer ,  and we have commended the Ukrainians , frankly ,  for enduring more than probably any country in the United Nations could or would endure without using force .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Therefore , there have been no shortage of efforts at diplomacy .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Secondly , it is not the United States that has escalated the situation ,  it is the Russian Federation .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Thirdly ,  while we would like to place our faith in talks with the Russian Federation , the European Union and Ukraine ,  it is hard to reconcile the behaviour of the Russian Federation , the propaganda of the Russian Federation and the military actions of the Russian Federation  - which range from the massing of 40,000 troops on the border to the subversive activities inside Ukraine -   with their appeal for diplomacy and de - escalation .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: It is an appeal that we wish were in fact sincere .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Today one again searches in vain to find truth in the Russian position on Crimea , on Ukraine or on the proposed Security Council resolution ( S/2014/189 )  considered and vetoed a few moments ago .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The truth is that the draft resolution should not have been controversial .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: It was grounded in principles  that provide the foundation for international stability and law ,  Article 2 of the Charter of the United Nations ,  the prohibition of the use of force to acquire territory and respect for the sovereignty , independence , unity and territorial integrity of Member States .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Those are principles that Russia agrees with and defends vigorously , all around the world ;  except , it seems , in circumstances that involve Russia .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The draft resolution broke no new legal or normative ground .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: It simply called  on all parties to do what they had previously pledged through internationally binding agreements to do .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: It recalled  specifically the 1975 Helsinki Final Act and the 1994 Budapest Memorandum ,  in which Russia and other signatories reaffirmed  their commitments themselves to respect Ukraine 's territorial integrity  and to refrain from aggressive military action toward that country .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The draft resolution called  on the Government of Ukraine  to do what it had promised it would do :  to protect the rights of all Ukrainians ,  including those belonging to minority groups .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Ultimately , however , supporting this effort requires more than just our money .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: When the Council visited Mali , Guinea Bissau and Senegal earlier this month ,  there was not a single female representative of the Council on the trip .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: And even at Headquarters in New York , only two of the 15 Security Council member countries are represented by a woman at this debate .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: Since we call upon Africa 's leaders to do more to bring women into conflict prevention and resolution ,  let us also heed the call ourselves .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: What signal does it send when the primary body for preserving international peace and security only has one woman among its 15 permanent representatives .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: What message does it send to that young girl in Somalia who dreams of becoming president ,  or to those who want to answer the question " What was your role ?
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: with something other than " survivor " ?
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: If we want half of the world 's population to have a say in conflict prevention and resolution ,  then let us begin in this building .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: That is why the United Kingdom has been clear  that we need as many credible women as possible to apply to be the next Secretary - General .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: We have had three so far and I hope that there are more to come .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: It is time to make history and bring about a historic moment that is long overdue .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: All things being equal , we hope  that this will be the year that we appoint a woman to be Secretary - General for the first time .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: When asked " What was your role ? "
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: ,  she will be able to say that she was at the forefront of the United Nations action to prevent conflict and resolve crisis and represent the entire world ,  notjust half of it .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: The international community must require the Maidan henchmen who seized power in Kyiv to cease their war against their own people  and to implement all the commitments under the 21 February agreement .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The Western sponsors of the Maidan henchmen ,  in particular those who stood as witnesses to the agreement and the United States ,  which is their backer ,  are obligated to end their support ,  dissociate themselves from neo - Nazis and other extremists ,  stop the use of force against the Ukrainian people ,  and begin forthwith a genuine national dialogue with the full participation of all regions , in the interests of the speedy implementation of radical constitutional reform .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It is the West that must determine the opportunity for avoiding civil war in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Some people ,  including in this Chamber ,  do not wish to recognize the real reasons for the events in Ukraine  and are forever seeing the hand of Moscow in the South - East .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Enough is enough .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: They must stop claiming  that we have deployed our army along the border with that country  and are practically already at the English Channel ,  and that we have sent agents to coordinate the protests in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It must be understood that south - eastern Ukraine and its people are deeply worried about their future  and that they do not want anyone ,  especially the nationalist radicals ,  to impose their will on them .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: This tragedy would not have been possible  if Russia had not supported the terrorists  and if a sophisticated anti - aircraft system had not been provided to them from Russia .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: On many occasions , the Ukrainian Mission to the United Nations has addressed the Security Council and all States Members of the United Nations  and has given them information about Russia 's support for the terrorists in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Only yesterday , we presented new evidence to United Nations - accredited media .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The huge supply of weapons of Russian origin being used by terrorists in Donbas ,  which has been documented by the Ukrainian intelligence agencies , the media and the general public ,  is no longer a secret to anyone .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: A large exhibition of confiscated modern weapons ,  seized by the Ukrainian military forces from terrorist groups ,  took place in Kyiv a few days ago .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: In most cases , the actual military units of the Russian armed forces are specified as the origin of those weapons .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The documentation can be accessed on the website of the Ukrainian Mission and from my press conference yesterday ,  which can be found on the United Nations website .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: In conclusion ,  as a member of the Association of Southeast Ansian Nations family ,  Indonesia reiterates its solidarity with the Government and the people of Malaysia , as well as with the countries whose citizens have fallen victim to this tragedy .
speaker: Mr. Percaya

sentence_text: With regard to armed forces , our armed forces are on Russian territory .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: American forces are hardly at home .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: They are in Australia , Lithuania , Poland and on the Black Sea ,   where an American vessel has remained longer than it was invited to do .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Yes , our troops do conduct training exercises .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: But they do so in a transparent manner   and while upholding all existing international agreements .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: We do not have any aggressive intentions towards Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: They Kyiv Government should keep a cool head   and not engage in reckless activities with respect to the people in the south - east of the country ,   where there are many Russian citizens as well .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I wish to thank you , Madam President , for convening this meeting .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: I also wish to thank Assistant Secretary - General Oscar Fernandez - Taranco for his briefing .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Lithuania is deeply concerned about the sharp deterioration of the situation in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: External forces and local provocateurs continue to fuel separatism and hatred ,  destabilizing the situation in eastern Ukraine on the eve of the 25 May elections .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: The scenario is dangerously familiar .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Where there was no unrest , unrest and chaos are being created by pro - Russian militias ,  again anonymous and without insignia ,  and again carrying modern models of assault weapons as seen in Crimea .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Again , considerable Russian troops are massed on Ukraine 's borders .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Again , the external anti - Ukranian and anti - Western propaganda machine is in full swing ,  inciting suspicion , mistrust and hatred waiting to explode .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Ukraine 's traitor Yanukovich ,  who abandoned his country and fled , opening the floodgates to Crimea 's annexation ,  is being pushed again into the daylight to clear the way for Ukraine 's further dismemberment .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: President Poroshenko has consistently backed up his words with actions .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: He proposed a comprehensive peace plan and declared a unilateral ceasefire ,  both of which were cynically rejected by the illegal armed groups and their backers in Moscow .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: President Poroshenko 's plan offered amnesty to separatists who voluntarily laid down their arms and who are not guilty of capital crimes .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: He committed  to providing a safe corridor for Russian fighters to return to Russia .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: He established a job - creation programme for the affected areas ,  made an offer of broad decentralization and dialogue with eastern regions , including the promise of early local elections ,  and granted increased local control over language , holidays and customs .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: President Poroshenko has also reached out to the regions of eastern Ukraine  and is pursuing constitutional reforms that will give local regions more authority to choose their regional leaders and protect locally spoken languages .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: He has said  that he will meet with separatists in any safe location , inside or outside Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Immediately after the crash , the military leader of the terrorists , Igor Girkin Strelkov ,  who is of Russian origin ,  boasting on social networks ,  commented on having shot down what he believed to be a Ukrainian jet ,  saying the following .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: " In Torez , Ukraine , an AN-26 has been shot down .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: It is lying somewhere near the Progress coal mine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: We have warned everyone not to fly in our skies " .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: To target and shoot down an aeroplane at an altitude of as high as 10 kilometres would be possible only by using a sophisticated anti - aircraft system , such as the SA - ll Buk missile system , or a similar system .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: It has been affirmed both by the radio interception of terrorist leaders and by photographs and video - recordings obtained from citizens of cities in the area ,  that the terrorists have at least two SA - ll Buk missile systems .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The question is , where did they get those sophisticated anti - defence systems ?
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I reiterate that radio interceptions , photographs and the confessions of detained terrorists ,  including two recently detained Russian citizens who were going to join the terrorists as military experts ,  state  that the Buk system came from Russia .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: All that and other evidence and information will be provided to the international investigation .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Well , no .  Force can not override the law .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: That would be too serious and too dangerous for every Member State .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Our duty is to raise the fragile barrier of law against the brutal nature of international relations ,  which has led us into two world wars  and has cost , as of this very moment , thousands of innocent lives in Syria and elsewhere .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: To accept the annexation of Crimea would be to give up everything that we are trying to build in this Organization .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: It would make a mockery of the Charter of the United Nations .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: It would once again make the sword the supreme arbiter of disputes .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: The vast majority of Member States will prove ,  by their refusal to recognize the annexation of the Crimea ,  that they know  that the territorial integrity of one of them is the guarantor of the territorial integrity of all .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: There are minorities all over the world .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: What would become of us  if they became the pretext for any kind of adventure  to be undertaken by an ambitious and enterprising neighbour ?
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: What will be the next Crimea ?
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: The annexation goes beyond Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: It affects us all .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: In the first instance , the special monitoring mission the of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe should act as a first responder ,  thereby laying the foundation for efforts by other international organizations and individual nations ,  including those whose citizens were victims of the tragedy .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Yesterday ,  President Obama assured Ukraine 's President Poroshenko  that United States experts would offer all possible assistance upon his request .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: President Poroshenko has invited the independent and credible International Civil Aviation Organization  to join an investigation .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: International investigators must be granted immediate ,  full and unfettered access to the crash site .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: All those concerned  - Russia , pro - Russian separatists and Ukraine -  should agree to support an immediate ceasefire  to facilitate access by international investigators .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: In that regard , we look to the monitoring misson also to reach agreement with separatists and others in the region  to make that possible .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: All evidence must remain undisturbed  and any evidence removed from the site by the Russian - backed separatists operating in the area should be promptly returned and handed over .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russia needs to help make that happen .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: International law provides for a State 's timely ability to close off areas deemed dangerous for flights .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It would seem that an investigation is necessary not only of the disaster ,  but also of the extent to which Ukrainian aviation authorities carried out their obligations to exercise the relevant law  and did everything necessary  to ensure that Kyiv 's military campaign prevented disasters .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Today Kyiv announced  the full closure of its airspace  to conduct a so - called anti - terrorist operation .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Why could that not have been done earlier ,  instead of waiting for there to be hundreds of victims ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: During our previous meeting on Ukraine ( see S / PV.7205 ) , some Western members of the Council talked about the restraint exercised by the Kyiv authorities in using force .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: They have fully demonstrated that " restraint " now .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: There have been indiscriminate air strikes , rocket fire and attacks by artillery tanks in Donetsk and Luhansk .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: This punitive operation is becoming increasingly destructive for the civilian population and infrastructure .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Dozens of civilians have been killed , including children .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Transport systems , community facilities and medical centres have been destroyed .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: When one lays out the facts ,   they cut through the fiction of Russian propaganda .
