country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Having illegally annexed Crimea ,   Russia is now destabilizing southern and eastern Ukraine as part of its plan   to undermine the ability of the people of Ukraine to determine peacefully their own future .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: In doing so ,   it is threatening international peace and security .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: But the doors of diplomacy remain open .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: We urge Russia   to abandon the dangerous course it is pursuing   and to take urgent steps to implement the Geneva agreement .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: In the extremely difficult circumstances which now confront it ,   the Ukrainian Government is striving to take forward a programme   of democratization and inclusive constitutional and economic reform   that aims to correct the long period of misgovernment and corruption that preceded it .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: It is in all our interests to support this process .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: This is not about zero - sum game politics ;   it is about restoring stability to Ukraine and to the wider region   and allowing all the people of Ukraine to determine their own future .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: We urge Russia   to become part of this collective international effort .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: We call on Russia   to continue to use all of its influence on the pro - Russian separatists   to encourage them to release unconditionally and promptly the seven inspectors from OSCE participating States that they have been holding hostage in Sloviansk for the past four days , as well as the Ukrainian personnel accompanying them .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: We also condemn   the restrictions on media freedom and on the freedom of expression .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The detention and intimidation of journalists have increased over the past two weeks in the east of the country .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The day before yesterday , pro - Russian separatists took control of the regional public television station in Donetsk .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The OSCE Representative on Freedom of the Media , Ms. Dunja Mijatovie , has repeatedly warned   against misinformation and propaganda .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: I would like to join her appeal   and highlight   that any limitations on the freedom of the press is unacceptable .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Nothing can take the place of direct , substantive dialogue between Kyiv and Moscow   to find a diplomatic solution to the Ukraine crisis .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The crisis continues to worsen .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: It will have harmful consequences for the entire region , Europe and beyond .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The Geneva declaration of 17 April can not remain a dead letter .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The alternative to dialogue and to de - escalation would have incalculable consequences for international peace and security .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: I would like to thank Mr. Feltman for his update on the difficult situation in Ukraine .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: I am wondering ,   and I would also like to ask the Council ,   why we are having this meeting .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: Going over the difficult situation and the worsening of the crisis once again is undoubtedly one reason ,   although I know there are clear , decisive reasons behind the initiative of the United Kingdom to convene this meeting that brings us all together .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: I also ask myself another question ,   not out of false piety   but out of sincerity .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: It is the question Pope Francis asked a few days ago when he received Mr. Yatsenyuk   - who has not sped up hatred and violence -   and gave him a pen with which he might sign a peace .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: Are we acting in the Council to help overcome misunderstandings ?
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: I am certain   that we are .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: It is for that reason that today my country will merely reaffirm two convictions .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: That is , that in the dialogue of constructive diplomacy that was initiated on 17 April with a view to finding a peaceful and political solution to this critical situation ,   Russia , the United States , the European Union and Ukraine all expressed at Geneva   a willingness to reach an agreement .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: What we saw as willingness to agree ,   the whole world saw as a source of hope .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: I thank you for convening this meeting , Madam President , and for the opportunity to address the Security Council .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I would also like to thank Under - Secretary - General Feltman for his briefing , and all the members of the Council for their statement .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: It has been a month since Russia illegally occupied and annexed Crimea ,   using its military forces   and brutally violating international law .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Unfortunately , Russia has not stopped there ,   and apparently its leaders are now targeting other parts of Ukraine   and brazenly interfering in its internal affairs .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The agreements reached at the Geneva meeting of the Foreign Ministers of Ukraine , the Russian Federation , the United States and the European Union on 17 April provided a faint beam of hope for a diplomatic solution .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: In order to implement the Geneva statement for the de - escalation of the situation in the eastern regions of Ukraine ,   the Government of Ukraine immediately took the necessary practical steps .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Within just one week , the Government suspended the active phase of its anti - terrorist operation ,   whose main objective was the restoration of law and order and the protection of civilians .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: It initiated constitutional reform .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: It approved the concept of local administrative reform ,   whose main principles are decentralizing power in the country ,   significantly empowering local communities and   improving management at the regional and district levels .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: A draft law on amnesty for participants in the uprisings in the eastern regions has been prepared   and would apply to those protesters who surrender their weapons and evacuate illegally seized administrative buildings ,   except for those suspected of committing serious crimes .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The parliamentary coalition has invited all political parties represented in the Ukrainian Parliament   to sign a memorandum of understanding on ways to resolve the situation in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The Minister of Internal Affairs and Security Services has continued implementing a nationwide campaign to seize illegal arms from the population ,   and more than 6,000 weapons have been handed over recently .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Ukraine is demonstrating its commitment to constructive cooperation with human - rights institutions and international organizations .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: We welcome  the efforts made in that regard by France , Germany and the OSCE to promote dialogue between Russia and Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: We sincerely hope  that those efforts will contribute to a de - escalation  and put an end to a crisis that has gone on for too long .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Yesterday 's plane crash demonstrated the incalculable consequences that the crisis can have .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: It is high time for all stakeholders ,  including the Russian Federation ,  to mobilize all energies to put an end to this crisis .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: There must be a full , thorough and impartial international investigation .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: We thank Under - Secretary - General Feltman for his message  that the United Nations is fully prepared to cooperate with any investigation  and that the International Civil Aviation Organization ( ICAO ) has offered its investigative capacity .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: We also welcome Mr. Feltman 's information  that ICAO and the Government of Ukraine are communicating on the issue of an investigation .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: There must be immediate preservation of the crash site ,  and unfettered access for independent investigators .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: Safe access must also be provided  to allow fro the recovery of the bodies of those who lost their lives in the tragedy .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: Undertakings brokered by the trilateral contact group with armed separatists who control the territory in which the crash occurred to allow access must be upheld .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: Our Prime Minister has made it clear  that Russia 's full cooperation with all investigations is expected .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: The Council has just issued a press statement calling for investigation , accountability and immediate access to the crash site .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: That is welcome ,  but Australia believes ,  given the gravity of the incident ,  that it is not a sufficient indication of the Council 's resolve .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: Australia believes  the Council should adopt a draft resolution  that emphasizes the need for access to be granted to the crash site  and for a full , thorough , independent and international investigation to be carried out .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: The human stakes of what is happening in Ukraine are extremely high .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The lives of innocent civilians are at risk ,  yet we are being bombarded by Russian disinformation and propaganda ,  while the Ukrainians are being confronted by incitement and violence .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russian media and Government spokespersons are spreading fiction ,  so we must tonight focus on facts .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The Council has heard , these last weeks , Russia disclaim  any intention of occupying or invading .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The Council has heard it publicly ,  and we have heard it privately .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Unfortunately , the fact is that the armed seizure of buildings in six eastern Ukrainian towns yesterday , and several more today , mirrors the tactics Russian forces used in the early stages of the Crimea invasion .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Then , too , officials from the Russian Federation spoke early  on in the crisis  and disclaimed  any intention of occupying or invading .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: In the earlier Crimean case , highly organized , well - equipped and professional forces wearing Russian military uniforms and military gear without identifying insignia moved in first to take control of Crimean Government and security facilities ,  before being later replaced by regular Russian military forces .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Then , too , Russia said  it was acting to protect minorities ' rights .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: But the whole world now knows  that they were not .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: As the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe has reported ,  the minorities at risk in Crimea are Tatars and Ukrainians .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We have heard Russia 's statement about the crisis taking place in eastern Ukraine ,  but what we are actually witnessing is Violence and destabilization  in an effort to manufacture a sense of crisis and separatism .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Ukraine 's response to those provocations has been one of restraint under intolerable threats to its stability and independence .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: There is no evidence of actions directed at Russian speakers in eastern Ukraine that could possibly justify an intervention by Russia .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Nor is there the generalized anarchy claimed .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The ongoing work of the special mission of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe is all the more important for providing an objective account of the situation in eastern Ukraine ,  and we welcome the information that the number of monitors will be significantly increased in coming days .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: International condemnation of Russia 's actions against Ukraine in the past six weeks has been resounding .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: General Assembly resolution 68/262 unambiguously condemned  the threat and use of force in this manner as contrary to the Charter of the United Nations and to Russia 's specific treaty obligations to Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Many countries , including my own , have imposed unilateral sanctions to register the depth of their concern .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Repeated calls for de - escalation have been ignored .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: We meet today in the most tragic of circumstances .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Yesterday , Malaysia Airlines passenger flight MH - l7 appears to have been shot down over eastern Ukraine ,  killing all passengers and crew .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Our deepest , most heartfelt condolences go to the families of the victims and to the people and Governments of those countries affected .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: In the United Kingdom , we are mourning the loss of at least nine British citizens who were passengers on the flight .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: This is a dark moment for the international community .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: The senseless violence  unleashed by armed separatists in eastern Ukraine  has reached monstrous proportions .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: The precise circumstances and causes of this tragic event must be established quickly and beyond any doubt .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: As the Council has affirmed this morning ,  that will require a full , thorough and independent international investigation , in accordance with international civil aviation guidelines .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: The International Civil Aviation Organization ,  which provides the international legal framework for the investigation of air accidents ,  should have a central role to play  in ensuring that there is credible and independent international involvement .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Let me thank the Nigerian presidency for convening this open meeting ,   which does not cease to surprise us ,   judging by some of the statements we have heard .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: I might refer to some of the comments by our colleague from the Russian Federation .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: I would also like to thank Under Secretary - General Jeffrey Feltman for his briefing .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: As so many of us have said here , the international community had placed high hopes on international mediation and monitoring efforts and on the 17 April Geneva statement on Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: But ,   as we know today ,   the Geneva statement is just another document to be signed and discarded by Russia ,   adding to the growing list of breaches of Russia 's international commitments , such as the Helsinki Final Act , the 1991 Almaty Declaration , the Budapest Memorandum of 1994 , the Treaty of Friendship and Cooperation between Russia and Ukraine of l997 and the Charter of the United Nations itself .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Despite growing provocations , the Ukrainian authorities have taken a number of concrete steps   to follow up on the Geneva statement .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Barricades in Maidan Square are being dismantled .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: I recall my French colleague referring a number of times to the Internet and Google .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Users of those will see that there is a significant difference in terms of what is happening on the streets of Kyiv .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: As I said ,   barricades are being dismantled .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: The Kiyv city administration building has re - opened , as has the main thoroughfare of the city , Khreschatik .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: The draft resolution ( S/2014 / l89 ) was designed to prevent a further escalation of the crisis in Ukraine .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: It invited Council members to uphold the sovereignty , unity and territorial integrity of a United Nations State Member  and to reaffirm core United Nations principles .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: It was about sending a clear signal  that holding a referendum in Crimea would take us further away from a diplomatic solution .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: The resounding message from today 's vote is that Russia stands isolated in the Council and in the international community .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Russia alone backs the referendum .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Russia alone is prepared to violate international law , disregard the Charter of the United Nations and tear up its bilateral treaties .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: That message will be heard well beyond the walls of the Chamber .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: The position of the international community is clear .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: If the referendum is held tomorrow ,  it will have no validity , no credibility and no recognition .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: We trust that Russia will take notice of its isolation .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: On Thursday , we heard a clear message from the Prime Minister of Ukraine  that Ukraine was willing to engage in dialogue with Russia to address its stated concerns ( see S /PV.7134 ) .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: The ball is now firmly in Russia 's court .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: If Russia fails to respond to Ukraine 's outstretched hand  and instead continues with its military adventurism  or seeks to take advantage of the illegal referendum ,  it will lead to further escalation of tension in the region and further consequences for Russia .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: We ask Russia  to hear the collective voice of the international community today  to rethink its actions  and to take the decision to work with Ukraine and with the rest of the world to find a peaceful solution .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: We are at a turning point .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: With every moment that passes , the risk of anarchy and bloody incidents grows .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: That is why we call on the Russian authorities   to choose the path of de - escalation through the immediate demonstration of respect for the commitments made in the Geneva declaration .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Yesterday ,   together with our European Union partners and the United States ,   we adopted new targeted sanctions .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: If the situation worsens ,   we will be forced to ratchet up the sanctions once again .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: That is not what we would prefer .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Our goal is to ensure the holding on 25 May of free , inclusive and transparent presidential elections ,   whose good conduct will be guaranteed by the presence of international observers .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: The possibility   that the actions of some violent groups could threaten the holding of this democratic exercise   is unacceptable .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: We also support constitutional reform   that would ensure respect for minorities and some decentralization .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: It is up to all Ukrainians to decide their future .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Then history and geography can bring about an inevitable and desirable reconciliation between a democratic , peaceful and independent Ukraine and a Russian Federation   that will renounce its dangerous nationalist illusions .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: On the other hand , the Russian side has complied with none of the 17 April commitments .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: There has been no condemnation of the separatist actions   that have spawned new violence   and no call for public buildings to be evacuated .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: There has been no appeal to the pro - Russian militants   to exercise restraint and end their attacks on munitions depots and on their compatriots ,   some of whom are said to have been tortured ,   and on journalists as well .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Far from condemning those who took the OSCE observers hostage ,   today Russia is calling the mission 's presence in eastern Ukraine a provocation .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: However , we sincerely hope   that the announcement yesterday of a halt to the Russian military manoeuvres on the Ukrainian border is true   and will be the first step in a genuine de - escalation .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Unfortunately , today peacekeeping operations account for 70 per cent of the allegations of sexual abuse within the United Nations system .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: At a time when the Secretary - General is undertaking determined action ,  the Council 's support is indispensable .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Let us recall once again  that sexual abuse is unacceptable ,  regardless of the perpetrator or source of these actions - military , police , civilian personnel , United Nations or non - United Nations .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: The colour of the helmet or uniform means little to the victims .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: The resolution allows us to send a clear message to all Blue Helmets , police , civilian personnel and international forces .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: We must do our utmost to translate into reality the zero - tolerance objective ,  which must serve more than ever before as our compass and our shared obligation .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: We would like to thank Assistant Secretary - General Oscar Fernandez - Taranco for his briefing and welcome the convening of this meeting at this critical time for Ukraine and the region .
speaker: Mr. Llanos

sentence_text: We face a sensitive development in the crisis in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Llanos

sentence_text: Chile regrets the outbreaks of violence  seen in the eastern regions , specifically in Donetsk , Luhansk and Kharkiv ,  and expresses its deep concern over the serious consequences of the escalation of the crisis  owing to the actions of separatist groups .
speaker: Mr. Llanos

sentence_text: It is critical that the parties exercise the maximum restraint in order to contain the crisis .
speaker: Mr. Llanos

sentence_text: Our country once again reiterates the need to respect the sovereignty , independence and territorial integrity of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Llanos

sentence_text: We also reaffirm the obligation incumbent on Members of the United Nations to refrain from resorting to the threat of or use of force against the territorial integrity and political independence of any State .
speaker: Mr. Llanos

sentence_text: It is urgent that all parties involved refrain from undertaking actions that are contrary to the provisions of the Charter of the United Nations and the international agreements and treaties to which Ukraine is a party .
speaker: Mr. Llanos

sentence_text: We once again call on the parties to seek a peaceful solution to the crisis through direct political dialogue ,  to refrain from taking unilateral measures  and to support international mediation initiatives , in accordance with General Assembly resolution 68/262 .
speaker: Mr. Llanos

sentence_text: That process must be inclusive  and must ensure the rule of law , human rights , fundamental freedoms and full respect for the rights of minorities .
speaker: Mr. Llanos

sentence_text: In that context , the role of the Security Council , the Secretary - General , his Special Envoy and regional organizations continues to be fundamental .
speaker: Mr. Llanos

sentence_text: by merely inserting a very simple word  - one of the most often - used words in the English language , " and " -  the amendment  proposed by Egypt  stipulates  that all three conditions must be met prior to triggering that provision .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: For example , under the Egyptian provision , if a country merely sends a letter to the Secretary - General ,  after receiving an allegation or allegations ,  that it has chosen not to investigate ,  giving no reason ,  but informing the Secretary - General according to that provision ,  and if it does nothing else ,  it would be in compliance with the draft resolution  as amended by Egypt .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: That would be enough .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: If a Member State investigated and determined  that an individual committed an act of sexual abuse and exploitation  but does not hold the perpetrator accountable ,  it would actually be in compliance with the draft resolution  as Egypt would have it amended .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: I certainly do not want to prolong our meeting here this evening .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The simplest of answers would be to again read the statement I made earlier ,   which refletcts our vision and position .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: However , allow me a very brief comment .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: A great deal has been said here about some sort of wrong interpretation of our positions and statements in various forums and situations .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Our Ukrainian colleague even began to depict some fantastic scenario of how he views the further developments unfolding in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The only scenario that I would want to hear   - but do not -   is one that includes genuine efforts by the authorities in Kyiv to implement the Geneva document .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Mr. Feltman began by saying   that there were various interpretation of that document .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The document is so simple ,   there is nothing to interpret .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: There is nothing to be done   but to implement it .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Let us do so .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Russia helped to draw it up .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: But the actions backing it up need to be taken , first and foremost , by the authorities in Kyiv ,   if that is what they are .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Unfortunately , their lack of action is reflected in the statement I made here earlier today .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Russia 's aggressive stance is a clear threat to the sovereignty , independence and territorial integrity of Ukraine .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: The United Kingdom calls on Russia immediately to redeploy its troops away from the border ,  cease all activity designed to heighten tensions  and sow discord ,  and revoke the mandate given by the Federation Council on 1 March to use military force on Ukrainian soil .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: The Russian Federation has made little secret of its efforts to undermine the process of reconciliation in Ukraine .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Rather than assisting its neighbours in rebuilding their country after the fall of a deeply corrupt regime that left the nation on the verge of bankruptcy ,  Russia has instead sought to destabilize the country further in pursuit of its narrow interests .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Russia must desist from those steps  and address whatever grievances it has through dialogue ,  starting with the contact group talks scheduled for this coming week .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: The international community is not fooled by the Kremlin 's use of propaganda and misinformation to spread fears among the population of eastern Ukraine .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Contrary to Russian claims ,  the recent demonstrations in eastern cities are not organic .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: They do not enjoy widespread support ,  and the numbers of genuine protestors on the streets pale in comparison to the crowds of hundreds of thousands who protested against the former regime .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Rather , what we are witnessing is a well - orchestrated campaign designed to destabilize the country .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: If Russia really has genuine concerns about Ukraine 's Russian - speaking population ,  then its actions have done nothing to safeguard their interests .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: The illegal annexation of Crimea ,  stoking tensions and provoking violence in eastern Ukraine ,  hurt and endanger all the people of Ukraine .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: In Geneva , there was agreement that there should be amnesty for protestors .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: However , instead of that , the People 's Governor of Donetsk , Pavel Gubarev ,   who never had weapons in his hand ,   remains in prison .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: He is a political prisoner ,   arrested just because   he called   for a referendum on the federalization of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The monitors of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe ( OSCE ) confirm   that he was tortured   and that he is now engaged in an indefinite hunger strike .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Mr. Gubarev is far from being the only political prisoner of the Kyiv regime .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: One can speak of widespread witch hunts   for those who have dared to express their disagreement with the Government in the Maidan .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: According to our sources ,   in the Donetsk region there are already about 10 cases of politically motivated kidnappings of people who were later transported to Kyiv by the special services .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Japan voted in favour of resolution 2272 ( 2016 ) ,  proposed by the United States .
speaker: Mr. Yoshikawa

sentence_text: Since we spoke on our views on sexual exploitation and abuse in the Chamber yesterday ( see S / PV.7642 ) ,  I wish to emphasize only one point ,  which is why  we think  that this resolution is important and necessary .
speaker: Mr. Yoshikawa

sentence_text: Japan supports the Secretary - General 's decision  to repatriate contingents  when there is a demonstrated pattern of misconduct .
speaker: Mr. Yoshikawa

sentence_text: That measure is aimed not at pointing a finger at contingents ,  but at protecting civilians  where peacekeepers are deployed .
speaker: Mr. Yoshikawa

sentence_text: Its purpose is also to urge troop- and police - contributing countries to take action .
speaker: Mr. Yoshikawa

sentence_text: We need to realize  that investigating allegations of sexual exploitation and abuse is the primary responsibility oftroop- and police - contributing countries ,  and they have to take appropriate actions against the allegations  and hold personnel accountable for sexual exploitation and abuse .
speaker: Mr. Yoshikawa

sentence_text: Russia backed the adoption of resolution 2272 ( 2016 ) , on sexual exploitation and abuse in peacekeeping operations .
speaker: Mr. Iliichev

sentence_text: We approached with understanding the initiative of the United States and other States ' delegations  to send a signal through the Security Council regarding the unacceptability of such actions .
speaker: Mr. Iliichev

sentence_text: We decisively condemn  such crimes  and deem it necessary to strengthen peacekeepers ' responsibility for sexual exploitation and abuse .
speaker: Mr. Iliichev

sentence_text: During the course of intensive negotiations , we were able to craft a text that expanded preventive measures and the fight against this phenomenon ,  not only to the United Nations but also other missions deployed with Security Council consent .
speaker: Mr. Iliichev

sentence_text: However , we believe it is important to underscore once again  that we can not accept attempts to exclude national peacekeeping contingents  enjoying the Security Council 's mandate from responsibility for the commission of sexual exploitation and abuse .
speaker: Mr. Iliichev

sentence_text: This is all the more true  as recently there has been a significant number of cases  that clearly point to the fact  that such crimes were committed byjust such contingents of foreign missions .
speaker: Mr. Iliichev

sentence_text: Seventh , Egypt is about to adopt a strategy on gender equality ,  and we very much welcome the statement made by Ambassador Macharia Kamau earlier ,  since the strategy to be adopted by the Special Committee on Peacekeeping Operations can be an excellent starting point for bolstering the participation of women in conflict prevention and resolution ,  particularly in terms of action at the regional level .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: Egypt attaches great importance to issues affecting the role of women in conflict prevention and resolution .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: We are devoting major efforts at the national level  to improve the status and empowerment of women .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: We have supported  the substance of resolution 1325 ( 2000 ) since its adoption .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: That resolution is an important milestone  with regard to the status of women and their participation in the resolution of conflicts .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: Egypt was one of the first countries to adhere to resolution 2242 ( 2015 ) this past October .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: The national council responsible for the status of women in Egypt has fine - tuned a national plan of action based on resolution 1325 ( 2000 ) .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: Egypt thus became one of 17 African countries to have a national plan of action of that kind .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: Egypt has also organized a number of events concerning this issue since the adoption of resolution 1325 ( 2000 ) 15 years ago .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: We attribute great importance to capacity - building .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: The regional centre in Cairo  responsible for specialized training in peacekeeping in Africa  has held seven training workshops and two training workshops for trainers .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: The main topic ofthose workshops was the social dimension of peacekeeping and peacebuilding in implementing resolution 1325 ( 2000 ) between 2013 and 2015 .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: Five other workshops are due to be held in June .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: Egypt is fully committed to this process  and to implementating the plan of action ,  and takes part in all relevant regional and international forums .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: China 's position on the question of Ukraine remains objective , impartial and responsible .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi

sentence_text: From the very beginning , China has called on all parties   to seek a political solution through dialogue rather than confrontation ,   and we support international mediation efforts conducive to de - escalating the situation and seeking a political solution .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi

sentence_text: China will continue to play a constructive role in mediation efforts and pushing for talks .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi

sentence_text: On 17 April in Geneva , agreement was reached that all sides should refrain from any types of violence , intimidation or provocation .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: However , in just a matter of days , there was a resumption of the so - called counter - terrorist ,   but actually punitive , operations - out and out violations of that agreement .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: In the south - east , there was a deployment of roughly 15,000 military personnel , tanks , armed vehicles , artillery , aircraft and subdivisions of Right Sector Banderists .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: As the first attempts to bring military pressure to bear on the south - east led to the defection of some Ukrainian military to the side of the protesters ,   today the sub - units are staffed by those from the west of the country .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: One might wonder what political and psychological effect that has had on the south - east   and how it ties in with the task of ensuring the territorial integrity of the country .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: In Geneva , it seemed that there was a window of opportunity for a significant de - escalation of the situation in Ukraine at the beginning of broad national dialogue .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: However ,   almost immediately following the declarations and actions of the Kyiv Government authorities ,   it became clear that they had no intention of implementing the agreement ,   just as they did not intend to implement the agreement of 21 February .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: In both cases , that treachery led to bloodshed .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Unfortunately , it is difficulty to speak of confidence in the current coalition in Kyiv   when the defence and law - enforcement agencies are essentially controlled by the Svoboda Party ,   whose political platform is based on declarations issued by Nazi collaborators in June 1941 .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Pursuant to those declarations ,   real Ukrainians should have collaborated with Hitler   to establish a new order in Europe .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I would recall   that the collaborators and the followers of Bandera killed not only Jews , Poles and Soviet soldiers but also Ukrainians who refused to subscribe to their sloganeering .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I join others in thanking Assistant Secretary - General for Political Affairs Jeffrey Feltman for his briefing on the developments concerning Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: We share his assessment   that the situation in eastern Ukraine is deteriorating alarmingly , especially in Kharkiv , Luhansk and in the Donetsk area .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: We are deeply concerned   by the actions of the pro - Russian separatist militias backed by Russia ,   aimed at destabilizing eastern Ukraine and , it seems , preventing the holding of the presidential elections on 25 May .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: These destabilizing actions have intensified again in recent days ,   with the proliferation of the illegal occupation of public buildings , an increasing number of attacks against the Ukrainian security forces and an increase in violence against the local population .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: As others have already mentioned ,   just yesterday peaceful demonstrators in favour of the unity of the Ukraine were violently attacked by armed pro - Russian gangs armed with clubs and baseball bats in the city of Donetsk .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Today hundreds of pro - Russian demonstrators seized the building of the regional administration and the prosecutor 's office in the city of Luhansk , and stormed the police station .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: We condemn   those actions and the attacks targeting political figures in the strongest terms .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The torture and murder of the Horlivka city councillor , Volodymyr Rybak ,   whose remains were found last week near Sloviansk together with those of a young student from Kyiv , Yuriy Popravko ,   attest to the high level of violence .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Yesterday , the mayor of Kharkiv , Henadiy Kernes , was the target of an assassination attempt   - there are differing interpretations with regard to the party responsible .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: These crimes must be investigated   and everything possible must be done to prevent similar cases in the future .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: While it make take us some time to firmly establish who shot down a plane filled with innocents ,  most Council members and most members of the international community have been warning for months about the devastation that would come  if Russia did not stop what it started  - if it did not reign in what it unleashed .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The context for yesterday 's horror is clear :  separatist forces backed by the Russian Government continue to destabilize Ukraine  and undermine the efforts of Ukraine 's elected leaders to build a democratic Ukraine that is stable , unified , secure and able to determine its own future .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russia says  that it seeks peace in Ukraine ,  but we have repeatedly provided the Council with evidence of Russia 's continued support to the separatists .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Time after time , we have called on the Russian Government to de - escalate the situation  by stopping the flow of fighters and weapons into Ukraine ,  pressing separatists to agree to a ceasefire  and release all hostages ,  and support a road map for negotiations .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Time after time , President Putin has committed  to working towards dialogue and peace  - in Geneva in April , in Normandy in June and in Berlin earlier this month -  and every single time he has broken that commitment .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: I will list some facts .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Three Ukrainian law - enforcement officers were abducted , brutally beaten , tortured and later presented to the Russian media as Ukrainian spies ,   blindfolded and with their hands tied .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Ukrainian and foreign journalists are being systematically kidnapped ,   while Russian journalists are allowed to operate in the areas controlled by the illegal armed groups .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: A military helicopter was destroyed with a man - portable air defence ( MANPAD ) guided missile .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: It should be understood that peaceful protesters can not buy MANPADs in shops .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Representatives of the military verification mission of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe ( OSCE ) were taken hostage in Sloviansk .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The detention by force of international observers is yet another testament to the criminal and terrorist nature of the separatist armed groups .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: In contrast to the demand voiced in many of the statements in the Council today   that those hostages be released ,   the Russian Federation ,   as might be expected ,   made no such demand ;   nor have its leaders in Moscow .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: What is important is that the leaders of the illegal armed groups have publicly admitted responsibility for all the aforementioned crimes * even on television .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Many members of the illegal militant groups are citizens of the Russian Federation ,   and they are not even trying to hide it ,   publicly displaying their identification .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: We recently read an article in The New York Times   in which the Kuban Cossack Mozhaev declared his presence and that of an armed group from his region ,   which we had noticed in Crimea as well .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Let me congratulate  Angola on having organized this debate under the guidance of its Minister for Family and the Promotion of Women , Ms. Maria Filomena Delgado .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: I also thank  the Executive Director of the United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women , the Assistant Secretary - General for Political Affairs , the Chair of the Peacebuilding Commission , the Permanent Observer of the African Union and Ms. Palegi Ayang for their presentations .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: Today 's debate provides a timely opportunity to reflect on the results of the high - level review of the implementation of resolution 1325 ( 2000 ) ,  and to focus on the needs and perspectives of Africa .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: Brazil took note with satisfaction  of the recommendations of the global study on the implementation of resolution 1325 ( 2000 )  and , in particular , its emphasis on prevention and the need to avoid the militarization of the women and peace and security agenda .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: As highlighted by the global study ,  increasing recognition of women 's participation and empowerment is an end in itself  and should not be part of counterterrorism strategies or efforts to prevent violent extremism conducive to terrorism ;  rather , it should be a part of the civilian peace agenda .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: That point is highly relevant for Africa ,  where most peacekeeping operations are deployed  and where women 's organizations have been playing and will continue to play a positive role in all peace processes ,  from mediation and prevention initiatives to reconciliation and reconstruction in the aftermath of conflict .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: The historical inhabitants of the peninsula , the Crimean Tartars ,  who see their future in and with Ukraine ,  said  they would boycott this illegal happening .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: All others who care for the sovereignty and indivisibility of the country ,  including Crimea 's Ukrainians ,  will be left voiceless by this hastily concocted plebiscite ,  because the " yes " option to Crimea 's future in Ukraine is simply not on the ballot .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Our Russian colleague has spoken about self - determination and the independence of Crimea .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Let me quote the self - proclaimed Prime Minister of Crimea , Aksyonov :  "
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: No , we will not have independence " ,  he said to the press ,  " Crimea shouldjoin Russia " ,  and it may happen in the next week or so .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: It is in that context that the Council has voted for a draft resolution  condemning the illegal referendum in Crimea ,  saying yes to the non - use of force in relations between the States ;  yes to the sovereignty , territorial integrity , inviolability and political independence of Ukraine , and by way of extension , of any sovereign State .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: My country 's yes to the draft resolution is a yes to non - aggression , to a nation 's free choice of its destiny and its alliances , to democracy , to the rule of law and to the internationally accepted rules of behaviour based on the norms and principles of international law .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Today 's veto is not business as usual .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: By vetoing the draft resolution ,  built on the core tenants of the Charter of the United Nations ,  which clearly states  that " All members shall refrain in their international relations from the threat or use of force against the territorial integrity of political independence of any State , or in any other manner inconsistent for the Purposes of the United Nations "  and that " The parties to any dispute , the continuance of which is likely to endanger the maintenance of international peace and security , shall , first of all , seek a solution by negotiation , enquiry , mediation , conciliation , arbitration , judicial settlement , resort to regional agencies or arrangements or other peaceful means of their own choice " .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: The Russian media channels are putting out ongoing anti - Ukrainian propaganda .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: The mouthpiece of the separatists ,  Life News ,  boasts of the agility of rebels to shoot down any plane in sight .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: The terrorists and separatists continue to take hostages .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: The abducted and hooded Ukrainian pilot Nadia Savchenko was trafficked by separatists from Ukraine straight to the Russian Voronezh pretrial detention centre .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: We condemn  the unlawful detention of Ukrainian citizens in Russia .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: Russia must respect the norms of international law  and release Savchenko immediately .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: We remain appalled by the deteriorating human rights situation in Crimea .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: Lithuania urges Russia  to unequivocally distance itself from any kind of direct or indirect support for terrorists , separatists and foreign fighters .

sentence_text: The insurgents must lay down their weapons .

sentence_text: Lithuania calls on Russia  to cooperate with Ukraine  in order to ensure the security of the borders  and to prevent weapons and armed terrorists from entering the territory of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: We call on Russia  to constructively cooperate on the implementation of the peace plan put forward by President Petro Poroshenko .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: A diplomatic solution is possible .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: Ukraine 's independence , sovereignty and territorial integrity within its internationally recognized borders ,  including Crimea ,  are non - negotiable and must be respected by all .

sentence_text: I thank Under - Secretary - General Feltman for his briefing and his warning to the Council .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Australia strongly supported calls for the holding of tonight 's briefing   to give the Council an up - to - date sense of the continuing destabilization and increased tensions in eastern Ukraine ,   much of which has evidently been sponsored and condoned by the Russian Federation .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: We , with the rest of the Council , welcomed   the 17 April agreement reached in Geneva on steps to de - escalate the crisis ,   including commitments to refrain from further acts of violence and provocation .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: That was a positive development   and ,   we hoped ,   a demonstration of serious commitment to reduce tensions   and work cooperatively towards a diplomatic and political solution to the crisis .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: I also thank the Under - Secretary - General for Political Affairs , Mr. Jeffrey Feltman , for his briefing .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: At the start ofmy remarks , Iwish to express ,  on behalf of the Government and the people of Luxembourg ,  my most sincere condolences to the families and relatives of the 298 people aboard the Malaysia Airlines aircraft  that crashed yesterday afternoon near the village of Grabovo in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Among the victims was a Dutch - English family living in Luxembourg .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Our sympathy also goes out to the Governments and the peoples of the Netherlands , Malaysia , Germany , Australia , Belgium , Canada , Indonesia , New Zealand , the Philippines and the United Kingdom .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The international community owes it to the victims to shed light on the circumstances that led to this tragic event .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: A transparent and independent comprehensive international investigation must be completed as soon as possible .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Safe and unhindered access must be granted to international investigators , as well as to observers from the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe ( OSCE ) and representatives of affected countries .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: All parties involved should fully cooperate to that end .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: We commend the Ukrainian authorities in that regard .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Those who committed this heinous act must be held accountable .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: This air disaster took place in a context of the ongoing deterioration of the situation in the east of Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Day after day , we receive reports of civilians killed in fighting between the Ukrainian armed forces and illegal armed groups .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The pro - Russian separatist militias continue to occupy buildings and border posts ,  hold dozens of innocent people hostage  and threaten the territorial integrity , sovereignty and independence of Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The living conditions ofpeople living in areas affected by the hostilities continue to deteriorate ,  and the number of internally displaced persons has steadily increased .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The escalation of violence in recent days ,  until its tragic climax yesterday ,  demonstrates once again that active armed groups in eastern Ukraine are actually well - equipped and well - trained paramilitary forces who enjoy clear external support .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: With regard to dialogue , in accordance with Chapter VI of the Charter of the United Nations , the draft resolution under consideration by the Council this morning was intended to urge all parties to seek a peaceful settlement immediately through direct political dialogue ,  to exercise restraint ,  to refrain from any unilateral action and any inflammatory rhetoric that might increase tension  and to engage fully in international mediation efforts .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: However , the referendum  organized for tomorrow in Crimea  is intended to change the status of the Ukrainian territory against the will of Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: If the referendum were to take place ,  it would constitute a unilateral act  that could very seriously destabilize Ukraine and the entire the region .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Pursuant to the Charter of the United Nations , Member States have conferred upon the Security Council the primary responsibility for maintaining international peace and security .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Today , the Russian veto prevented the Security Council from assuming that responsibility in the interest of peace and security in Ukraine and Europe .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The referendum  organized for tomorrow in Crimea  runs contrary to Ukraine 's Constitution ,  which stipulates that the territory of Ukraine is indivisible and inviolable .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The referendum is also contrary to the Constitution of the Autonomous Republic of Crimea .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The international community can in no way recognize its outcome .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Secondly , greater efforts should be deployed to find political solutions to critical regional issues ,  and greater importance attached to the role of women in conflict resolution .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: The international community should work hard to help design political solutions to conflicts and overcome differences through dialogue .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: Women should be encouraged to become important players in mediation  and to fully leverage their advantages in advocating a culture of peace .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: United Nations peacekeeping operations may also steadily raise the percentage of female staff  so that communication with local women and girls can be improved .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: Thirdly , women should be given a greater role to play in building a culture of harmony and inclusiveness .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: The international community should encourage women to play a greater role in social life ,  and it should educate young people  so that they can resist the ideological influence of violent extremism and the demagogic rhetoric of armed groups and terrorists .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: Women should be empowered to fully participate in all phases of post - conflict reconstruction , actively encourage the disarmament , demobilization and reintegration process of combatants , and provide counselling and community support for victims of violence .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: Fourthly , women must be enabled to promote economic and social development ,  thereby eliminating the roots causes ofconflict .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: The international community should step up economic empowerment efforts for African women ,  help African countries reduce poverty  and promote economic development .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: African women should be provided with better occupational - skills training and with greater funding support for entrepreneurship  in order to comprehensively improve incomes and livelihoods ,  with a view to promoting the industrialization and agricultural modernization of the continent ,  thereby eradicating the root causes of conflict .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: Last September , the Global Summit of Women was convened under a joint China - United Nations initiative .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: We continue efforts to de - escalate the situation in Ukraine and find a diplomatic path forward ,  which is why Secretary Kerry will participate in the Geneva talks on 17 April ,  which will include Russian Foreign Minister Lavrov .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: But ifthose are to be successful , Russia will have to explain why its forces continue to mass on the Ukrainian border - at least 40,000 forces -  and it will have to come with constructive ideas on how to de - escalate and resolve the armed attacks on buildings in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The United States stands with Ukraine and the fundamental principle that the future of Ukraine must be decided by the Ukrainian people .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We also stand with international law and norms and the fundamental principle that borders are not suggestions .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: On Monday , we will conclude the $ 1 billion loan guarantee for Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: That will benefit all the Ukrainian people , including minorities .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Next week , Vice - President Biden will visit Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We strongly support concluding the agreement between Ukraine and the International Monetary Fund  so that the international community can bolster Ukraine 's economy .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: And we will support in every way we can Ukraine 's elections at the end of May  so that Ukraine can advance its political transition and look to a peaceful future .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: To support that effort ,  we have to increase women 's participation in politics and society .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: That means delivering on the commitments we made in resolutions 1325 ( 2000 ) , 1889 ( 2009 ) , 2242 ( 2015 ) and so many others  because breaking down barriers facing women in peace talks requires breaking down barriers facing women across society .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: It means helping girls stay in school , improving health care and , yes , tackling sexual Violence .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: At its heart , it is about ending discrimination against women .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: We all have a part to play .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: In Somalia , the United Kingdom is helping make health services available to over 1 million Somali women and children ,  but also providing legal assistance to thousands of Somali women  and will soon be supporting initiatives that boost their participation in politics too .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: But this issue will not be solved by one country alone .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: That is why the United Kingdom is contributing $ 1 million to the Global Acceleration Instrument for Women , Peace and Security and Humanitarian Action ( GAI ) .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: By funding the GAI , we can all offer material support that can break down those barriers .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: In Burundi , a network of women mediators was able to deal with 5,200 local conflicts in 2015 .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: That is over 14 a day .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: Thanks to the GAI , they are now scaling up their activities .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: At a time when the Council has been so frustrated by the crisis in Burundi ,  it is heartening to see how powerful women 's civil society can be in their local mediation efforts .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: I would like to thank Assistant Secretary - General Fernandez - Taranco for his briefing .
speaker: Mr. Wang Min

sentence_text: China is deeply worried about the recent escalation of the situation in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Wang Min

sentence_text: We hope that the relevant parties will remain calm ,  exercise restraint  and avoid any further deterioration of the situation .
speaker: Mr. Wang Min

sentence_text: Settling the question of Ukraine involves the interests and concerns of all parties .
speaker: Mr. Wang Min

sentence_text: It should be considered in a balanced manner .
speaker: Mr. Wang Min

sentence_text: Political and diplomatic channels should continue to be pursued in order to narrow differences   and settle the issue within the framework of law and order .
speaker: Mr. Wang Min

sentence_text: China has consistently called on the international community to make constructive efforts and employ good offices to ease the situation in Ukraine ,   and will continue to support the international community in those endeavours .
speaker: Mr. Wang Min

sentence_text: We must facilitate the active contribution of women in peace operations in Africa .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: We must ensure  that United Nations operations are appropriately prepared and equipped  to address the needs of women and girls in conflict and post - conflict settings .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: New Zealand lies far from the African continent ,  however we strive to make a modest , practical contribution to those efforts .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: New Zealand has long reflected women and peace and security considerations in its doctrine , policy and training for uniformed personnel serving internationally .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: Last November , an all - female New Zealand Defence Force team provided training on the the theme " Operationalization of gender " at the Kofi Annan International Peacekeeping Training Centre in Ghana .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: The training incorporated conflict - prevention techniques through the inclusion of women ,  increasing the employment of women in conflict prevention and resolution processes , and women 's experiences of leadership in conflict .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: Our experience in gender - sensitive approaches to community policing in post - conflict settings has proved the value of women 's participation .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: Female police officers interact better with the local female population .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: The presence of female personnel empowers local women ,  thereby ensuring that they are not seen only as victims  but as actors and providers of safety and security .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: Regional leadership has played an important role in African efforts to support the role of women in conflict prevention and resolution .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: We commend the African Union 's Gender , Peace and Security Programme .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: It has framed the integration and strengthening of the African peace and security architecture 's responsiveness to gender issues .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: Finally , we urge  the Security Council to incorporate the perspectives of women in its work as a matter of course .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: We should encourage greater participation by women in all mediation efforts and conflict - prevention processes .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: It is simple :  when women are included as active participants ,  there is a far greater chance of ending conflict and sustaining peace .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: The United States offered the draft resolution in a spirit of reconciliation , in the desire for peace , in keeping with the rule of law , in recognition of the facts and in fulfilment of the obligation of the Council  to promote and preserve stability among nations .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: At the moment of decision , only one hand was raised to oppose those principles .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russia  - isolated , alone and wrong -  blocked the draft resolution 's adoption ,  just as it has blocked Ukrainian ships and international observers .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russia put itself outside the international norms that we have painstakingly developed  to serve as the bedrock foundation for peaceful relations between States .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The reason only one country voted against the draft resolution today  is that the world believes  that international borders are more than mere suggestions .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The world believes  that people within those internationally recognized borders have the right to chart their own future , free from intimidation .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The world believes  that the lawless pursuit of one 's ambitions serves none of us .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Australia is seriously disturbed  that the draft resolution contained in document S/2014/189 before us was vetoed .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Its purpose was to reaffirm the fundamental principles and norms governing relations between States in the post-1945 world  - obligations that form the core of the Charter of the United Nations -  respect for the sovereignty and territorial integrity of all States ,  the obligation to refrain from the threat or use of force against the territorial integrity or political independence of any State ,  the illegality of the acquisition of territory through the threat or use of force and the obligation to settle disputes by peaceful means .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: As the body mandated under the United Nations Charter with the primary responsibility for the maintenance of international peace and security ,  the Security Council has a primordial responsibility to uphold those obligations .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: As Council members , we do so on behalf of all Member States .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The draft resolution directly and carefully reflects those fundamental norms .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: There is nothing in it that any State Member of the United Nations could reasonably oppose .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Russia 's decision to veto the resolution is therefore profoundly unsettling .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The referendum to be held tomorrow in Crimea is dangerous and destabilizing .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: It is unauthorized and invalid .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The international community will not recognize the result  nor any action taking on the basis of it .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: We would like to underscore  that we are concerned by the fact  that the sponsors of the resolution ignored the logical and wise amendments that were proposed by Egypt and were backed by troop - contributing countries ( TCCs ) .
speaker: Mr. Iliichev

sentence_text: This is a case in which the view of the troop - contributing countries must be heard  and must be included in the work on Security Council resolutions .
speaker: Mr. Iliichev

sentence_text: We believe  it is wrong to pit the Council up against the General Assembly and , even worse , against TCCs .
speaker: Mr. Iliichev

sentence_text: Nigeria is vehemently opposed  to unilateral secession or forceful excision of territory  designed to alter the configuration of States in their internationally recognized boundaries .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: Standing on that fundamental principle ,  Nigeria is opposed  to any unilateral declaration by a component part of a State  that will alter the configuration of the State  to which it appropriately belongs .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: It is therefore needless to restate that the impending referendum in Crimea is not in consonance with the Constitution of Ukraine .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: The consequences of any defiance are better imagined than described .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: At the outset , I would like to express  my unequivocal condemnation of all crimes of sexual exploitation and abuse  and to emphasize  that States must take all the measures necessary to combat and eradicate such crimes as a deterrent to potential offenders .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: I would also like to stress  how important it is that every effort be made  to assist the victims of such crimes ,  in line with the compliance of Egypt and every other State Member of the United Nations with our zero - tolerance policy .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: The Egyptian delegation chose not to vote against today 's resolution 2272 ( 2016 )  out of our sincere belief in the importance of many of its provisions ,  which are designed to deal with repeated cases of sexual exploitation and abuse in peacekeeping operations .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: Despite the unilateral approach to the negotiations on the draft resolution ,  we have chosen not to vote against it .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: Throughout the negotiations and during yesterday 's briefing on the subject ( see S / PV.7642 ) ,  my delegation has consistently pointed to the need  to differentiate between , on the one hand , condemning and combating sexual exploitation and abuse  and , on the other , tarring entire States and the troops they contribute with the same brush .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: The way that peacekeeping troops and troop - contributing countries ( TCCs ) have been libelled is completely unacceptable .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: It has a drastic and negative effect on the troops ' morale  and demonstrates contempt for the sacrifices of tens of thousands of peacekeeping personnel operating under extremely difficult conditions .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: The Security Council has chosen to act on an issue outside its purview ,  since conduct and discipline ,  including in relation to sexual exploitation and abuse ,  are matters that are at the very core of the competence of the General Assembly .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: All States Members of the United Nations are represented in the General Assembly ,  including the TCCs .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: Therefore , taking action on this matter in the Security Council rather than in the General Assembly illustrates ulterior motives  aimed at capitalizing on the fact the major troop - contributing countries are absent from this organ ,  in order to adopt a resolution that never would have been adopted in the organ  designated with responsibility to confront sexual abuse and exploitation .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: It would have been more appropriate  if United Nations bodies had focused on addressing the root causes of the problem  by providing sufficient predeployment training to peacekeeping forces ,  ensuring the separation of United Nations camps from the local population ,  avoiding prolonged rotation  and providing adequate living conditions , among other things .
speaker: Mr. Aboulatta

sentence_text: We are deeply shocked  by yesterday 's downing of a Malaysia Airlines Boeing 777 in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: We express our sincere condolences  to Malaysia , the Netherlands , Australia , Indonesia , the United Kingdom , Germany , Belgium , the Philippines , Canada and the other nations whose citizens were among the 298 people who perished .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: Our deepest sympathies go to the families of the victims .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: The circumstances ofthe downing mustbe established by an independent , international investigaton ,  in accordance with international civil aviation guidelines .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: The perpetrators can not escape responsibility .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: Investigators must immediately be granted access to the crash site  and the black boxes must be handed over to independent authorities  in order to prevent the evidence being tampered with .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: The debris of the Malaysian plane lies in an area controlled by pro - Russian separatists .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: This week alone , a Ukrainian AN-26 cargo plane and an Su-25 fighter jet were shot down by pro - Russian separatists from a high altitude .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: The third  - a Malaysian passenger plane -  was deliberately shot down .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: An Il-76 transport plane and half a dozen helicopters were brought down by pro - Russian separatists at Luhansk airport and elsewhere .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: In June , separatists boasted of possessing an SA-11 Buk missile system .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: They claimed  to have used the system  to shoot down the An-26 cargo plane at high altitude .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: Separatist commander Igor Strelkov claimed to the media  to have shot down another aircraft at the same time as the Malaysian Airlines flight was overflying the area .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: Withthe proposedEgyptian amendment , there would be no cost either for non - response or for uninvestigated , unaccountable criminal behaviour .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: That undermines the purpose of today 's draft resolution ,  which is to get countries to respond to credible allegations against their personnel  and to change a system that is not working .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: It is to move away from talking about zero tolerance  to actually having a provision that puts in place consequences that incentivize the kinds of actions  that every member of the Security Council ,  including Egypt ,  has said it supports .
speaker: Ms. Power
