sentence_text: For that reason , we will vote against the proposed Egyptian amendment .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: As a Council , we often demand  that perpetrators be held accountable ,  and no one has said before that the Council is acting in contravention of the presumption of innocence .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: That is not what we are doing .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: In that regard , again , Member States will have the authority within their own systems  to determine how to pursue an investigation ,  whether a guilty finding is appropriate  and what will be the means of accountability that they put in place .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: But it can not be the case that simply sending a note to the Secretary - General  after allegations of such gravity are brought  is enough to dispense with a State 's obligations under the draft resolution .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: What is the situation today ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: We have been told that restraint will be exercised  and a peaceful solution found to the situation that takes into account the opinions of the various groupings of the Ukrainian population .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: That has been confirmed by our Western interlocutors .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: However , on 13 April the Verkhovna Rada - appointed President Turchynov stated  that the Ukrainian Security Council had decided to launch a full - scale anti - terrorist operation , including the use of the armed forces .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: However ,  unlike the Maidan demonstrators ,  the protesters have terrorized no one ,  have used no bulldozers against the authorioties ,  and thrown no Molotov cocktails .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It is no coincidence that law - enforcement officers were present among the Maidan protestors .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Now the Kyiv authorities must use force to suppress other areas of the country .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: According to Turchynov ,  the people of south - eastern Ukraine must end their protests by the morning of Monday , 14 April , lest armed force be used .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: However , the protesters ' interests and opinions have not been taken into account or even discussed .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: As a result , blood has already been shed in the South - East  and the situation is extremely dangerous .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Any further escalation of the situation must be swiftly stopped .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I would like to welcome  Ms. Maria Filomena Lobao Telo Delgado  and to thank  Angola for having convened this extremely important debate on women and peace and security in Africa .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: I would also like to thank  the Assistant Secretary - General , the Executive Director of UN - Women , the Chair of the Peacebuilding Commission , the Observer of the African Union and the Executive Director of South Sudan
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: Women 's Empowerment Network .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: Over the past 15 years , the Security Council has managed to build a legal framework for the programme of action for women and peace and security  through the adoption of resolution 1325 ( 2000 ) and seven subsequent resolutions .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: The Council accordingly established a concrete political momentum  thanks to which the contribution of women to the prevention and resolution of conflicts in Africa has significantly grown .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: That momentum has also helped reinforce the contribution of women  through a number of mechanisms and legal frameworks that have been adopted in Africa  in order to boost the participation of women in this area .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: As examples , I may point  to the Solemn Declaration on Gender Equality in Africa  and the appointment of an African Union Special Envoy on Women , peace and security .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: And in West Africa there have been numerous positive experiences .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: Jordan has voted in favour ofthe draft resolution contained in document S/2014/189  out of its respect for Ukraine 's sovereignty , territorial integrity and political independence and non - interference in its internal affairs .
speaker: Prince Zeid Ra'Ad Zeid Al-Hussein

sentence_text: Moreover , it calls  for adherence to the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations , especially Article 1 ,  and to the use of peaceful means to settle disputes .
speaker: Prince Zeid Ra'Ad Zeid Al-Hussein

sentence_text: Jordan confirms  the importance of upholding the territorial integrity of Ukraine  and subjecting all its territories , including Crimea , to Ukrainian sovereignty , in accordance with the principles of international law and relevant international resolutions ,  including the 1994 Budapest Memorandum and the 1997 Treaty on Friendship , Cooperation and Partnership .
speaker: Prince Zeid Ra'Ad Zeid Al-Hussein

sentence_text: The Republic of Korea is deeply concerned   over the continuing tensions in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah

sentence_text: Despite the agreement reached in Geneva on 17 April ,   the situation in Ukraine is showing no signs of abating .
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah

sentence_text: We are troubled   in particular by the continuing violence and aggressive provocations by illegal armed groups ,   including the seizure of key public buildings and the recent assassination attempt against the Mayor of the eastern city of Kharkiv .
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah

sentence_text: All provocative actions and hostile rhetoric aimed at destabilizing Ukraine must cease immediately .
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah

sentence_text: As agreed in the Geneva statement ,   all illegal armed groups must be disarmed and all illegally seized key public buildings vacated .
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah

sentence_text: We strongly condemn   the detention of military monitors of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe ( OSCE ) , as well as of Ukrainian staff by illegal armed groups .
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah

sentence_text: It should be noted that the OSCE monitoring mechanism is an indispensable tool for implementing the Geneva statement .
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah

sentence_text: It is unacceptable to target international observers who are working to de - escalate the volatile situation .
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah

sentence_text: They must be released immediately and unconditionally .
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah

sentence_text: The safety and security of all international personnel must be fully guaranteed by all actors on the ground .
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah

sentence_text: In the light of the ongoing situation in Ukraine , we reiterate that constructive dialogue among all concerned parties will be the only way to achieve a peaceful solution .
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah

sentence_text: In that regard , we call for all parties   to the Geneva statement to implement their commitments .
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah

sentence_text: As Ukraine moves towards critical elections in May ,   it is all the more important to ensure the holding of fair and free elections in the country ,   without any intervention or influence by outside forces .
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah

sentence_text: We hope   that the Ukrainian Government will lead an inclusive and transparent constitutional process .
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah

sentence_text: I thank the United States delegation  for having taken the initiative of submitting to the Security Council the text of resolution 2272 ( 2016 ) ,  which we have just adopted ,  concerning cases of sexual exploitation and abuse committed by United Nations peacekeeping personnel and external forces authorized by the Council .
speaker: Mr. Seck

sentence_text: As a troop- and police - contributing country  and in accordance with its international commitments to peacekeeping and respect for international humanitarian law and international human rights law ,  Senegal naturally voted in favour of the resolution .
speaker: Mr. Seck

sentence_text: The delegation of Senegal participated actively in the negotiations in a constructive spirit and accordingly proposed amendments  aimed at making the text clearer with a View  to ensuring that innocent parties do not fall victim to collective punishment for crimes  that are a matter of individual responsibility .
speaker: Mr. Seck

sentence_text: The delegation of Senegal would have therefore liked the resolution to take into account the sometimes difficult situations  faced by States concerned with regard to carrying out investigations and enquiries .
speaker: Mr. Seck

sentence_text: My delegation regrets  that several of the concerns we voiced with a view  to making the text more balanced  were not reflected in the resolution .
speaker: Mr. Seck

sentence_text: However , Senegal 's commitment to the zero - zolerance policy called for by the Secretary - General remains absolute ,  given that the fight against impunity must remain a collective and universal exigency .
speaker: Mr. Seck

sentence_text: That is why France ,  within the framework of its national women and peace and security programme , covering the period 2015 - 2018 ,  has contributed to several programs in Africa ,  devoted to , among other things , social cohesion , education , access to justice for women in post - conflict situations on the continent .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: The future of Africa is in the hands of its people , especially its women .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Today they continue to be victims of the conflicts ravaging the continent ,  and it is therefore up to the United Nations to give them the tools to serve as stakeholders in the peace of tomorrow .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: The Council can count on the full support of France to assist women in post - conflict situations in Africa .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: We can not be having this discussion again  - not in 20 years ' time , not in one year 's time .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: What we need now is swift and systematic implementation of this resolution , implementation  that brings justice for the victims  and ends the sickening cycle of impunity .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: This is not about collective punishment , nor about penalizing the many for the sick acts of the few .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: This is about taking serious action in the face of serious allegations ,  about acting decisively against any pattern of abuse in any part of the world .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: We have also witnessed continued and extreme provocations , including military manoeuvres on the Russian side of the Ukrainian border and reported multiple violations of Ukrainian air space by Russian military aircraft .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: We have witnessed the deplorable shooting on 28 April of the Mayor of Kharkiv and the abduction and killing of a Horlivka City Council representative .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: We are seeing continued occupation of Government buildings by well - armed and coordinated paramilitary groups , including , today , the occupation of Government buildings in Lugansk .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: We are seeing the increasing intimidation of local populations and illegal detentions .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Under - Secretary - General Feltman has just reported to us   increasing reports of violence , with people killed , wounded , beaten and tortured .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: In those circumstances , it is appropriate and necessary for the Ukrainian Government itself to take measures   to try to ensure security and protect its citizens in its own territory .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: It has shown considerable restraint in the face of extreme provocation ,   but it has a right to enforce the rule of law and respond in a manner proportionate to the circumstances .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: We welcome Deputy Minister for Foreign Affairs Lubkivsky 's statement during his 25 April press conference at the United Nations   that Ukraine would protect its people from provocation in a civilized manner   so as to avoid bloodshed .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: We welcome Ukraine 's recent acceptance ofjurisdiction of the International Criminal Court ( ICC ) with respect to crimes committed in its territory from November last year to February 2014 .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: We urge Ukraine   to extend the ICC 's jurisdiction to crimes committed beyond that date   and to accede to the ICC Statute .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: For its part , overwhelmingly , the international community remains united in its support for Ukraine 's sovereignty and territory integrity   and in its position that Russia cease its illegal intervention , interference and provocative actions in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Statements by other Security Council members tonight are further confirmation of that .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: I thank Mr. Feltman for his briefing .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: I wish to extend my deepest condolences  to all the Permanent Representatives of the countries that lost citizens in this tragic event .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: I would like in particular to extend our condolences  to our colleagues from the Netherlands and Malaysia .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: We also mourn with the people of the Netherlands .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Yesterday a Malaysia Airlines flight with nearly 300 passengers aboard crashed in the separatist - controlled area of Ukraine ,  and the French President expressed his enormous sorrow at the announcement of the disaster .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Today I reiterate France 's solidarity with the victims ' families in the ordeal they are experiencing .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Given this tragedy and the already chaotic situation ,  France requests  that all efforts be brought forth to shed light on the circumstances that led to the tragedy .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: We call  for an independent international inquiry  that would allow the facts to be established  and to draw the necessary conclusions .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: We ask  that all measures be taken  to facilitate the work of the investigators on the ground .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: In particular , we expect the separatists to cooperate with the Ukrainian authorities in the investigation  and to allow safe , immediate and full access to the investigators ,  in accordance with the decision made yesterday during the video tele - conference between the contact group involving Ukraine , Russia and the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe ( OSCE ) and the separatist representatives .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: New Zealand voted in favour of resolution 2272 ( 2016 )  because of the clear and pressing need for more robust action  to combat sexual exploitation and abuse .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: New Zealand respects the sacrifice  and commends the meaningful contribution of the vast majority of United Nations peacekeepers .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: The measures in this resolution support the Secretary - General 's efforts with respect to sexual exploitation and abuse ,  in particular to address the systemic failure represented by the ongoing allegations .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: The past 10 years ,  and especially this past year ,  have demonstrated  that the status quo is neither working nor acceptable .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: The Security Council has a responsibility to act on sexual exploitation and abuse  and address the negative consequences of the peacekeeping operations that we members of the Council mandate ,  including to implement the standards  we have all agreed .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: We encourage all partners  to work together going forward .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: Only our close cooperation to implement zero tolerance and build capacity , with a real investment of political will ,  can make the difference  that is so desperately needed for the victims , United Nations peacekeeping , and the credibility of the Organization .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: Spain thanks the United States  for this important initiative .
speaker: Mr. Oyarzun Marchesi

sentence_text: We have just adopted resolution 2272 ( 2016 ) ,  the first to address exclusively conduct deemed completely unacceptable .
speaker: Mr. Oyarzun Marchesi

sentence_text: With this resolution , the Security Council is sending a strong message to all who have the responsibility to eliminate this scourge ,  and that responsibility is collective .
speaker: Mr. Oyarzun Marchesi

sentence_text: My delegation supported the text  put forward in its entirety and without amendment ,  because quite simply we can not address the issue of accountability in a partial manner .
speaker: Mr. Oyarzun Marchesi

sentence_text: The reason for that is obvious .
speaker: Mr. Oyarzun Marchesi

sentence_text: Our aim is not to repatriate contingents ,  but to protect the victims  and prevent the repetition of aggressive acts .
speaker: Mr. Oyarzun Marchesi

sentence_text: It is therefore necessary to investigate such matters as soon as possible  or inform the Secretary - General of the measures taken .
speaker: Mr. Oyarzun Marchesi

sentence_text: The perpetrators must be brought to justice  and serve their sentences .
speaker: Mr. Oyarzun Marchesi

sentence_text: All of that is first and foremost the responsibility of the troop - and police contributing countries ,  precisely because we do not want the work of a contingent to be tarnished by the actions of some of its members .
speaker: Mr. Oyarzun Marchesi

sentence_text: Let us ensure that we all assume our responsibility .
speaker: Mr. Oyarzun Marchesi

sentence_text: We urge the Russian Federation  to actively use its influence on the illegal armed groups  and ensure  that weapons and fighters can no longer cross the border ,  in order to bring about a de - escalation as soon as possible .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Throughout the past few months , Ukraine has demonstrated its commitment to finding a peaceful solution to the crisis and to implementing the agreements concluded ,  in particular the joint declaration adopted on 17 April in Geneva between Ukraine , Russia , the European Union and the United States .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Ukraine has established a national dialogue and guarantees for national minorities .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Once elected , President Poroshenko put forward a comprehensive peace plan  and put in place a unilateral ceasefire  to create the conditions necessary for its implementation .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Unfortunately , illegal armed groups ,  whose sole aim is to destabilize Ukraine ,  chose not to take that outstretched hand .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Diplomatic efforts to find a peaceful solution to the crisis in eastern Ukraine must continue .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: In that regard , the personal commitment of the Secretary - General since the beginning of the crisis is essential and must continue .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: It is important to urgently reach an agreement on a real and lasting ceasefire that is observed by all parties ,  so as to create the conditions necessary for the implementation of President Poroshenko 's peace plan .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela voted in favour of resolution 2272 ( 2016 ) ,  for we are convinced  that acts of sexual exploitation and abuse  committed by any foreign force or military , police or civilian personnel participating in United Nations peacekeeping operations or special political missions  must be categorically rejected .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: No one can justify such cowardly and absolutely reprehensible crimes .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: All those responsible should be punished .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: In that regard , we reiterate our support for the Secretary - General 's zero - tolerance policy .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: As we stated during the briefing yesterday ( see S / PV.7642 ) ,  this is not an issue of an exclusively disciplinary nature ;  these are reprehensible acts that contradict and undermine the purposes and principles of the United Nations  for which peacekeeping missions are established .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: In situations of armed conflict , such acts could constitute violations of international humanitarian law and international human rights law .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: The United Nations should be an example of consistency , firmness and high moral and ethical commitment  with regard to the importance of preventing these acts  and , above all , with regard to the accountability of any such personnel authorized by the Security Council  that commits this type of crime .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: Most of the interventions made yesterday stressed how important it was  that the discussion and actions to be taken within the Council on this sensitive issue entaild close and organic coordination with other bodies with competence in the matter , namely , the General Assembly , in particular through its Special Committee on Peacekeeping Operations .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: We want to insist on that point .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: The spirit of cooperation should prevail among the various organs of the United Nations .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: A glimmer of hope had begun to dawn in Ukraine at the end of last month .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: With the election of Mr. Poroshenko , a process of political normalization had begun .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: A unilateral ceasefire ,  declared by Kiev on 20 June ,  hinted at a possible end to the general deteriorating security and humanitarian situation in the east .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: On that same day , President Poroshenko initiated a comprehensive peace plan  in order to arrive at a peaceful resolution of the situation .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Furthermore ,  following their meeting on the sidelines of the ceremonies marking the Normandy landing ,  a process of almost daily exchanges between Presidents Poroshenko and Putin and Chancellor Merkel and President Hollande led to the start of a useful dialogue .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Moreover , a joint statement was adopted in Berlin on 2 July  that provided for the quest of a lasting ceasefire via the meeting between the contact group and the separatists ,  strengthened border control on the Russian - Ukrainian border to curb the flow of weapons and fighters ,  and the agreement of the OSCE to participate in that effort .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Nevertheless , today the situation continues to deteriorate .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: For several days , fighting has escalated in eastern Ukraine  because the separatists have refused to clasp the hand being extended to them .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Every day the attacks are ever more deadly .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Weapons never used until now have begun to be used and have struck Ukrainian territory .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Two Ukrainian planes were shot down in their own airspace .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: That could happen only if one of the parties possessed sophisticated anti - aircraft weaponry .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Moreover , this unprecedented deterioration is also due to the presence of armed fighters coming from outside Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: The question of outside support in terms of recruitment , supplies of materials and training can not be avoided .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: The answer is too obvious .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: It is irrefutable .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Important proposals regarding the status of the Russian language , amnesty , greater rights for the regions , as well as limitations on the President 's power , have been put forward by the transitional Governmet .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Indeed , as Ambassador Churkin referred to earlier today ,   constitutional reform was being discussed by the Parliament in a public session accessible to all .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: There has been a major debate on what was being proposed .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: But , again , a major debate that includes criticism is a sign of democracy .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Unanimous decisions and acceptance of whatever is put on the table is something that abelongs to regimes , not democratic Governments .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: We therefore welcome the discussion .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: It is necessary   and it is something Kyiv has to do ,   and should be doing actively while involving all the regions and populations ,   because it affects the lives of the entire population of Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Other issues discussed today include decentralization , constitutional reform , checks and balances , the powers of the President in the future , a stronger role for and the reinforcement of the independence of the judiciary , and so forth .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Preparations are taking place for the national elections to be held on 25 May .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: While we welcome   the joint de - escalation measures agreed on in Geneva on 17 April   and involving the main stakeholders as a step towards a tangible solution to the crisis ,   we are concerned about the fact   that many of those measures have not been implemented .
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe

sentence_text: We urge all parties   to implement their parts of the agreement ,   and especially to disarm all military groups   and restore all seized buildings .
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe

sentence_text: The OSCE monitors must be allowed to play a role and to fulfil their mandate ,   as stipulated in the joint declaration .
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe

sentence_text: In the meantime , Rwanda reiterates its call   for respect for Ukraine 's independence , sovereignty and territorial integrity .
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe

sentence_text: We believe in the right to peaceful demonstration ,   but we firmly condemn   the use of violence , the seizure of public buildings and the installation of illegal checkpoints by armed protesters .
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe

sentence_text: We therefore believe that Ukraine , like any other country , has a right to restore public order ,   provided that right is exercised in a proportionate manner .
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe

sentence_text: Nonetheless , the crisis in eastern Ukraine is not merely a matter of public order   but a political issue that must be resolved through genuine dialogue with all Ukrainian parties ,   with a view to ensuring sustainable peace and equal rights for all , including the Russian - speaking minority .
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe

sentence_text: To conclude , we reiterate our strong belief   that while public meetings of the Council are important for its members to continue monitoring this crisis ,   the only way to solve the crisis in Ukraine is through the exercise of political will and the influence of all the countries and regional organizations involved ,   in order to ensure a political and diplomatic solution to the conflict .
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe

sentence_text: From the speaker before me ,   we heard references to military punitive operations and acts .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: If what Ukraine is carrying out in the eastern part of its country is a military punitive action ,   it is probably the most invisible , impossible military action on Earth .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Nothing has happened in that sense .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: To exaggerate to such an extent is going a long way in terms of exaggeration .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: On the other hand , in a threatening tone , Russia recently ordered   Ukraine to withdraw Ukrainian troops stationed on Ukraine 's own soil ,   or else - so much for respect for Ukraine 's international sovereignty .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: We firmly reject all of Russia 's attempts to validate its intentions   and threats to use armed forces or to send so - called Russian peacekeepers into Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: As a permanent member of the Security Council , Russia should know better than to exploit the name of peacekeeping   to cover up its aggressive expansionist aims .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Now I would like to turn to human rights and the media .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: The Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe ( OSCE ) Representative on the Freedom of the Media , Mr. Dunja Mijatovic ' , is sounding increasing alarm   regarding the treatment of journalists and the deterioration of media freedom in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: In areas under the control of pro - Russian militants , journalists are attacked , detained , harassed and their equipment taken or smashed .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: There is probably something to hide   if there is such a distaste and dislike of free media in that part of Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: We reiterate our call   to end impunity for attacks against journalists .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: We also call   for a thorough investigation of kidnappings , torture and killings ,   committed by whomever ,   and to insist that the perpetrators of all such acts be brought to justice .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: I thank you , Madam President , for convening this emergency meeting on the situation in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: I also thank Assistant Secretary - General Oscar Fernandez - Taranco for his briefing on the worrying situation in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: We are very alarmed by reports of increased tensions in eastern Ukraine in the past several days .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: We condemn the attack that killed a State security officer and wounded five others in the eastern city of Slovyansk .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: The perpetrators of that criminal act should be brought to justice .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: I take this opportunity to echo the Secretary - General 's call to all sides to work towards calming the situation .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: After numerous calls for the de - escalation of the crisis , the situation has become more complex for the diverse Ukrainian community .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: It is imperative to protect the rights of the citizens of Ukraine regardless of ethnic background .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: We reiterate our call for an inclusive dialogue , a frank and open discussion that is mutually beneficial for all the parties concerned .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: Although Rwanda agrees in principle that Ukraine , like any other country , has a right to self - defence and to promote its territorial integrity ,  its acts should be proportional .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: We discourage any military act that would put the lives of innocent civilians in danger .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: Rwanda remains of the View that military action will only worsen the already tense situation .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: We encourage all the parties involved , particularly in the current situation , to exercise full restraint .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: It is vital to allow the diplomatic efforts that have already been deployed to work .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: The international community can not watch another crisis slip out of its hands .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: We must act on what we stand for - peace and security .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: We welcome the discussion among the United States , Ukraine and Russia due to take place on 17 April .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: We encourage United Nations participation in those talks .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: France ,  which contributes to peacekeeping operations ,  has consistently during the negotiation process supported this broad - based approach ,  which sends a strong message to all players .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: I should note ,  however , that we do not intend here to collectively stigmatize the soldiers who bravely fight for our Organization 's ideals ;  that is not ,  and will never be ,  our intention .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: This issue is too important for us not to all mobilize in a collective spirit of goodwill .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Everyone must feel heeded .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: This is why an in - depth , inclusive dialogue with the troop - contributing countries is so important , for the sake of efficiency ,  in order to achieve the result that we all wish to see .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: It is vital for everyone to take ownership of the zero - tolerance objective  to which I have just referred .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: We must meet this challenge .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Our collective action will serve as the best possible reply to the Secretary - General 's call and , ofcourse , to the victims .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Rest assured that France 's determination in this respect is absolute , both nationally and in the framework of the United Nations .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: France will spare no effort in supporting the Secretary - General 's efforts  aimed at strengthening our policy of zero tolerance for sexual abuse .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: I should like to conclude  by once again paying heartfelt tribute to all of the soldiers  who are working for the maintenance of peace and to their invaluable contribution .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: In addition ,   Prime Minister Yatsenyuk has publicly committed his Government   to undertake far - reaching constitutional reforms that will strengthen the power of the regions .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: He has appealed personally   to Russian - speaking Ukrainians ,   pledging   to support special status for the Russian language   and to protect those who use it .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: He announced legislation   to grant amnesty to those who surrender arms .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: All of that should be cause for optimism and hope .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Tragically , what we have seen from Russia since 17 April   is exactly what we saw from Russia prior to 17 April :   more attempts to stir up trouble ,   more efforts to undermine the Government of Ukraine and statement after statement at odds with the facts .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: What we have not seen is a single positive step by Russia   to fulfil its Geneva commitments .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: In a stark contrast to those efforts , armed separatists ,   aidead and abetted by Russia ,   are continuing their assault on Ukraine ,   adding violence to force and lawlessness to impunity .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: As many noted earlier , yesterday and today saw more violent attacks in the city of Luhansk and elsewhere - in Mykolaiv and in Konstiantynivka -   where men armed with clubs and metal bars smashed windows and doors .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: A pro - unity rally was attacked by men in military fatigues ,   leading to over a dozen injuries among pro - Ukrainian protesters .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: A few days ago , a Ukrainian helicopter was downed by a rocket - propelled grenade ,   hardly a weapon so - called peaceful protesters   - as labelled by the Russian side -   can buy at the local corner market .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: That certainly does not sound like the implementation of Geneva agreement by the separatists and their state sponsors ?
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Displays of brutal force , beatings , disappearances , torture , killings and hostage - taking have become a daily reality in eastern Ukraine under militant separatist rule .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: While quick to condemn and brand Ukrainian authorities for alleged crimes ,   Russia has yet to issue a single condemnation of the violence carried out by armed separatists .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: The legitimate right of Ukraine ,   to which our Australian colleague has referred ,   to defend its territory and its State   has been exercised with incredible restraint and caution ,   although portrayed by the Russian propaganda machinery as a bloodbath and a valid cause for intervention .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: The promised reform of the Constitution is being prepared in secret .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It appears that Kyiv would like to enlist the support of European structures  and then give it to its lucky people .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Indeed ,  according to reports ,  the redistribution of powers from the President to the Parliament ,  which was the source of the fighting in Maidan for months ,  is not actually being planned for .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Is it any wonder that violence has been the result of such strategy ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The political representatives of those regions are well known .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: They have long been a part okaraine 's political life ,  and have come to the forefront through the protest movements in recent months .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Involving them in the dialogue would prevent a further escalation of the current serious crisis ,  but instead Kyiv chose to arrest , beat and threaten them .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I reiterate that , unfortunately , several clumsy accusations have been made against Russia .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It has been said that Russia somehow wishes to destabilize Ukraine ,  if not practically crush it altogether .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: But why was there no response to our call at the start of the crisis  for launching a dialogue  on how to help Ukraine emerge from the political and economic crisis  it had found itself in ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Why was the crisis encouraged to continue ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Why was it only just a few days ago  that the Foreign Ministers of France , Germany and Poland said  that the European Union and Russia should indeed talk about the economic prospects for Ukraine , Georgia and Moldova in connection with their joining the partnership programme of the European Union .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: And , by the way , we have heard nothing about the fact  that those ministerial conversations took place in Brussels .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Rwanda wishes  to explain its vote on the text of the draft resolution ( S/2014/ 189 ) before us .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: It is unfortunate that we have come to this today ,  as the situation could have been avoided .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: Voting for the text before us was a hard decision we had to make ,  and that is so because we are not convinced that the timing of the draft resolution was productive to the objective and purpose of the Security Council .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: It is hinged on the timing of the planned referendum in Crimea ,  which may not resolve the entire crisis .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: More cynical is the objective being stated in these corridors and in some capitals  to isolate each other ,  including important stakeholders ,  in our search for a peaceful solution to the crisis in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: There is no need to isolate ;  however , there is a need for a real and frank dialogue .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: That is why we are in the Chamber , all of us , as a United Nations .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: The Russian Federation is carrying out a consistent policy of developing cooperation among the United Nations , the African Union and subregional organizations .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: We call for further pooling of efforts  regarding the conflict situations in Darfur , Somalia , South Sudan , the Central African Republic , Mali , the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Guinea - Bissau , as well as the intra - Sudanese track ,  in the fight against international terrorism , transnational organized crime , piracy , the illegal trafficking in arms and drugs ,  as well as other important areas of cooperation ,  including the issue of women and peace and security .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: Russia is ready to step up its cooperation with African States  aimed at strengthening their crisis - response capacities ,  including through the ongoing training of their peacekeepers and law - enforcement agents in Russian educational establishments .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: Our country is participating in a number of United Nations peacekeeping operations on the continent  and plays a leading role among the contributors of air - transport services to them .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: The issue of women and peace and security is an inalienable component of peace and conflict - resolution processes and post - conflict peacebuilding .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: The participation of women in such efforts has much positive potential .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: We must also note the efforts of specialized subregional and regional organizations in that regard .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: Furthermore , while Ukraine has put a draft law to the Ukrainian Parliament   that would provide amnesty for protestors who vacate Government buildings and lay down their weapons ,   Russia has not rescinded the order by the Russian Parliament to authorize the use of military force in Ukraine   and will not condemn   the widely reported abuses by pro - Russian armed groups in southern and eastern Ukraine .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: These abuses include at least 11 kidnappings ,   among them several Ukrainian and international journalists ,   and the torture and murder ofa Ukrainian local official and two other local people .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: The deplorable shooting yesterday of the Mayor of Kharkiv was another sign of the violence being instigated against those who have opted to support a united Ukraine .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Finally , Ukraine has begun an inclusive process of constitutional reform on the decentralization of power .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: It has announced   measures to guarantee the protection of the Russian language ,   and it has condemned   instances of anti - Semitism and xenophobia ,   whereas Russian rhetoric continues to whip up tensions   with false claims that the Russian language is under threat in Ukraine   and allegations that the Kyiv Government is anti - Semitic .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Finally ,   as all the world knows ,   pro - Russian separatists in Donetsk have kidnapped and continue to hold seven international inspectors ,   openly declared as members of a Vienna document mission ,   along with their Ukrainian escorts .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: My Government joins with responsible Governments everywhere in condemning   that unlawful act   and in being outraged   by the shameful exhibition before the media of those international public servants .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The Vienna document ,   agreed upon by all 57 participating States of the OSCE ,   has been a lasting source of cooperation and military transparency .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We call , with others , for the immediate and unconditional release of the inspectors and their Ukrainian escorts   and the immediate end to their mistreatment while in captivity .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We also call upon Russia ,   as a signatory to the Vienna document ,   to help secure their release   and to confirm publicly , even if belatedly , for the record   that the abducted monitors were part of a legitimate mission on behalf of the international community .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Since 17 April , the Government of Ukraine has acted in good faith and with admirable restraint to fulfil its commitments .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The Kyiv city hall and its surrounding area are now clear of all Maidan barricades and protestors .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Over the Easter holiday , Ukraine voluntarily suspended its counter - terrorism initiative ,   choosing to de - escalate despite its fundamental right to provide security on its own territory and for its own people .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Unlike the separatists , Ukraine has cooperated fully with the OSCE special monitoring mission   and allowed its observers to operate in regions about which Moscow had voiced concerns regarding the treatment of ethnic Russians .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: I thank the briefers for their insights  and I welcome Ms. Paleki Ayang to the Council .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: We should hear the voices of women activists from civil society in the Chamber more often .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: I would like to begin with the words of another activist , Nobel Laureate Leymah Gbowee .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: In 2003 , her group Women of Liberia Mass Action for Peace successfully pressed Charles Taylor to attend peace talks .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: Talking afterwards , she said ,  " We are now taking this stand to secure the future of our children , because we believe , as custodians of society ,  tomorrow our children will ask us ,  ' Mama , what was your role during the crisis ? "
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: '  " What was your role during the crisis ? "
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: The answer to that question for so many women in Africa is not negotiator ;  it is not envoy ;  it is not delegate even ,  and that needs to change .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: It is not just about ending gender inequality .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: It is not just a women 's issue ;  it is a peace issue .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: When women 's voices are heard in peace processes , in negotiations and in State - building , the chances of a lasting peace increase .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: If we are serious about truly resolving conflicts and preserving peace  - not just for hours , but for generations -  we must heed the words of Leymah Gbowee and our briefer Paleki Ayang .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: They demonstrate just how powerful community - based activism can be .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: Just think how powerful those women 's voices could have been  had they actually been in the room at key times in peace processes .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: So ,  whether in Africa or in any other part of the world ,  we need to make sure that women are playing the fullest role in conflict resolution .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: I am proud  that all future United Kingdom - hosted peacebuilding events will ensure that women 's voices are heard .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: If the rest of the Council were to follow suit ,  then we would send a strong message to the rest of the world .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: Russia 's major military build - up along Ukraine 's eastern border has been a significant and deliberation provocation that only further escalates tensions and the likelihood of conflict .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: It deepens Russia 's own isolation  and also , of course , strengthens the resolve of the international community to stand with and support Ukraine  as it seeks to maintain its sovereignty and territorial integrity .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The only way forward , as we all know , is de - escalation , dialogue and the free elections that are planned for 25 May .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: And Ukraine must be allowed to prepare for those elections without the interference and coercion we are witnessing .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: But talks can take place only with genuine commitment and good faith on all sides .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The talks between Russia , Ukraine , the European Union and the United States planned for 17 April are an essential step in that direction ,  but can take place successfully only on that basis .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Attempts to change the facts on the ground are completely contrary to dialogue and peaceful resolution .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: We call on Russia to work immediately to reduce tensions , stop its destabilization and withdraw its forces from the provocative posture they have assumed on Ukraine 's border .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: We have heard assurances in the past that Russia will take such action .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: It now really is imperative that it do so .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: We are truly shocked  by the number of victims among the civilian population in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: Armed separatists , terrorists and foreign fighters and their supporters bear the responsibility for the deaths and injuries among the civilian population ,  including children , women and the elderly .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: The carnage must end .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: President Poroshenko proposed a peace plan .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: Ukraine declared a unilateral ceasefire .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: The agreement in Berlin on 2 July provided a vehicle for talks .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: Yet separatists and terrorists in the eastern part of Ukraine continued to sow terror , loot , rob banks , racketeer , kidnap people and traffic in human beings .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: The massive and continuous influx of foreign fighters from across the Russian border into the neighbouring Luhansk and Donetsk regions has gone unabated .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: That influx has been accompanied by T-65 tanks , Grad multiple rocket launchers , anti - aircraft guns , towed anti - tank guns , BTR armoured personnel carriers , man - portable air defence systems and small arms .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: In fact , the terrorists in Donbas hardly bothered to remove the markings of Russian military units from their heavy weapons .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: Russian military helicopters and drones violate Ukrainian airspace ,  while 40,000 troops are encamped within minutes of the Ukrainian border ,  in addition to the 20,000 troops stationed in occupied Crimea .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: Russian citizens ,  many of whom are veterans of the conflicts in Chechnya and Transdnistria ,  lead many of the terrorist groups .
speaker: Mr. Baublys

sentence_text: With or without a resolution , the message from Council members and the wider international community has been overwhelming .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The de - escalation of the current crisis is imperative .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Russia must pull back its forces to their bases  and decrease their numbers to agreed levels .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: It must allow international observers access to Crimea .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: It must demonstrate its respect for the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine ,  including by desisting from any recognition of or action on the basis of the results of the Crimean referendum .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: It must engage in direct dialogue with Ukraine ,  as Ukraine has repeatedly requested ,  either bilaterally or through a diplomatic mechanism such as a contact group .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Russia can be under no misapprehension about the action the international community is demanding it take .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Should it fail to respond , there will be consequences .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The international community will demand it .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The recent events in south - eastern Ukraine and the country as a whole are of the most serious concern .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The Kyiv regime ,   spurred on by Western well - wishers ,   are stubbornly pushing the country to disaster .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Today , Western colleagues have spoken many critical words regarding the activities of protesters in south - eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: If our Western colleagues had actually demonstrated a tenth of that commitment to maintaining order during the events at the Maidan   then perhaps the current crisis could have been prevented .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: ( spoke in English )
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I am sincerely thankful to the members of the Security Council who spoke in favour of a peaceful resolution of the problems in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I am sincerely thankful for that .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I also thank the members of the Security Council for understanding the critical situation in Ukraine  and for any kind of support they can provide .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Mr. Churkin is absolutely right ,  there is not much time left at all ,  there is just about an hour and a half .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: It is just as easy for him to call his President  and say a few simple things to him  as it is for me to do so ,  so I will repeat them here .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The statement that Mr. Churkin has referred very negatively to several times today was made by the acting President , Mr. Turchynov ,  and was addressed to those people who are now creating tension in those towns , the terrorist groups of separatists .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: He stated :  ( spoke in English ) " Those not involved in shooting at Ukrainian law enforcement officers and who will surrender their weapons and leave State administrative buildings  will be released from prosecution . "
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: ( spoke in Russian )
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Why do they not call their people  and tell them to come back ,  sit down around the negotiating table  and decide together  how we can establish good neighbourly relations ?
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: That would be the right thing to do .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The Government mentioned  the referendum , changes to the Constitution , the retention of the language law and the fact that the problems that have cropped up over the decades and remained unsolved by previous Governments needed to be addressed at last .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: That is something that we need to do ,  but we are being prevented from doing so .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I would like Mr. Churkin to listen to that  and convey what he can to his Government .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: We have raised our concern several times here in the Chamber  that Russian nationals are directly participating in destabilizing the situation in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Some colleagues have today given some information about the Luhansk and Donetsk leaders proclaiming republics .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: All their military commanders are of Russian origin .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Illegal armed groups of fighters are stepping up their recruitment efforts within Russia .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: They seek volunteers with experience in operating heavy weapons , such as tanks and air defence equipment .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Russia has allowed the establishment of recruitment offices in Moscow and Rostov ,  which are openly recruiting and sending Russian nationals to Ukraine 's eastern regions .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Yesterday at the press conference , we described all the websites that are calling for recruits .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Numerous groups of Russian paramilitary formations ,  including Russian Cossacks ,  are actively supporting the terrorists in spreading terror and chaos in the eastern part of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Throughout the entire period of such articifically created confrontations ,  supported by Russia ,  that country has never publically called on its citizens to refrain from joining the illegal armed groups operating on the territory of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: That fact speaks for itself .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Paragraph 2 of article 208 of the criminal code of the Russian Federation states the following .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: " Participation in armed groups that are not governed by federal law ,  as well as participation in such armed groups on the territory of a foreign State for any purpose against the interests of the Russian Federation ,  is punishable by 5 to 10 years ' imprisonment " .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Since no Russian national has been brought to justice for such actions ,  there is only one conclusion :  their participation in illegal armed groups on the territory of Ukraine does not contradict the interests of the Russian Federation .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I shall now make a statement in my capacity as the representative of Luxembourg .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Luxembourg deeply regrets  that the draft resolution ( S/2104/189 ) .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: proposed by the United States ofAmerica , on the situation in Ukraine was not adopted  because of the vote against it by Russia , a permanent member of the Council .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Luxembourg voted in favour of the draft resolution  and is also a sponsor of the text ,  as did many United Nations States Members .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Why ?
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Because the draft resolution was based on principles and dialogue .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: First , with regard to the principles , the draft resolution was intended to recall the purposes and principles of the United Nations ,  as set out in particular in Article 2 of the Charter .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The draft resolution was intended to reaffirm the Security Council 's support for the sovereignty , independence , unity and the territorial integrity of Ukraine within its internationally recognized borders .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The Security Council should be unanimous in upholding those principles .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The Charter ofthe United Nations states  that in discharging its duties the Security Council " shall act in accordance with the purposes and principles of the United Nations " .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Today , the Russian veto prevented the Security Council from complying with that provision .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: While innovative methods have been found ,  they remain on the sidelines  and have not been fully exploited within official frameworks .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: The conclusions  that were adopted by the Commission on the Status ofWomen this past Friday  affirmed  the need for the participation of women in conflict prevention and resolution .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: They also affirmed  the importance of the implementation of the Beijing Programme of Action and of achieving genuine , comprehensive gender equality .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: Those frameworks and mechanisms are very important ,  but to date they have not ensured the required level of participation .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: On that account , I would like to share the following remarks .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: Mr. Gaspar Martins took the Chair .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: First , Egypt supports  the call of the Secretary - General to strengthen the role of women in peacekeeping activities , mediation and the prevention of conflicts .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: That call was supported by the three major reviews carried out recently in that area .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: We have also seen tangible evidence  of the importance of the role of women in their countries , especially in Liberia , Malawi and Central Africa ,  where women are successfully governing .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: Second , there are large gaps in terms of the Council 's resolutions and their follow - up .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: We therefore need to adopt a methodology that will enable us to bridge those gaps  so as to ensure the comprehensive implementation of those resolutions .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: We also need to step up the role of the Informal Experts Group set up in resolution 2242 ( 2015 ) .
speaker: Mr. Mahmoud

sentence_text: A good example of cooperation is the African Union 's five - year Gender , Peace and Security Programme for the period 2015 - 2020 .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: In order to achieve results in implementing the agenda on women and peace and security ,  there needs to be a balanced , system - wide approach that provides for the full - fledged participation of women in peace processes throughout the continent and in post - conflict reconstruction .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: No less pressing is the need to ensure the effectiveness of efforts  to deal with violence against women during armed conflicts in Africa .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: There is also a need to ensure that the inclusion of gender aspects in our work on the ground does not become an end in itself  and is not only declarative in nature .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: We should aim at achieving real results .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: In that context , it is important to bear in mind that national plans of action for the implementation of resolution 1325 ( 2000 ) can not be used as an instrument for assessing the policy of States in terms of their gender - promotion policies .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: We need to bear in mind  that the protection of women during the course of armed conflicts  and steps to afford them equal opportunities for participation in efforts to achieve peace and security  are the primary responsibility of the States involved in such conflicts .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: The international community and the United Nations must provide them assistance in that regard .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: One of the main objectives of peacekeeping and peacebuilding efforts should be the restoration of normal life and the elimination of the consequences of conflicts ,  as well as safeguarding the security of all strata and groups of the population .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: As we have noted earlier ,  greater effectiveness of the work of the Security Council is not always achieved through the establishment of new structures .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: That is the reason for our doubts with regard to the usefulness of setting up the Informal Experts Group on Women , Peace and Security .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: We stand ready to cooperate with other members of the Council on this very important topic  in order to develop effective and tried methods .
speaker: Mr. Zagaynov

sentence_text: There is substantial video evidence of armed attacks using gunfire on local Ukrainian police stations , in Slavyansk and Kramatorsk in particular .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Those videos ,  which have been widely broadcast on international television channels and over the Internet ,  have left absolutely no doubt that the terrorist groups are not the peaceful protesters  that our Russian colleagues claim  them to be .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Rather , they are professional special forces appropriately equipped and armed by the Russian Federation .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Terrorists have started using their weapons against Ukrainian law enforcement and military officers .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: This morning in Slavyansk the auto convoy of the Ukrainian military was attacked by gunmen using automatic weapons .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Terrorists shot and killed Captain Gennady Belichenko of the Ukrainian security services ,  while " Alfa " Commander Kuznietsov and Colonel Kuksa were seriously wounded , as was a police officer named Selikhov .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: In the light of the aforementioned facts , the National Security and Defence Council of Ukraine ,  pursuant to our anti - terrorism law of 2003 ,  has adopted a decision to launch a large - scale counter - terrorist operation involving the special units of the Ukrainian armed forces .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: We are not going to let the Crimea scenario be repeated in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: We have not imposed a state of emergency as is required by the provisions of the Constitution of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Instead , we have prepared a counterinsurgency plan to strike at the armed terrorists .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Ukrainian law - enforcement agencies have credible evidence of these persons ' involvement in serious crimes .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Today , some ofthose crimes have been described .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Among them was the brutal story of Volodymyr Rybak , a member of Horlivka 's City Council , and Yuriy Popravko , a l9 - year - old activist from Kyiv ,   who were martyred by members of terrorist groups .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Their bodies ,   mutilated by torture ,   were found in the Torets River in the vicinity of Sloviansk .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Volodymyr Rybak disappeared on 17 April in Horlivka   after he tried to remove the separatists ' flag from the building of Horlivka City Council .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: A video of the kidnapping , as well as audio recordings of phone conversations intercepted by Ukraine 's Security Service , provided sufficient proof   that terrorist leaders , notably the self - proclaimed mayor of Sloviansk , Vyacheslav Ponomaryov , and the military commander of the terrorists , the Russian agent Igor Strelkov , were involved in the murder .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The true identity of the Russian agent has been established as Colonel Igor Girkin of Russian military intelligence ,   who is registered as a permanent resident of Moscow .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: In doing so , the United Nations will ensure that its peacekeepers ,  who are sometimes the last hope for people suffering in conflicts ,  are deployed to protect people .
speaker: Mr. Yoshikawa

sentence_text: By taking the appropriate actions ,  they can also preserve the honour of the vast majority of peacekeepers from Africa , the Asia - Pacific , Latin America and the Caribbean , and Europe , including my own country , Japan ,  which are fulfilling their tasks seriously in difficult circumstances .
speaker: Mr. Yoshikawa

sentence_text: It is our belief that resolution 2272 ( 2016 ) will send a clear message  that the Security Council fully supports the zero - tolerance policy called for by the Secretary - General .
speaker: Mr. Yoshikawa

sentence_text: What has Russia done for its part of the Geneva document ?
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: It has done nothing .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Because of the lack of support for the separatists among the population of eastern Ukraine ,   Russia is seeking new ways to destabilize the situation in the region ,   preparing and carrying out numerous armed provocations through its agents .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Russian - sponsored illegal paramilitary units have continued to destabilize the situation in eastern Ukraine ,   preparing the ground for a new stage of military aggression .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The Russian leadership has done nothing   to publicly dissociate itself from the armed separatists and provocateurs   or to urge them to immediately lay down their arms and release captured administrative buildings .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Russia has not even condemned the seizure of hostages , including journalists , or separatists ' open acts of xenophobia and anti - Semitism .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Any attempts by Russia   to show that the Ukrainian Government is trying to use force against the peaceful Ukrainian population   are lies .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Our Government respects freedom of expression and the right to peaceful assembly ,   which are guaranteed by the Constitution of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: However , when heavily armed , professionally trained groups led by Russian military seize law - enforcement facilities and administrative offices , kill Ukrainian police officers and take hostages ,   they are operating like terrorists   and must be treated accordingly .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Ukrainian counter - terrorism operations are targeted exclusively at illegal armed groups threatening civilians .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Meanwhile , the Russian - controlled army groups are in fact holding the entire civilian population of several towns in the eastern region hostage   and have thus transgressed the bounds of humanity .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: It is because of such continued destabilizing Russian actions  that the United States imposed sanctions on the defence , energy and financial sectors of the Russian economy ,  including financial institutions .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The measures include freezing the assets ofRussian defence companies  and blocking new financing of some of Russia 's most important banks and energy companies .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The sanctions are significant ,  but they are also targeted and designed to have the maximum impact on the Russian calculus  while limiting the impact on the Russian people and any spillover effects on our interests or those of our allies .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: This week , the European Union also announced  expanded sanctions on Russia .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The message is unified and clear :  if President Putin continues to choose escalation over de - escalation ,  the international community will continue to impose costs on Russia .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: But that is not what any of us want .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We and our allies remain committed to a diplomatic solution ,  as are the Ukrainian Government and the Ukrainian people ,  who have seen their neighbours , friends and family members killed in a needless conflict .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: It is deeply regrettable that there was no unanimity  and that there was an attempt to weaken the resolution through a draft amendment .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: What does that say to the victims , the women and girls whom we heard so poignantly about yesterday ,  that some members of this Council would seek to weaken our response ,  rather than endorse meaningful action ?
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: The United Kingdom voted against the draft amendment  because not holding perpetrators accountable is unacceptable .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: Had the draft amendment succeeded ,  the Secretary - General would not have had a lever to apply pressure for accountability .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: I want to conclude with the words of a teenage girl from Bangui .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: Speaking to ajournalist earlier this year ,  she said :  "
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: Sometimes when I am alone with my baby I think about killing him .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: He reminds me of the man who raped me . "
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: ( The Washington Post , 27 February 2016 )
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: Those are difficult words to read in the Council ,  but this is the reality of sexual exploitation and abuse .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: It is a reality created by a peacekeeper who was entrusted to help , not harm , that teenage girl .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: It is a reality that we simply can not shy away from .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: We must confront it  and we must end it .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: This resolution today is a vital step towards doing so .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Mr. Rycroft

sentence_text: In the press statement agreed earlier today ,  the members of the Security Council expressed their condolences  and called  for an international investigation and appropriate accountability .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: That is welcome ,  but it is not enough .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: The Council must go further .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: It should come together behind a clear demand  that the armed separatist groups should lay down their arms  and pursue whatever political legitimate objectives they may have through exclusively peaceful and democratic means ,  and that the flow of arms , fighters and logistical support to the armed separatists be fully halted  and the borders secured .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: In the light of yesterday 's tragedy , any other course of action would be unconscionable .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: We condemn  the abuse  and we condemn  the lack of accountability ,  and then we go to the General Assembly  and some of us try to water down provisions  to try to strengthen the system .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: What is up with that ?
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: One can not simultaneously try to water something down in the General Assembly  and then complain  when the body that sends peacekeepers out to try to protect people  actually takes responsibility for the fact  that some of those who were supposed to do the protecting are committing sexual abuse .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We can not have it both ways .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: If the General Assembly had been able to actually put in place methods for accountability ,  if the system were working for girls like the ones Matthew just quoted ,  who are now left with the children of the people who have come and raped them  and then gone back to their countries never having been held accountable -  if the system had prevented these kinds of acts ,  or least had some kind of accountability ,  we would not be having this conversation .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We are here only because it just keeps happening .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Noting that the plane went down in an area under the control of armed rebel groups ,  we urge  that those groups cooperate fully and unconditionally with the investigation into the crash .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: We have no doubt that ,  without the ongoing conflict in Ukraine and the widespread insecurity and lawlessness engendered by the activities of the rebel groups in the eastern part of the country ,  this tragic accident would not have occurred .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: We want to renew our call  for a cessation of hostilities in Ukraine and a return to dialogue and negotiation , within the framework of the Geneva statement of 17 April and the 2 July four - party talks in Berlin .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: Let us together resolve this issue .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu
