sentence_text: Let us together close this war front ,  before its reverberations become manifest in other parts of the world .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: China welcomes Angola 's initiative to convene this debate .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: China expresses its appreciation to you , Minister Delgado , for presiding over this meeting .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: I also wish to thank Ms. Mlambo - Ngcuka , Assistant Secretary - General Zerihoun , Ambassador Kamau and Ambassador Antonio for their briefings .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: China also listened attentively to the statement made by the representative of the South Sudan Women 's Empowerment Network .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: The current international security situation is complex and challenging .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: In particular , regions like Africa and the Middle East have long been mired in war and conflict .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: Many women are victims of violence and the threat of terror .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: On the other hand , women are increasingly important players in the prevention and resolution of regional conflicts .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: The international community should step up protection of the rights and interests of women in conflict  and give women a greater role in conflict prevention and resolution .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: First , we should enhance protection for women in conflict ,  it is incumbent upon the international community to adopt effective measures to maximize security assurances for women affected by conflict .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: In providing humanitarian assistance to conflict areas ,  we should focus in particular on the needs of women and other vulnerable groups .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: The provisions of relevant Council resolutions on the protection of women in conflict must be implemented to the letter .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: United Nations peacekeeping operations should ,  within the purview of their respective mandates ,  assist host countries in safeguarding the security of women in conflict  and should effectively implement a zero - tolerance policy toward sexual violence .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: Highlighting examples of how women have made a difference in preventing and resolving conflict in Africa demonstrates the practical benefits of women 's participation .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: Take , for example , the role that women 's groups continue to play in de - escalating and preventing election - related violence .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: The establishment of women 's situation rooms and the deployment of trained female election monitors in Senegal , Kenya , Nigeria and , most recently , in the Central African Republic have had a measurable impact on preventing , monitoring and mitigating incidents of violence and intimidation .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: Women 's groups also play a key role in de - escalating crises and advocating for an end to conflict .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: The critical role played by the movement Women of Liberia Mass Action for Peace in ending the conflict in that country is well documented .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: Women have also mobilized to support peace in Burundi by bringing parties together to engage in dialogue .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: A nationwide network of women mediators ,  established by the United Nations in close partnership with the Ministry of the Interior and civil society organizations ,  has effectively prevented violence at the local level ,  dispelled false rumours  and mitigated the impact of the ongoing political crisis on everyday people .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: As the mediation process in Burundi moves forward , those gains must not be side - lined or suppressed .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: The efforts of those women ,  undertaken with minimal resources and at personal risk ,  deserve more than our applause ;  they deserve support and empowerment ,  because what they do works .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: We have taken particular note of the steps  called for by Ms. Paleki Ayang  to end sexual violence in South Sudan as a necessary ingredient to rebuilding peace in her country .
speaker: Mrs. Schwalger

sentence_text: Let me quote a statement  made today by Ukraine 's acting President Oleksandr Turchynov :  " A particularly dangerous situation has arisen in the city of Slavyansk ,  where professionally trained armed troops wearing Russian armed forces camouflage without insignia shattered the peace .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: This morning , a convoy of law enforcement officers who sought to protect the citizens of Slavyansk were attacked with assault rifles .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The criminals opened intense fire  using local people as human shields .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The blood of Ukrainians has been shed for one undivided sovereign Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: That blood has been shed in a war  that Russia is waging against Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The aggressor has not stopped ,  and continues to organize unrest in the eastern regions of our country .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: It is not a war between Ukrainians .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The situation of confrontation was artificially created with the aim of weakening and destroying Ukraine itself . "
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Within a short period of time , approximately one and half months , the Ukrainian Government has done everything possible to avoid confrontation through an inclusive approach to each and every region .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Recently , Mr. Yatsenyuk , the Prime Minister of Ukraine , visited the southern and eastern regions - Donetsk , Lugansk , Kharkiv , Dnepropetrovsk , Odessa *  addressing  such issues of concern as the language policy and prospects for decentralization of power and constitutional reforms .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The Government is ready to consider the significant empowerment of local authorities in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Unfortunately , the efforts of the Government of Ukraine have been severely challenged by recent developments in the eastern regions .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: But when it came to the south - eastern regions of Ukraine ,  somehow such tactics were unacceptable .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: A month and a half elapsed between 21 February and 6 April ;  a month and a half had gone by since the overthrow of President Yanukovych  and the conclusion of the agreement that could have prevented an escalation of the situation .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: From the very beginning , all we said was that it was essential to conclude that agreement ;  that perhaps a constitutional assembly should be convoked ;  and that some decisive gesture should be made towards the south - eastern regions of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Was any such gesture made ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Finally , Mr. Yatsenyuk came ,  said something  and left .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Then Mr. Turchynov came the next day  and did not seem to agree with him .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It seemed they preferred to use force .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I first want to say to our colleagues whose citizens were involved  that we convey our deepest condolences to their families , citizens and Governments .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: Yesterday at noon , the world watched in horror the downing of the Malaysian jetliner .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: What happened yesterday seemed to be an apocalyptic end to the world .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: I think Ambassador Power described it similarly .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: The spectacle is graphically described , respectively , in chapters 8 and 9 of the Book of Revelation :  " hail and fire mingled with blood , and they were cast upon the Earth " ,  " the sun and the air were darkened " .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: That was what I saw yesterday .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: No matter our religious beliefs , that scenario may become a self - fulfilling prophesy  if States continue to choose to open or support theatres of war and conflict in every corner of the world .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: What will happen is that the world will self - annihilate .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: Enough is enough .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: The fact that this incident occurred as the plane flew over eastern Ukraine ,  which , for some time now , has been a zone of conflict ,  indicates that the accident may be connected , in one way or another , to the conflict .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: But this is not the time to play the blame game .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: If it is established that the plane was shot down deliberately ,  it will mark a new dimension in the Ukraine crisis ,  one that represents a grave threat to the safety of international civil aviation .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: At this point , it is of critical importance for the facts surrounding the crash to be dispassionately well - ascertained .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: In that regard , we would like to express our full support for an independent international investigation ,  as called for by the Secretary - General .
speaker: Mrs. Ngu

sentence_text: The Summit was attended by Chinese President Xi Jinping and representatives from over 140 countries , including 85 Heads of State and Government .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: The event had a significant and far - reaching impact on the development of the global women 's cause .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: China decided to contribute $ 10 million to the United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: Over the next five years , China will adopt a series of initiatives  to help developing countries overcome the difficulties facing women and girls with regard to their access to medical care and education ,  strengthen training for local women  and , through a fund created in partnership with the United Nations , roll out projects dedicated to capacity - building for womin developing countries .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: China attaches great importance to working with Africa ,  promoting the cause of women and  intensifying support for African women in the political , economic , cultural , educational and health domains .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: The 2015 Johannesburg Action Plan of the Forum on China - Africa Cooperation called for intensified pragmatic cooperation between China and Africa in the area of women 's affairs and for dialogue between female leaders .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: The assistance provided by China in recent years covers almost all African countries .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: China also provided women and girls in Ebola - afflicted West African countries , such as Sierra Leone and Liberia , with a large amount of assistance in kind  to support Africa 's efforts to upgrade its public - health system and emergency - response capacity on all fronts .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: Going forward , China will implement 200 Happy Life projects across Africa and 100 village - level agricultural development projects ,  build industrial parks and vocational training centres on a collaborative basis , and provide training for 200,000 technical specialists .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: These cooperative projects will benefit the people of Africa ,  and in particular bring new opportunities and new hope for the development of African women ,  thereby creating new conditions for conflict resolution .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: China stands ready to continue working with the international community  to jointly help women achieve comprehensive development  and fully engage in political , economic and social life  so that they can contribute more positive energy to the peace , development and prosperity of the African continent and makes their own important contributions .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jieyi

sentence_text: The referendum of 16 March is part of a vicious cycle .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The decision  taken on 1 March by the Council of the Russian Federation to authorize the use of the Russian armed forces on Ukrainian territory ,  and the subsequent actions undertaken ,  constitute a flagrant violation of international law .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Those actions violate the commitments Russia entered into with regard to Ukraine within the framework of the Budapest Memorandum of 1994 and the Treaty of Friendship , Cooperation and Partnership Agreement between Russia and Ukraine , signed in 1997 .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Had it been adopted ,  the draft resolution would have helped to put an end to that vicious cycle and the nationalist escalation that accompanies it .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Today 's vote is a failure - a failure for the Security Council and the United Nations , but also , and above all , a failure for Russia .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Would it be naive to hope that , despite that failure , we can still find a peaceful solution to the crisis  that Russia is imposing on Ukraine and the international community ?
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: For its part , Luxembourg will not abandon that hope .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Even if diplomatic efforts have not yet borne fruit ,  they must continue to achieve a solution  that respects the political independence , sovereignty , unity and territorial integrity of Ukraine , in the interest of peace , stability and prosperity in Europe .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: I resume my functions as President of the Council .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: I give the floor to the representative of Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: In Geneva , there was agreement on the need for a full rejection of extremism .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: However , the Right Sector Banderists ,   instead of laying down their weapons ,   headed to the east of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: As was declared , the Banderist army crossed the Dnepr .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Neither the Right Sector with its Nazi slogans nor any other radical organizations have laid down their arms .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: On the contrary , those groups have become legal .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: They are forming military battalions with names like Dnepr and Donbass in their ranks .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: How could the militias in the east be convinced to disarm or vacate buildings   if they have been surrounded ,   as has happened in Sloviansk , by subdivisions of the Ukrainian armed forces and the so - called National Guard , comprised of fighters from the Right Sector .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: In Geneva , there was agreement that there had to be a single approach to all illicit activities in Ukraine from whichever side they might emanate   - that is , from Kyiv , the west , the east or the south .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: However , the Maidan remains occupied   - cement blockades are still in place -   as are several buildings in Kyiv .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: No one has liberated anything in Kyiv .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: In Washington , DC , they are saying , uncritically ,   that the buildings have been legally rented .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: But by whom ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: They have been rented by armed fighters .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I would like to express my sincere gratitude to the members of the Security Council for their overwhelming support of the draft resolution contained in document S/2104 / l89 ,  as well as for their support in trying to resolve the crisis by diplomatic and political means .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I would like to thank all the sponsors of the draft resolution for their support .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: In this difficult time for my country , we really need their support ,  and I want to assure them that it is highly appreciated by the people of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I would like to particularly thank the Member States who are the guarantors of the Budapest Memorandum who supported Ukraine  - the United States , the United Kingdom , France and China -  and who several times spoke in favour of territorial integrity .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: It is awful that the other one , the fifth guarantor , the Russian Federation , violated its own obligations .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: All the appeals by the united membership to the wisdom of the Russian leadership were not successful .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I received a call 40 minutes ago as we were discussing the crisis in Crimea , Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Members noticed  that somebody called me .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Russian troops entered the mainland from the south , from Crimea .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Now we are facing a new development  and we are to face an even more dangerous stance of the Russian Federation .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I appeal to all Council members to find the means and measures in the Security Council and the United Nations , as well as at the bilateral level , to do the utmost possible to stop the aggressor , the Russian delegation , present in the Chamber .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The Russian Federation is challenging the very principles  on which this Organization , the United Nations , is built  and which supported the international system for the past seven decades .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: We deplore this veto .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: The world can not allow a repetition of 1956 , 1968 or 2008 in Europe .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: We call on all Member States and regional and international organizations not to recognize the results of the referendum in Crimea  and not to recognize any alteration of the status of Crimea  carried out in clear and obvious violation of the Constitution of Ukraine , a United Nations founding Member .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: We call on Russia  to disown the illegal referendum in Crimea .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: International observers , monitors and mediators have been invited by the Ukrainian Government and must be allowed to do their job .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: We also urge Russia  to reaffirm its treaty obligations vis - a - vis Ukraine , including respect for its sovereignty , territorial integrity and political independence ,  and to withdraw without delay its armed forces to the areas of their permanent stations .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Only political dialogue and full respect of the Charter of the United Nations and international law can put an end to the crisis and prevent further bloodshed .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Here is what we know .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: In the past few weeks , Russia has increased the number of tanks , armoured vehicles and rocket launchers in south - west Russia .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: More advanced air defence systems have also arrived .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Moscow recently transferred Soviet- era tanks and artillery to the separatists , and several military vehicles crossed the border .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: After recapturing several Ukrainian cities last weekend ,  Ukrainian officials discovered caches of weapons long associated with Russian stockpiles ,  including MANPADs , mines , grenades , meals ready to eat , vehicles and a pontoon bridge .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Ukrainian forces have discovered large amounts of other Russian - provided military equipment ,  including accompanying documentation verifying Russian origin , in the areas they have liberated from separatists in recent days .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Recruiting efforts for separatist fighters are expanding inside Russia ,  and separatists have openly said  that they were looking for volunteers with experience in operating heavy weapons such as tanks and air defences .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russia has allowed officials from the Donetsk People 's Republic  to establish a recruiting office in Moscow .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Ukrainian pilot Nadia Savchenko ,  who has long had a distinguished career in the Ukrainian military ,  was taken by separatists in mid - June .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: She is now being held - where ?
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: - in a prison in Voronezh , Russia .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: According to the Ukrainian Government ,  she was transferred to Russia by separatists .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russia continues to redeploy new forces extremely close to the Ukrainian border .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: In addition , on Monday , a Ukrainian air force cargo plane was shot down in Ukrainian air space ,  and on Wednesday a Ukrainian fighter jet was also shot down in Ukrainian air space .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: In both instances ,  the Ukrainian Government believes  that the planes were fired on from Russian territory .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The key to resolving the crisis in Ukraine is to act within the framework of law and order ,  seeking an early solution to the differences through dialogue and negotiations ,  with due respect for the legitimate rights and interests of all those in the various communities and regions .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: All parties should move forward in the overall aim of maintaining regional peace and stability  and of protecting the fundamental interests of all the communities in Ukraine  in order to keep calm ,  exercise restraint  and prevent a further escalation of the tension ,  while resolutely seeking a political solution  so as to find a specific way out as soon as possible .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: China has been calling  for constructive efforts and the good offices of the international community to de - escalate the situation in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: We note  the new developments and proposals in that regard .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: Drafting a resolution at this juncture will only lead to confrontation  and further complicate the situation .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: It is not in line with the common interests ofboth the people of Ukraine and the international community .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: On the basis of the above , we could only abstain in the voting on the draft resolution ( S/2014/189 ) .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: China holds a fair and impartial position on the issue of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: We will continue to mediate  and to promote dialogue  so as to play a greater contructive role in seeking a political solution to the crisis in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: To that end , we would like to make three proposals .
speaker: Mr. Liu J Ieyi

sentence_text: In that regard , we appeal to all conflicting blocs in Ukraine to pause a little ,  close their ears to all aggravating rhetoric  and give intercommunal talks a chance .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: If there is a need for credible mediators , the United Nations should rise to playing that role .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: Once again , we invite both sides to consider the mutual interests of the people of Ukraine  and to uphold their commitment to bilateral and multilateral agreements .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: We call  on the international community to fulfil its obligation ,  to ensure no further deterioration  and to respect the principles of peace and security .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: Finally , this situation is not a win or a loss to any of us .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: Also , it should not be seen as bringing dishonour to any of us .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: But let it be a lesson to us all  to truly commit and constructively work towards finding a sustainable solution to the process .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: We once again reaffirm   our full support for Ukraine 's sovereignty , independence and territorial integrity .
speaker: Ms. Paik Ji-Ah

sentence_text: I wish to thank Under - Secretary - General Feltman for his briefing .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi

sentence_text: The crisis in Ukraine is the result of a complex fabric of historical and contemporary factors .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi

sentence_text: A political solution is the only way to end the crisis .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi

sentence_text: To tackle the crisis at its roots ,   both the current situation and the historical facts must be considered ,   taking into account the legitimate rights , interests and demands of the various regions and ethnic communities of Ukraine   and the legitimate concerns of all the parties concerned ,   with a view to achieving a balance ofinterests for all .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi

sentence_text: For some time now , various parties including China , have been vigorously engaged in mediation efforts and pushing for talks   in order to ease the crisis in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi

sentence_text: The Geneva agreement reached between Russia , the United States , the European Union and Ukraine calls   for measures to de - escalate the Ukrainian situation ,   thereby sending a positive signal for a political solution to the crisis .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi

sentence_text: Regrettably , tensions in eastern and south- eastern Ukraine have worsened ,   with each side more vehemently accusing the other .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi

sentence_text: Threats and sanctions have again replaced dialogue and negotiation .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi

sentence_text: China hopes   that all parties concerned will keep in mind the broader picture of regional peace and stability ,   and the fundamental interests of all ethnic groups in Ukraine , maintain restraint , persevere in dialogue and consultations ,   effectively implement the agreement already reached by all of the parties   and continue to push for a political solution to the crisis   so as to achieve stability and development in Ukraine as soon as possible .
speaker: Mr. Liu Jie-Yi

sentence_text: Our South - South cooperation with Africa ,  a key priority of Brazilian foreign policy ,  is closely aligned with the women and peace and security agenda .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: In Guinea - Bissau , we helped enable health institutions  to assist women and girl victims of gender - based violence .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: In the Democratic Republic of the Congo , we have financed projects  to assist victims of sexual and gender - based violence .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: In this respect , I can not fail to refer to the inspiring work of Dr. Denis Mukwege ,  a physician who has treated thousands of survivors of rape in Bukavu , Democratic Republic of the Congo ,  and a role model not just in Africa ,  but worldwide .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: Through the Guinea - Bissau configuration of the Peacebuilding Commission , I have witnessed first - hand the essential role played by women in building sustainable peace .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: The Brazilian Peace Operations Joint Training Center in Rio de Janeiro regularly holds workshops and courses  to train peacekeepers on gender issues and the protection of women ,  where rigorous standards regarding the conduct and discipline of personnel are upheld .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: Ukraine is living up to its Geneva commitments .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: It has submitted to Parliament a draft law on amnesty for protesters who surrender their weapons .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: It has initiated a process of constitutional reform aimed at decentralizing power .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: It has committed   to holding a broad public debate on possible constitutional changes and sought proposals for constitutional reform .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: It is working to disarm radical movements .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The Ukrainian Government has also said   that it will guarantee the rights of Russian speakers to use their own language .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: It has strongly condemned   xenophobia , intolerance and anti - Semitism   and begun an investigation into the distribution of anti - Semitic leaflets in Donetsk .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: It has invited all political groups   to discuss ways to resolve the crisis in eastern Ukraine   and it has supported the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe ( OSCE ) in its work to de - escalate tensions .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: But what has Russian done since 17 April to honour its Geneva commitments ?
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Disappointingly , all evidence at hand points to Russia 's continued determination to promote instability and challenge Ukraine 's authority over its sovereign territory .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Russia 's claims   that it has no agency in or influence over the actions of armed militia groups operating in eastern Ukraine are not credible .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The seizure of OSCE observers on 25 April in Sloviansk and their mistreatment and their continued detention is a deplorable and cynical act against impartial international personnel working to bring peace and stability to the region ,   an act clearly intended to impede the ability of all OSCE monitors to work in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: We call for their immediate release .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The Russian Federation has called for this emergency meeting of the Security Council  because of the serious dangerous evolution of the situation in south - eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: We have pointed out on several occasions ,  including in this Chamber ,  that the reckless actions that led to the coup d'etat by the self - proclaimed Kyiv authorities threaten to definitively destroy the fragile mosaic of Ukrainian society .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The authorities do not wish to listen to those who do not accept the imposed dominance of Kyiv by national radicals and chauvinistic , Russophobic and anti - Semitic forces ,  whom they perceive as a threat to their human dignity and to their very lives .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Grotesque Russophobia and entrenched hatred have become the norm in the Verkhovna Rada as well .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: A few days ago , a member of Parliament belonging to the chauvinist Svoboda party said this about the Russian - speaking inhabitants of Ukraine :  " I would have acted much more harshly .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I would simply have shot them .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The enemy is prevailing in our land .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: They should have been chased out in 1654 .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: These creatures deserve only one thing - death . "
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It should be noted that this was said by a woman .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: We can only imagine the thoughts that must be churning in the minds of her brutal fellow partisans .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: And that is not even the most radical group on the Ukrainian political spectrum .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Should we be surprised that the peaceful political protects and the call by the people of south - eastern Ukraine for their aspirations to be heard have been met by the Rada with draconic laws entailing long - term prison sentences for separatism ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The events of the past two days have shown that ,  following our many calls for the organization of inclusive national political dialogue ,  a measure of common sense has prevailed in Kyiv .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Prime Minister Yatsenyuk went to Donetsk ;  although he did not meet with the protesters ,  he did say  the right things about dialogue , decentralization and his desire to find a way out of the problem .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Incidentally , some very worrying tones have crept into our numerous contacts with our Western colleagues .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: As the Council knows ,  our Minister for Foreign Affairs , Mr. Sergei Lavrov , has been talking to Secretary of State Kerry on the phone almost every day .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Kerry continually claims  to understand our concern  that in contacts with the Ukrainian authorities genuine efforts should be made  to ensure that they demonstrate a better grasp of the concerns of the south - eastern regions of Ukraine regarding a definition of their autonomy , independence and language rights .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: And then suddenly  one of the United States Deputy Secretaries of State gets up in Congress and says ,  we know that these talks will not lead anywhere ,  but we have to occupy the time somehow .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: " Occupy the time . "
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: So , really , maybe somebody in Washington , DC , is thinking about Turchynov 's military offensive scenario .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: In which case , there is no need to accuse Russia of attempting destabilization .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I would like to thank Under - Secretary - General Feltman for his briefing on the tragic incident in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: The Republic of Korea expresses its utmost shock and outrage at the downing of the Malaysia Airlines passenger plane in eastern Ukraine yesterday .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: We deplore the loss of nearly 300 innocent civilian lives aboard that commercial airliner .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: On behalf of the people and the Government of the Republic of Korea ,  I extend my deepest condolences to the people and Governments of Australia , Belgium , Canada , Germany , Indonesia , Malaysia , the Netherlands , the Philippines and the United Kingdom and other affected countries .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: Our hearts go out to the families of the victims at this difficult time .
speaker: Mr. Oh Joon

sentence_text: Finally , at the national level , France is working closely with civil society .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: During the sixtieth session of Commission on the Status of Women ,  which came to an end a few days ago ,  Ms. Laurence Rossignol , France 's Minister for Families , Children and Women 's Rights , incorporated into her delegation nearly 20 organizations representing women .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: In France , civil society is an integral part of women 's rights diplomacy .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Secondly , the role of women in the prevention and settlement of conflicts should be increased as part of our strategies against violent extremism and terrorism .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: The African continent was tragically and repeatedly struck by the recent attacks in Mali , Cote d'Ivoire and Burkina Faso ,  as well as by the constant deadly attacks of Boko Haram in Nigeria and Al - Shabaab in Somalia in particular .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: We know women are victims of intolerable violence on a daily basis that is an affront to the human conscience .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Terrorist groups target them , exploit them , reduce them to sexual objects and sell them in public squares or online .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Women are objects of a parallel economy ,  victims of human trafficking for sexual exploitation purposes  and the trafficking in them finances the activities of terrorist groups .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: That is the very condition of women and their rights ,  which are denied .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Above all , we must give women the means to reverse that logic of control ,  so they can make decisions about their bodies , their lives and the society in which they live .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: To do that , women must have access ,  including in conflict situations in Africa ,  to sexual and reproductive rights and health services , to education and economic resources .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: I thank Mr. Feltman for his briefing .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Since early April , the situation in Ukraine has deteriorated continuously .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: In several eastern cities , armed militants ,   acting in a professional and synchronized manner ,   have taken possession of public buildings .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: The similarity of the operations that were observed in Crimea is striking .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: The violence continues .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Seven observers of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe ( OSCE ) were taken hostage on 25 April .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: They must be released without delay .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: On Sunday , the mayor of Kharkiv was the target of an attack and is in a serious condition .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Many times , we have put forth in this Chamber the essence of the Russian position regarding the cause and development of the internal crisis in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: That general context is important to understanding our view of the draft resolution submitted by the United States ( S/2014/189 ) for the Council 's vote today .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It is a secret to no one that the Russian Federation will vote against the draft resolution .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: We can not go along with its basic assumption ,  which is to declare illegal the planned referendum of 16 March  whereby the people of the Crimean republic will themselves determine their future .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The philosophy of the sponsors of the draft resolution runs counter to one of basic principles of international law ,  the principle of equal rights and self - determination of peoples ,  enshrined in Article 1 of the Charter of the United Nations .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: That principle is confirmed in the 1970 Declaration on Principles of International Law  concerning Friendly Relations and Co - operation among States in accordance with the Charter of the United Nations ,  and in a number of other decisions of the General Assembly ,  as well as the Helsinki Final Act of 1975 .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: We do not dispute the principle of the territorial integrity of States .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It is indeed very important .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It is also understandable that the enjoyment of the right to self - determination involving separation from an existing State is an extraordinary measure ,  applied when further coexistence within a single State becomes impossible .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Moreover ,  as practice has demonstrated ,  in the majority of cases , the realization ofpeoples ' right to self - determination is achieved without the agreement of the central authorities of the State .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: We hope   that the next report of the United Nations human rights monitoring mission in Ukraine ,   to be issued in mid - May ,   will address   the growing cases of human rights violations , violent deaths , causes for torture , abductions and activist disappearances in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: We also hope   the report will look into the human rights situation in occupied Crimea .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: As has been reported , the Crimean Tatar leader Mustafa Dzhemilev has been barred from returning home to Crimea .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: A group of camouflage - clad men stormed the Tatar Assembly offices   and tore down the Ukrainian flag there .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: The director and editor of Crimean Tatar programmes on Crimean State television have been forced out by local authorities   because they had spoken against increasing censorship .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: A new level of banditry by the separatists in eastern Ukraine was reached on 25 April ,   when they kidnapped a group of OSCE representatives .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Notably ,   when asked to release the hostages ,   the separatists were quoted as saying   that they needed to speak to the competent authorities in the Russian Federation .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: My delegation strongly condemns the kidnapping of unarmed OSCE military verification mission observers and Ukrainian security personnel .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Such acts , as well as the public parading of the hostages , speak loudly to the true character and intentions of the separatists ,   who seek to disrupt international observation   so that they can continue attacking Ukraine out of sight of the international community .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: The goal of the United States throughout the crisis in Ukraine has been consistent ,  namely , to support a stable , peaceful and democratic Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We will not be satisfied with a temporary halt to violence .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Russia must stop destabilizing Ukraine  and allow all the people of Ukraine to decide their country 's future through a democratic political process .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: As we sit here ,  the remains of nearly 300 people  - innocent infants , children , women and men -  are strewn across a blackened , smouldering landscape in Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The victims came from at least nine different nations ;  they could just as easily have come from any of ours .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We must treat all of them as our own victims .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We have a duty to each and every one of those individuals , their families and their countries  to determine why that jet fell out of the sky  and to hold the perpetrators accountable .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We must stop at nothing  to bring those responsible to justice .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: To conclude , Australia continues to call on Russia   to meet its Geneva commitments ,   to allow Ukraine 's elections on 25 May to proceed without interference or obstruction ,   which is the right of every sovereign nation ,   and to exercise its influence over separatist activists in Ukraine towards those ends .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The crisis remains very dangerously poised .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Active , genuine and immediate efforts by Russia to defuse it are imperative .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: I would like to thank you , Madam President , for convening this emergency meeting on Ukraine ,   and Mr. Jeffrey Feltman , Under - Secretary - General for Political Affairs , for his briefing on the developments in the situation in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe

sentence_text: We believe , however , that the Ukrainian people and the international community will not judge us on the number of public briefings we organize in the Council   or the toughness of our statements ,   but on our political will   and how we use our influence to effectively help Ukrainians resolve the crisis in their country .
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe

sentence_text: We are witnessing a situation   that is deteriorating every day   and leading slowly to an open war   that might involve countries of the region and beyond .
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe

sentence_text: Indeed , the developments of the last few weeks are alarming   and have immensely undermined the diplomatic efforts to defuse the situation .
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe

sentence_text: We condemn in the strongest terms   the attempt made to assassinate Hennadiy Kernes , the Mayor of Kharkiv , Ukraine 's second - largest city ,   as well as the illegal detention of the military monitors from the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe ( OSCE ) and their Ukrainian staff ,   which is a serious violation of the current agreement ,   and we demand their immediate release .
speaker: Mr. Nduhungirehe

sentence_text: The veto should be a defeat for Russia alone .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: It should not take us with it .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: We must remain steadfast in our commitment to the principles it embodies ,  which are at the heart of the Charter of the United Nations ,  are our best defence against the return of a past  in which Russian aggression against Ukraine emerges .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: To avoid deficiencies , fragmented and bureaucratic responses to these cases ,  which the Organization has suffered from in the past ,  it is essential that the Council 's decisions be guided by the principles of objectivity , non - selectivity and impartiality ,  and that the mechanisms and frequency of dialogue and coordination with countries that contribute military , police and civilian personnel be improved with a view  to examining and discussing this issue ,  and to advancing concerted actions that have greater impact on prevention and the fight against impunity .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: With this resolution , the Security Council has taken up the flag in the fight against this type of act  and is obliged to coordinate with troop - contributing countries .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: Finally , we believe  that it is not a question of stigmatizing countries ,  but rather a question of delivering justice .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: We therefore insist on the need to fully implement Article 44 of the Charter of the United Nations ,  which establishes the requirement to invite troop - contributing countries to participate , in an active and binding manner , in the decision - making process with regard to the deployment oftroops in peacekeeping missions .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: That has never really been operational .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: That single action could help enormously to prevent and punish this type of reprehensible and despicable crime .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: In conclusion , having adopted this resolution ,  we hope  that we will never again have to discuss abuses against women , children and the most vulnerable groups in armed conflict .
speaker: Mr. Ramirez Carrefio

sentence_text: This is the nineteenth time that the Council has met  to discuss the situation in Ukraine since the crisis began .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: Time and time again , the overwhelming majority of the Security Council has called  for a end to the violence and destablization .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: Council members have consistently called  for a de - escalation of tensions ,  for separatists to lay down their weapons  and for genuine dialogue to commence .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: It is time for the equivocation and dissembling and false narratives of some to stop .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: In the three weeks since the Council last discussed the situation in Ukraine ( see S / PV.7205 ) ,  the security situation in the east has become increasingly dire .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: Separatists have ignored repeated calls to disarm  and have continued their attacks on Ukrainian military forces , facilities and border posts .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: Two Ukrainian military cargo planes were downed in eastern Ukraine in the past week alone .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: The Ukrainian armed forces have responded firmly to those attacks .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: They has every right to restore law and order ,  and they have underlined their commitment to do so in proportionate manner .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: Russia has a crucial role to play in de - escalating this persistently dangerous crisis .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: It must end its provocations and any support for separatist forces .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: It must control its border with Ukraine  and prevent the flow of weapons , equipment and fighters from Russia into Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: Russia must withdraw the large number of troops it has again amassed on the Ukrainian border .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: It must actively work  to de - escalate tensions and use its considerable influence with separatist groups in Ukraine to that end .
speaker: Ms. King

sentence_text: The violence of recent days shows once again the need to urgently de - escalate the situation .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: We welcome   the positive steps taken by Ukraine   to fulfil the commitments set out in the Geneva statement adopted on 17 April by Ukraine , Russia , the European Union and the United States .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The Ukrainian Government has proposed   an amnesty for those who leave the buildings they occupy in eastern Ukraine ,   as long as they have not committed crimes .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: It is ready to launch an inclusive national dialogue on constitutional reform and decentralization ,   and has acted with restraint in response to the actions of armed militias in the east .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The international community expects Russia , for its part ,   to take concrete steps   to bring the separatists in eastern Ukraine to de - escalate in accordance with the commitments undertaken in the Geneva statement .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: We expect Russia   to use its influence over the separatist movements   to convince them to seek dialogue with the Ukrainian Government instead of fighting .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Russia should publicly condemn the actions of the separatists aimed at destabilizing Ukraine   and call on armed militants to leave the illegally occupied buildings .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: Finally , the withdrawal of Russian forces from the Ukrainian border is an essential step for de - escalating tensions , especially in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: We strongly condemn   the kidnapping near the town of Sloviansk on 25 April of a team of military inspectors deployed under the 2011 Vienna document of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe ( OSCE ) .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: We also condemn   the temporary detention , on 27 April , of two members of the OSCE special monitoring mission in Yenakiyeve .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The safety of international observers deployed anywhere in Ukraine must be ensured by all parties .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: The OSCE monitoring mission must be able to fulfil its role in the implementation of the Geneva statement .
speaker: Ms. Lucas

sentence_text: My delegation is profoundly troubled  by Russia 's veto of the draft resolution ( S/2014/189 ) on the illegality of the referendum in Crimea ,  and we are worried  about its consequences for the future of peace and security in the region and internationally .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: On 31 May 1997 in a ceremony at the monument of the Liberator Soldier in Kiev , the late President of Russia , Boris Yeltsin , during his historic visit to Ukraine solemnly declared ,  " Ukraine is an independent country ,  and we will hold this promise sacred " .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Russia " does not lay claim on any part of Ukraine or on any of its cities " .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Secondly , the agreement called for all illegal armed groups   to be disarmed .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: The Ukrainian Government started to collect illegal weapons almost as soon as it came to power .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: There are now no illegally armed protesters on Maidan Square   and no armed self - defence groups patrolling the streets of Kyiv .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: But in Sloviansk and other eastern cities , we continue to see ,   encouraged by Russia ,   heavily armed paramilitary forces armed with automatic rifles and rocket - propelled grenades .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Thirdly , the agreement called for all illegally seized buildings , occupied streets and public places   to be vacated .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: The Ukrainian Government has been systematically and incrementally removing barricades around the Maidan   and the protests there are gradually shrinking .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: By contrast , Russia has refused to use its influence to restrain armed groups in the east .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: In fact ,   Foreign Minister Lavrov stated on 23 April   that Russia will not call for these illegal militias to put down their arms and vacate buildings .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Instead , barricades and roadblocks in eastern and southern Ukraine have been steadily reinforced .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Our words and resolutions and debates therefore do have an effect on the ground ,  where it counts the most .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: Let me give just one small example of where the engagement of the international community has had a strong impact  - actually , not such a small example ,  but an important example .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: In Sierra Leone a programme sponsored by the United States to strengthen women 's local political participation became a strong vehicle for empowing women during the 2014 Ebola outbreak .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: The women there leveraged their convening authority to host outreach sessions with health - care providers and local populations on the Ebola response .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: The effort ultimately yielded important recommendations for commmunity - led Ebola responses ,  standards that were adapted by the Government of Sierra Leone .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: Despite the significant progress we have made in advancing the women and peace and security agenda in Africa , again ,  there is still that remains to be done .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: As my Secretary of State , John Kerry said ,  our goal is as simple as it is profound ,  namely , to empower half the world 's population as equal partners in preventing and resolving conflict and building peace in countries threatened and affected by war , violence and insecurity .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: That is also the commitment that the Council has made ,  and it is a commitmen that we must all strive even harder to fulfil .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: With respect to Crimea , that case resulted from a legal vacuum  generated by an unconstitutional armed coup d'etat  carried out in Kyiv by radical nationalists in February , as well as by their direct threats  to impose their order throughout Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It should also be noted that generally agreed principles of international law are closely interlinked  and that each should be considered in the light of the others , the relevant political context and historic specificities .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The political , legal and historic backdrop of the events of today in Ukraine is extremely complicated .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: In that context , it is useful to recall that up until 1954 , Crimea formed part of the Russian Federation .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It was given to Ukraine in violation of the norms of that time under Soviet law  and without taking into account the views of the people of Crimea ,  who nevertheless remained within a single State - the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: When the Soviet Union fell , Crimea automatically became part of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: The View of the people of Crimea was once again ignored .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: After the fall of the Soviet Union , for more than 20 years Crimea attempted to exercise its right to self - determination .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: In January 1991 , a referendum was conducted in Crimea ,  resulting in the adoption of a law in Ukraine regarding the establishment of autonomous Crimea .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: In September 1991 , the High Council of Crimea adopted a declaration on State sovereignty .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: In 1992 , the constitution of Crimea was adopted ,  declaring Crimea an independent state within Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: However , in 1995 ,  through a decision of the Ukrainian authorities and the President of Ukraine ,  the constitution was annulled ,  without the agreement of the Crimean people .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: In his statement today , acting President Oleksandr Turchynov said ,  " I would like to emphasize that those not involved in shooting at Ukrainian law enforcement officers  and who surrender their weapons  and leave seized administrative buildings  will not be subject to prosecution . "
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Only a few weeks have passed  since part of the territory of Ukraine was annexed by the Russian Federation .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: And now Russia is applying the same tools  - inciting separatists by waging unprecedented anti - Ukrainian propaganda in the mass media ,  distorting the truth about Ukraine ,  sending in special troops  to seize administrative and law - enforcement buildings  with the aim of destabilizing the situation in the eastern regions of Ukraine ,  and encouraging marginal groups to pursue their separatist ambitions ,  threatening my country 's unity and territorial integrity .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Apparently , through these attempts , they hope to disrupt the presidential elections in Ukraine scheduled for 25 May .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I also take note of the very important comment  that Egypt made ,  of the admission that the measures contained in the resolution  - measures requiring accountability -  would not have been passed by the General Assembly .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We agree ;  the General Assembly has been totally paralysed .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: There are countries within the negotiations that are going on as we speak  that have tried to water down the recommendations that the Secretary - General has made .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: It would be one thing if we were succeeding ,  if the system was working .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We come in here every day ;  we lament ,  we condemn .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The situation on the Ukrainian - Russian State border has significantly deteriorated in recent days  as a result of systematic violations coming from the Russian side of the border , as well as the provocative actions of armed terrorist groups in the border areas of the Donetsk and Luhansk regions .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Several times a day , columns of military vehicles and Russian mercenaries attempt to break through the Ukrainian State border from the Russian side .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Such attempts are actively facilitated by Russian border protection units .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The anti - terrorist forces in Ukraine have been repeatedly shelled from the territory of Russia .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Ukraine has documented evidence of all those facts for the appropriate international response .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The number of provocations on the Ukrainian - Russian State border has increased substantially .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Illegal armed groups systematically fire towards the territory of Russia  in order to create the false image of Ukrainian military fire .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: That caused the death of a Russian citizen .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The Russian side accused the armed forces of Ukraine of shelling on Russian territory on 28 June , namely , Mine No .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: 24 of Vasetskaya village in the Krasnosulynsky district of the Rostov region and the Gukovo border checkpoint .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The Ukrainian armed forces have never attacked or fired on the territory of Russia .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: All such provocations are committed by pro - Russian terrorists  in order to find grounds for a further escalation .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Today 's statement by the Russian Foreign Minister , Sergey Lavrov , about the possibility of carrying out strikes against the territory of Ukraine sounds like a new provocation .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Today , colleagues have presented some evidence of the deteriorating situation on the Ukrainian - Russian border .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Every day during the month of July , we have observed such violations ,  including the shooting - down of Ukrainian jets .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I would like to take this opportunity to once again draw the attention of members of the Security Council to the fact that Russia continues to redeploy new forces extremely close to the Ukrainian border .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: As of 14 July , the total number of groups of Russian armed forces in the areas bordering Ukraine has significantly increased .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: They comprise 33 battalion tactical groups , with a total of at least 40,000 troops directly around Ukraine , including up to 18,000 troops in Transnistria and up to 21,000 troops in the occupied territory ofCrimea .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Those and similar actions constitute a flagrant violation by Russia of its obligations under the Charter of the United Nations and other universally recognized principles and norms of international law .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Those actions are incompatible with the obligations of the Russian Federation under the Geneva agreement of 17 April and the Berlin declaration of2 June .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Several issues were raised by our Russian colleague .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I would like to answer just one .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: ( spoke in Russian )
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: First , Mr. Churkin compared the situation in December and January with the current situation .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: We must recall that , at that time , the people were speaking out against the banditry of the authorities ,  and now it is bandits who are against the people .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: There is a difference there .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: We can not remain calm  about the fact that several hundred separatists are holding thousands of people hostage to fear in towns .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: We see the standoffs on television in Kharkiv , Luhansk and Dnipropetrovsk .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: We can not look on  while small groups of armed people ,  headed up , inter alia , by agents from the Russian Federation ,  seize State buildings and take weapons to hand out .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Indeed , those are terrorist operations that have been specially organized and orchestrated .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Let us see what the response will be to the reproaches to Russia over the fact  that we do not want supply Ukraine with gas for free .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Let us see on 14 April what response the European ministers will give to the letter that President Putin wrote  proposing  that we work together  to help Ukraine emerge from its economic turmoil .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It is true that the people in Washington , DC ,  to whom we did not send the letter ,  have already poisoned it for the European Union ,  calling it  economic blackmail .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: But let us see whether the European Union has retained some kind of sovereignty  and whether it is capable of making independent , rational decisions  that can help to rescue the situation from crisis .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Instead , Russian officials have refused   to publicly call on the separatists   to give up their weapons and relinquish their illegal control of Ukrainian Government buildings .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: In fact , Russia continues to fund , to coordinate and to fuel the heavily armed separatist movement .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: In addition , just outside of Ukraine 's border , Russia has continued to engage in threatening troop movements   that are designed not to calm tensions ,   but to embolden the separatists   and to intimidate the Government .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: In conclusion , I emphasize   that the United States remains committed to supporting the principles of the Charter of the United Nations   and will continue to uphold the territorial integrity and sovereignty of Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We continue to seek stability within a peaceful , democratic , inclusive and united Ukraine , especially in advance of the upcoming important elections .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We remain committed to a diplomatic process ,   but Russia seems committed to destabilization and fantastical justifications for its actions .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The truth about what is happening in Ukraine should guide our discussion ,   because truth is the only foundation on which an equitable and lasting solution to this crisis can be based .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Like all of us , Australia has watched the events in eastern Ukraine with mounting concern .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: What we have seen unfold is a coordinated operation where well - trained and well - armed paramilitary units have moved quickly to lay siege to , occupy and control key institutions in five or six towns in Donetsk province .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The violence in Sloviansk has led to one death and nine wounded .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The stakes are obviously dangerously high .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: This has not been a spontaneous , grassroots , broad - based protest movement by local inhabitants ;  rather it is a pattern of highly orchestrated destabilization by pro - Russian groups .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Those groups have included units of highly trained armed men with Russian military equipment ,  operating without identifying insignia .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: Those units have used force to storm and besiege local Government buildings and institutions .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: If all that sounds familiar ,  it is because we have seen the playbook used by Russia in Crimea .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: In that case , it became clear that the militias were in fact Russian forces .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: We condemn any use ofproxy forces .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: A State can not seek to avoid responsibility for its actions  by attempting to cloak the identity of those working on its behalf .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: The principles of State responsibility make it very clear  that a State bears international responsibility for acts undertaken by informal actors whom it engages on its behalf .
speaker: Mr. Quinlan

sentence_text: More often than ever before , we are confronted with the unspeakable :  the egregious use by violent extremist groups ,  such as Boko Haram and the Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant ,  of gender - based violence ,  not to mention kidnapping and slavery ,  which are strategically employed to achieve their aims .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: The abduction of over 250 Chibok girls from a school in northern Nigeria by Boko Haram militants in April 2014 and that militant group 's ongoing use of women and girls as suicide bombers remain tragic reminders of how extremist groups are manipulating gender to achieve their ends .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: As the international community responds to violence extremist threats ,  including across Africa ,  we must ensure that the needs and the perspectives of women and girls most affected by extremist violence are integrated into our larger approach to countering violent extremism .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: Our efforts to support survivors of gender - based violence across Africa will be incomplete  unless we also commit to fighting impunity .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: It is for that reason that the United States has supported mobile courts in the Democratic Republic of the Congo ,  which has led to 1,924 trials and 1,336 convictions of gender - based violence since 2009 .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: United States assistance has also supported the training of 5,505 providers of services to survivors ,  strengthened 1,103 local organizations serving gender - based violence - affected populations  and provided 20,125 gender - based violence survivors with a holistic package oflegal services .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: The third point that I would like to stress today  is that the Security Council 's active engagement remains absolutely vital  in order to achieve real and tangible gains for women yearning to be included in peace processes ,  even as we recognize that we still have much work to do .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: A study on assessing women 's inclusion and influence on peace processes by the Inclusive Peace and Transition Initiative of the Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies in Geneva revealed  that when women have been included in peace processes , as in Burundi , Somalia , Darfur and Kenya in recent years ,  their inclusion was mainly owing to normative pressure applied by women 's groups and their international supporters .
speaker: Ms. Sison

sentence_text: Yesterday we were all shocked by the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: All 298 people aboard  - 283 passangers and 15 crew members -  were killed .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: As we stared at the passanger list yesterday ,  we saw next to three of the passangers ' names a capital " I " .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: As we now know ,  that letter stands for " infant " .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: To the families and friends of the victims , it is impossible to find words to express our condolences .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We can only commit to them that we will not rest  until we find out what happened .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: A full , credible and unimpeded international investigation must begin immediately .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The perpetrators must be brought to justice ;  they must not be sheltered by any State Member of the United Nations .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We are witnessing a a subversive operation   that has been planned , barely disguised and orchestrated by Russia .

sentence_text: Russian special forces do not even hide anymore .

sentence_text: Some time ago , our Russian colleague denied   their involvement in Crimea ,   while his President recognized   it a few days later .

sentence_text: No doubt , he will do the same with respect to current events in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: France strongly and unequivocally condemns   those unacceptable attempts by Russia to destabilize Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: We must halt this course of confrontation and work towards de - escalation .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: The joint declaration agreed on in Geneva on 17 April by Ukraine , Russia , the United States and the European Union shows the way forward .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: It calls on all parties   to refrain from violence and acts of intimidation or provocation .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: It provides for the disarmament of illegal armed groups , evacuation of occupied buildings and public places and amnesty for those who lay down their arms ,   with the exception of individuals with blood on their hands .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: It is essential that the declaration be implemented by all parties without delay and in good faith ,   so that the Ukrainian State can re - establish its sovereignty over its territory .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: The OSCE 's special monitoring mission has been asked to play an important role in implementing those de - escalation measures ,   and it is essential that it be allowed to act without hindrance .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: However , since the declaration 's adoption we have seen two distinct attitudes .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: On the one hand , the Ukrainian Government has shown its good faith in implementing the declaration   by drafting an amnesty law , launching the process of constitutional reform and accelerating the dismantling of barricades and armed groups in Kyiv .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: In that regard , I commend the restraint and composure of the Ukrainian security forces ,   who have responded appropriately to the repeated destabilizing actions they are dealing with .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: We can only imagine what any other Government would have done in the face of such provocation on its national territory .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: I should like , if I could , to respond to Egypt 's intervention .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We were accused , implicitly , politely , of having an ulterior motive .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: I confess  that I do have an ulterior motive .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: My ulterior motive is actually , finally , the cancer of sexual exploitation and abuse against people who trust the United Nations flag .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: They see a peacekeeper coming their way  and they think ,  this is someone who is going to help me ;  they do not think ,  I have to run ,  this is someone who is going to rape me .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: That is not what they think .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: That is not what they should ever think ;  but that is what they are going to think ,  and that is with some of them do think ,  because there is not accountability for the crimes committed  that is in any way commensurate with what appears to be the scale of this problem .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: So that is my ulterior motive ,  I confess .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Sue me .

sentence_text: Allow me to thank  the briefers for their insights .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: I wish to thank you ,  Madam President , and your country , Angola , the President of the Security Council for the month of March , for organizing this open debate on the role of women in the prevention and resolution of conflict in Africa ,  a subject that is close to our hearts in Africa .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: I wish also to extend Namibia 's appreciation  to you for focusing your presidency on issues that are important to the African continent , the Middle East and other parts of the world  - issues that need the Council 's renewed attention .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: Namibia associates itself  with the statement delivered by the representative of the Islamic Republic of Iran on behalf of the Non - Aligned Movement .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: As we focus on this subject matter ,  it is important to recognize that more must be done  to fully engage women in conflict resolution and mediation .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: Women 's full participation in peacemaking is fundamental to building peace and security .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: The Charter of the United Nations not only committed its members to save succeeding generations from the scourge of war ,  but also unequivocally reaffirmed fundamental human rights and the equal rights of men and women .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: Despite this strong commitment ,  the understanding of the impact of armed conflict on women and girls  and the role of women in conflict resolution and peacebuilding developed slowly within the United Nations .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: Under the presidency of Namibia , the Security Council adopted resolution 1325 ( 2000 ) on women and peace and security on 31 October 2000 .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: The adoption of that resolution marked another milestone in the process of elevating women 's role in peace and security to a high political agenda  and urged an enhanced role for women in preventing conflict , promoting peace and assisting in post - conflict reconstruction and the incorporation of a gender perspective into United Nations operations .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: Through resolution 1325 ( 2000 ) , the increased participation ofwomen in peace processes was recognized as a goal for the first time in the United Nations history .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: I would like to thank you , Mr. President , for giving me the opportunity to participate in this meeting .
speaker: Ms. Frankinet
