speaker: Ms. Frankinet

sentence_text: On behalf of the Government and the people of Belgium , I would like first to express my most heartfelt condolences to the Government of Malaysia , as well as to the families and friends of the 298 people who were aboard the Malaysia Airlines plane shot down in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Frankinet

sentence_text: There were five Belgian nationals among the victims .
speaker: Ms. Frankinet

sentence_text: Our thoughts are with those who mourn today ,  in particular the friends and families and the Government of the Netherlands ,  a country close to us .
speaker: Ms. Frankinet

sentence_text: Like others who preceded me have done ,  Belgium launches an appeal to all the parties to guarantee full access to the disaster site ,  not only for the search and rescue teams but also for the investigators .
speaker: Ms. Frankinet

sentence_text: A full , detailed , thorough and impartial international investigation should be conducted  to determine the exact circumstances surrounding the MH-17 disaster .
speaker: Ms. Frankinet

sentence_text: In that regard , Belgium supports  the proposal of Australia  that the Security Council adopt a draft resolution  that stresses the need for guaranteed access to the site and for the conduct of a full , independent international investigation .
speaker: Ms. Frankinet

sentence_text: We owe it to the victims and their families , as well as to ourselves ,  to shed full light on what happened yesterday in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Frankinet

sentence_text: In conclusion , let me reiterate that the Security Council , the only world body in charge of maintaining international peace and security , must work towards restoring its own unity  in order to be able to defend the unity , sovereignty and territorial integrity of a States Members of the United Nations ,  while addressing the interests of the countries of the region .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: We recognize that there are political interests involved .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: United Nations peacekeeping operations have made great contributions to the maintenance of international peace and security ,  but a very small number of peacekeepers are suspected of acts of sexual exploitation and abuse ,  acts that undermine the image and the reputation of United Nations peacekeeping operations and the United Nations as a whole .

sentence_text: China supports  Secretary - General Ban ki - Moon and the Secretariat in adopting the zero - tolerance policy ,  supports the international community in taking comprehensive response measures  and supports the Council in playing a proper role in this regard ,  including stepping up coordination with the General Assembly and other United Nations bodies .

sentence_text: It is real , you understand ? "

sentence_text: It is time for the current Government to start seriously addressing issues of socioeconomic development   because a lot of that discontent is based on the socioeconomic concerns of the population .

sentence_text: Once those issues are addressed ,   the level of so - called separatism , I am sure , will diminish .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: That should not happen , according to some ,   because it would go against the scenario .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: It is important to note that through the adoption of resolution 1325 ( 2000 ) ,  the conventional impression of women as helpless victims of war was replaced by an understanding of the important role women play in fostering peace and security .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: We believe  that when women are involved as agents of peace ,  sexual violence against women and children in war and conflict situations can be addressed .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: Resolution 1325 ( 2000 ) is the first - ever resolution adopted by the Security Council that specifically addresses the disproportionate impact of war on women  and stresses the significance of women 's equal participation and full involvement in all efforts  to maintain and promote sustainable peace and security .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: Namibia attaches great importance to the implementation of resolution 1325 ( 2000 ) .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: In the region of the Southern African Development Community ( SADC ) , Namibia was the first country to ratify the SADC Protocol on Gender and Development in October 2009 .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: The Protocol calls  upon members States to put in place measures to ensure that women have equal representation and participation in key decision - making positions and peacebuilding processes .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: This explains why Namibia contributes one of the largest female contingents to the African Union - United Nations Hybrid Operation in Darfur .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: Namibian women in peacekeeping missions have demonstrated remarkable commitment , high competencies and aptitudes for innovation .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: Today , Namibian women are also steadily rising through the ranks and expanding their influence at an ever - increasing rate ,  serving bravely at national , regional and global levels in many different ways .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: More critically , they serve and sacrifice as courageously as any man out there ,  as they did during our struggle for liberation .
speaker: Mr. Emvula

sentence_text: At the global level , it is high time that we establish and implement an ambitious but achievable agenda for action on women in armed conflict  and allow an increased role for women in the peace process .

sentence_text: Those weapons have also been seen in the hands of Russian troops in Crimea .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: It is clear that the tactics used by terrorists to capture admininstrative buildings in the regions of Donetsk , Lugansk and Kharkiv are identical to those used to seize the buildings of the Crimean Parliament and other Governmental building in Crimea ,  which video evidence confirms .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Terrorist groups are acting in a very organized and pre - planned manner .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: One of the goals is to equip as many locally recruited marginal people as possible with arms and ammunition .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: That is why the primary targets of terrorists have been local offices of police and security services with weapon storage facilities .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: As a result , several hundred guns and automatic rifles have been seized  are now in the hands of terrorists .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I am grateful to Under - Secretary - General Feltman for his briefing .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: The United Kingdom requested this meeting   because we are deeply concerned   by the deteriorating security situation in southern and eastern Ukraine   and by the fact that the Geneva agreement of 17 April is not yet achieving its objective to restore stability in Ukraine .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: It is vitally important that the Security Council maintain its close scrutiny of events in Ukraine   and the consequent threat to international peace and security .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: We will doubtless hear   Russian claims   that it is the actions of the Ukrainian Government that are destabilizing the south and east of the country .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: In fact , it is Russia that has taken further dangerous steps   aimed at fomenting instability in Ukraine .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: It has directed paramilitary actions in Sloviansk , Kramatorsk , Lugansk and other towns in eastern Ukraine .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Russian military jets and helicopters have made incursions into Ukrainian airspace .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: Russian armed forces have held further military exercises on Ukraine 's border .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: These are all clear attempts to escalate tensions within Ukraine .
country: United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland
speaker: Sir Mark Lyall Grant

sentence_text: My Government condemns   the actions of armed separatists and their external sponsors ,   aimed at further undermining and threatening the territorial integrity , sovereignty and independence of Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: The onus is now on Russia to stop interfering in Ukraine 's internal affairs   and fomenting unrest in Ukraine ,   and to abandon its threats of the use of force .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Ukraine is doing its part to implement the Geneva agreement on Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: It is time for Russia to live up to its own commitments   and to reclaim respect for the Charter of the United Nations and international law .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Ukraine welcomes the adoption of resolution 2272 ( 2016 ) ,  which we consider to be a milestone document .
speaker: Mr. Vitrenko

sentence_text: We commend the United States delegation for its leadership in that regard .
speaker: Mr. Vitrenko

sentence_text: During yesterday 's debate ( see S / PV.7642 ) ,  the lack of sufficient progress in the fight against sexual exploitation and abuse in the past decade was acknowledged by almost all delegations .
speaker: Mr. Vitrenko

sentence_text: Unfortunately , the number ofallegations has not diminished .
speaker: Mr. Vitrenko

sentence_text: The crimes committed today are as appalling as they were years ago .
speaker: Mr. Vitrenko

sentence_text: We believe  that the Security Council is uniquely positioned to send a strong message  to confront this problem .
speaker: Mr. Vitrenko

sentence_text: That is why we fully supported the adoption of today 's resolution .
speaker: Mr. Vitrenko

sentence_text: We hope  that the document we have adopted will serve as a clear signal to all parties concerned  that the Security Council stands for the pressing need to implement a more assertive approach  in order to address the scourge of sexual exploitation and abuse promptly .
speaker: Mr. Vitrenko

sentence_text: As an active troop- and police - contributing country , Ukraine reaffirms its determination to effectively contribute to the fight against sexual exploitation and abuse ,  to engage with all stakeholders  and to implement the necessary steps and mechanisms ,  including those envisaged in today ’s resolution .
speaker: Mr. Vitrenko

sentence_text: Despite all the international efforts ,  supported by the strong Ukrainian will to prevent a further escalation and further strengthened by the President 's peace plan ,  the foreign terrorists and their Russian supporters have no intention of leaving us in peace or laying down their arms .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: We are still struggling against high - capacity military saboteurs who are willing to destroy Ukraine and to establish havens for chaos and instability .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Ukraine demands  that the Russian side immediately cease provocations on the State border of Ukraine ,  stop hindering the efforts of the Ukrainian side and the international community to put an end to terrorism and other violence in Donetsk and Luhansk regions ,  return to President Poroshenko 's peace plan ,  withdraw its forces from the Ukrainian border  and stop threatening peace and security in our country , the region and the world as a whole .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The United States will vote against the proposed amendment put forward by Egypt for a simple , stark reason ,  that is , the amendment would undermine the purpose of the draft resolution ( 8/2016/235 ) .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Our draft resolution does not dictate how any Member State should go about investigating allegations  or punishing those perpetrators found within their own systems to be guilty .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: But it does clearly state- finally - that there would be real consequences  if the concerned troop- or police - contributing country failed to credibly respond to the allegations against its personnel .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Under the draft resolution , a non - response is simply not an option .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Our draft resolution outlines  broad , objective criteria for troop- and police - contributing countries to satisfy ,  as appropriate , in the event that their personnel are the subject of an allegation or allegations .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Those criteria relate to countries not taking any of the following steps ,  namely , not investigating an allegation or allegations ,  not holding accountable somebody who has been found to be a perpetrator ,  or not informing the Secretary - General of the actions that the State has undertaken .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: In the draft resolution ,  which will come up for a vote shortly ,  the failure to do any one of those things should trigger the replacement provision set out in paragraph 2 of the draft resolution owing to non - response .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: I , too , would like to thank Assistant Secretary - General for Political Affairs Oscar Fernandez - Taranco for his briefing on the developments in Ukraine and on the involvement of the United Nations .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: I also welcome the presence of the Permanent Representative of Ukraine at this meeting .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: Argentina continues to follow the situation with concern , in particular in the east of Ukraine .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: Undoubtedly , the situation has deteriorated , with further tensions and violence ,  and we can not remain indifferent to that .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: We are deeply concerned that the tension and violence may continue and indeed worsen .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: We are also concerned about the consequences for Ukraine and the region .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: The delegation of Argentina reiterates that it is essential that we adhere to the principles that we subscribe to as Members of the United Nations .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: In particular , we must remember our commitment to non - interference in the internal affairs of States , whether militarily , politically or economically .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: In that respect , we believe that the action of any State or international organization must duly respect Ukraine 's handling of its own affairs .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: As we have expressed on several occasions , the situation will not be resolved through any kind of unilateral action .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: It is crucial that the use of force be avoided .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: We join the Secretary - General today in calling on all parties to endeavour to bring calm to the situation .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: Maximal self - restraint must be shown ,  and constructive dialogue sought and established on an urgent basis  in order to de - escalate the situation and address the parties ' differences .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: In conclusion , Argentina will continue to promote dialogue and a peaceful settlement of the crisis .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: It is essential to step up efforts  to create the conditions necessary for urgent dialogue to begin  so that solutions can be found to the parties ' differences and the interests of all minorities are taken into account .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: The multilateral meeting among the United States , the Russian Federation and the European Union that is planned for Thursday , 17 April will present an opportunity to do so .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: We hope that those main actors will be able to achieve the agreement necessary .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: We reiterate that the international community should concentrate its efforts on establishing dialogue .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: We stress that Ukrainians must have a democratic and peaceful outcome to the situation .
speaker: Mrs. Perceval

sentence_text: Through you , Madam President , France would like warmly to thank the delegation of Angola for organizing this open debate , which allows the Security Council , in the context of its work on the prevention and resolution of conflicts , to continue to add value to and to promote the crucial role of women on these issues .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: I also thank all the briefers for their precise and enlightening briefings on the evolution of the role of women  and , I would even say , the real and potential power they possess in terms of settling conflict in Africa .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: I heard the statistics and the information  presented by the Executive Director of UN - Women ,  and the message is clear :  women 's involvement in these issues is crucial for achieving lasting peace .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: The growing recognition of this fact is an important trend for the Organization ,  a deep - rooted movement in whose favour France is firmly committed .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: Our efforts should therefore focus on the ways in which to concretely implement that principle .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: What tools not only to strengthen  but also ensure active participation by women in the prevention and settlement of conflicts ?
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: How can we ensure that all Council resolutions - from 1325 ( 2000 ) to 2242 ( 2015 ) - are fully and effectively implemented ?
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: I will try to answer those questions by stressing three points today .
speaker: Mr. Delattre

sentence_text: This also follows a pattern of actions by Russian - backed separatists .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: On 13 June , separatists shot down a Ukrainian transport plane carrying 40 paratroopers and 9 crew members .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: On 24 June ,  as the Council was meeting to welcome Ukraine 's unilateral ceasefire ( see S / PV.7205 ) ,  we received word that separatists had downed a Ukrainian helicopter ,  killing all nine aboard .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: On 14 July , separatists claimed credit  for downing a Ukrainian military cargo plane flying at 6,000 metres .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: And on 16 July they claimed credit  for the downing of a Ukrainian fighter jet .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: If indeed Russian - backed separatists were behind this attack on a civilian airliner ,  they and their backers would have good reason to cover up evidence of their crime .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: It is therefore extremely important that an investigation be commenced immediately .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Moreover , the build - up of Russian troops for several weeks now  - under the guise of military exercises -  casts an ominous shadow over eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Further still , the economic pressure is becoming more biting .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Without dialogue with the Ukrainian side ,  which it has taken by the throat ,  Russia has brutally raised the price of gas .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: It blocks the entry of goods at the border between Russia and Ukraine ,  no doubt in an effort to stifle a country it calls its brother .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Finally , Russia is systematically bombarding Ukraine with a message of defiance vis - a - vis Kyiv via the airwaves and television channels ,  which , for many people who do not have access to various sources of information , is the only message they hear .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: It is against that backdrop that France commends the level - headedness of Ukrainian officials who ,  against that destabilizing torrent of events ,  seek to resolve the crisis through dialogue .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: That is the spirit in which Prime Minister Yatsenyuk visited eastern Ukraine  with specific proposals in response to the real questions of people overwhelmed by propaganda who are disoriented and being exploited by radical groups .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: France has always been clear on the issue of the status oflanguages and regions .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: We encourage the authorities in Kyiv to continue their efforts for cooler heads to prevail ,  enter into a constructive dialogue  and reassure people about their place in Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Araud

sentence_text: Uruguay wishes to express its satisfaction for the adoption earlier in this meeting of resolution 2272 ( 2016 ) .
speaker: Mr. Bermudez

sentence_text: At the outset , we want to thank the United States for its timely initiative .
speaker: Mr. Bermudez

sentence_text: Uruguay is very pleased to join the rest of the Council in their agreement  that dealing with this problem can no longer be postponed .
speaker: Mr. Bermudez

sentence_text: With regard to the content of the resolution ,  which is in line with the concept of zero tolerance , in our dual capacity as a member of the Security Council and a troop - contributing country ,  we believe that ,  although the text could be further improved ,  given the sensitivity ofthe issue ,  it nonetheless has important provisions for combating such reprehensible acts ,  which ,  as was said in yesterday 's meeting on the subject ( see S / PV.7642 ) ,  affect not only the image and credibility of United Nations peacekeeping operations  but , above all , have an impact on the dignity of the victims who suffer , often irreversibly , from their consequences .
speaker: Mr. Bermudez

sentence_text: For all of those reasons , therefore , Uruguay voted in favour of the resolution .
speaker: Mr. Bermudez

sentence_text: Lastly , we would like to reiterate  that all staff who are part of United Nations peacekeeping operations ,  whether military , police or civilian components , just like all personnel in other operations authorized by the Security Council ,  must be held accountable for their actions .
speaker: Mr. Bermudez

sentence_text: The representative of the United States noted  that Vice - President Biden will be going to Ukraine ,  it seems , on 21 April .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: But maybe he should not wait for 21 April .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Maybe he should go right now .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Pick up the phone ,  call Mr. Turchynov  - as he called President Yanukovych more than once before 21 February -  and say to him what he said to Mr. Yanukovych .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: As we were informed by the Vice - President 's Chief of Staff ,  he said ,  " For God 's sake , just do not use force .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Call off your forces from the centre of Kyiv " .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: That was what Mr. Biden said .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: And now , is the United States going to encourage  the fulfilment of this criminal decree  authorizing the use of military force ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Why , in one case ,  when it was a question of preparations to storm the residence of the President of Ukraine ,  the call was that under no circumstances should force be used ,  while in the current situation , it is to encourage the insane military actions  that Turchynov 's decree talks about ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I would therefore request Ms. Power to ask Vice - President Biden to call Mr. Turchynov right now ,  because in a few hours ' time things might take an irreversible turn .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: In recognizing and supporting women 's role as agents of peace ,  the international community is also contributing to address one of the direst aspects of war that mostly affects women and girls .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: Sexual violence in conflict remains a serious concern for vulnerable populations impacted by war around the world , predominantly women and girls .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: Despite the strong African commitment to fighting sexual and gender - based violence ,  serious crimes against humanity , involving rape and sexual slavery , continue to occur in some regions of Africa .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: Brazil strongly condemns  these abhorrent violations .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: We have long upheld the imperative  to pursue accountability for serious crimes and abuses against women and girls ,  including but not limited to sexual and gender - based violence .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: A milestone in this regard was the recent International Criminal Court ( ICC ) trial ,  presided over by Brazilian Judge Sylvia Steiner ,  leading to the conviction of Jean - Pierre Bemba for war crimes and crimes against humanity in the Central African Republic .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: This was the first ICC case to specifically focus on the use of sexual violence as a weapon of war ,   and should serve as a powerful deterrent to would - be perpetrators .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: As the current Chair of the Commission on the Status of Women ( CSW ) , I am deeply committed  to gender equality in all political and security processes .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: A specific concern are the human rights of women of African origin ,  who are often subject to discrimination and prejudice outside Africa .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: In this spirit , Brazil and the United States co - organized last week a CSW side event on the racial identity of women of African descent in the diaspora ,  in the context of the 2015 - 2024 International Decade for People of African Descent .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: We believe  that visibility and self - representation are powerful strategies for tackling racism and injustice .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: According to media reports ,   today Mr. Yatsenyuk submitted to the Rada some sort of draft constitution .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It is not really clear how it was prepared .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: What is certain is that it was not an open and inclusive process .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: In fact , the Party of Regions ,   which represents the rest of the east of the country ,   was excluded from the process .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It is no surprise that the draft was immediately criticized in the Rada by all sides .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: We did not hear any reasonable answers to key questions ,   such as how the federalization or decentralization of the country would take place .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: It seems such things are to be substituted by some type of broadening of municipalities .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: How is the issue of the status of the Russian language to be resolved ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Can anyone seriously assert that all those activities by Kyiv are a solution to the political crisis aimed at stabilizing Ukraine ?
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Instead of genuine collective work to bring Ukraine out of the crisis ,   which was brought about by political misadventurism ,   our colleagues from the United States and the European Union have preferred to make strong insinuations against Russia   and thinking up some sort of sanctions that are pointless and counterproductive .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Perhaps they are satisfactory to some one ,   but the responsibility for the future of Ukraine , Europe and the world is not being considered -   at least not by these people .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: For us it is no surprise that Russia has vetoed today 's draft resolution .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: For that permanent member of the Council , it has become the custom to veto any measure aimed at maintaining international peace and security .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: We remember the vetoes of draft resolutions on peacekeeping missions in Syria ,  which brought about thousands and thousands of deaths .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I am confident that when Council members gather together next week with Ambassador Tanin  to speak about the reform of the Security Council ,  the issue of the right of the veto will be discussed .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Two cases , Syria and Crimea , will certainly be considered as examples of the behaviour of a permanent member of the Council when peace is needed .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: ( spoke in Russian )
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The representative of the Russian Federation has stated many times in this Chamber  that Russia 's right of the veto was gained through the blood of the Second World War .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I would like to recall  that it was the collective bloodshed of Ukrainians , Belarusians and Georgians .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: To manipulate the issue of the bloodshed is absolutely unacceptable .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Moreover , it is a manipulation of the right of the veto before the new blood on one 's hands .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Previously it was Georgian blood  - now it is Ukrainian .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I believe  that such chaos should end now .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I shall now make a statement in my capacity as the representative of Rwanda .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: I thank Mr. Jeffrey Feltman , Under - Secretary - General for Political Affairs , for his availability and for his detailed briefing , prepared on such short notice .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: Allow me , first of all , to express my deep sorrow over the loss of the 298 lives ,  including 80 children ,  who were killed on Malaysia Airlines Flight MH - l7 ,  which was shot down in eastern Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: On behalf of the Government of Rwanda , I express my deepest condolences to the families who lost loved ones , as well as to the people and the Governments of the victims .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: The loss of those innocent civilians is beyond comprehension .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: Their lives were cut off in the middle of a crisis  on which this very Council has been unable to take action since it began in February .
speaker: Mr. Gasana

sentence_text: Notwithstanding significant challenges ,  African women have many success stories to tell .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: Women 's organizations were at the forefront of the Liberian peace process .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: Post - conflict recovery initiatives led to the economic empowerment of thousands of women in Burundi and Rwanda .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: The policies and instruments of the African Union Gender Policy ,  as well as the Gender , Peace and Security Programme of the African Peace and Security Architecture ,  provide valuable tools to support the empowerment of African women as agents of peace .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: We also welcome  the adoption last year of the African Union Agenda 2063  and its pledge to empower African women in all spheres of social life .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: It is also heartening to note that three important peacekeeping operations in Africa are now led by women .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: We pay tribute  to the commitment and leadership of Ellen Margrethe Loj , the Head of the United Nations Mission in South Sudan ;  Ai'chatou Mindaoudou , the Head of the United Nations Operation in Cote d'Ivoire ;  and Kim Bolduc , the Head of the United Nations Mission for the Referendum in Western Sahara .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: Another woman , Hester Paneras , until recently steered the world 's largest international police component  - that of the African Union - United Nations Hybrid Operation in Darfur .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: Yet this positive trend can not offset the fact that women constitute merely 4 per cent of the 88,000 troops and police personnel currently deployed in United Nations peacekeeping operations in Africa .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: In that regard , we recall resolution 2242 ( 2015 ) ,  which calls upon the Secretary - General and Member States to double the number of women in military and police contingents of United Nations peacekeeping operations over the next five years .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: Female peacekeepers are uniquely well placed to build trust with local communities and to address sexual and gender - based violence .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: They also serve as role models to inspire women and girls to seek more rights and participation in our societies .
speaker: Ms. Delgado/Mr. Gaspar Martins

sentence_text: Tragically , bloodshed is happening where there was no bloodshed before pro - Russian militants started their creeping secessionist provocations .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: It is as clear as day that ,  in spite of the reassurances we heard from Moscow a few weeks ago ,  military aggression against Ukraine and its sovereignty , independence , and territorial integrity has not stopped with Crimea .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: My Government strongly condemns the actions of the separatist groups and their sponsors in the Donetsk region , as well as in the regions of Luhansk and Kharkiv .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Lithuania supports the efforts of the Government of Ukraine to resolve this complex and unpredictable situation in a peaceful way .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Ukraine 's Government has reached out repeatedly to the separatists .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: In the most difficult of political and economic circumstances , Ukraine 's acting President Turchinov has decided to prepare a law on decentralization , granting more powers to the regions .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Acting Prime Minister Yatseniuk has clearly stated  that the Government must respond to people 's desire to have more regional authority .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: That decision is an important step forward ,  showing the flexibility and readiness of legitimate Ukrainian authorities to heed its population and engage constructively .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Prime Minister Yatseniuk also reassured  the Russian - speaking population regarding the use of the Russian language .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Furthermore , amnesty was offered to all militants who laid down arms and returned to seeking a peaceful solution to existing issues .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: It is obvious that the Ukrainian Government is doing everything possible , under such dramatic circumstances ,  to respond to the legitimate needs and concerns of the population ,  to curb corruption and impunity , which had reigned under Yanukovich ,  to re - establish law and order and the authority of the State  and to address the problems the Government inherited from years of neglect and mismanagement .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: We fully support those efforts  and once again stress the extraordinary restraint and patience with which Ukraine 's Government has continued to respond to the unending provocations and efforts to dismember the State by armed pro - Russian militants and separatists .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: At the same time ,  when the existence of a State is put in danger ,  we understand and support the right of Ukraine to defend itself in the face of external aggression and to tackle militant separatism and continuous provocations in order to protect the State and its population from a further escalation of violence .
speaker: Ms. Murmokaite

sentence_text: Some colleagues today have achieved high levels of rhetoric .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I must mention  that the Ukrainian colleague nevertheless went far beyond anything permissible .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Ifone is to speak ofblood ,  indeed the blood is not on our hands  but on the hands of his friends the nationalist radicals  - the blood of those Ukrainians who were shot by snipers on days in February of this year -  whose ideological fathers he defended not very long ago in the halls of the United Nations ,  stating  that Nazi Ukranian henchmen did not kill anyone  and that those were falsehoods made up by the Soviet Union .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: With regard to other statements ,  I must note  that something has caught my attention .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: Colleagues that have taken the floor discussed poorly developed arguments ,  on the whole - it was not the argumentation put forward by my delegation ,  but distorted images or elements of our position .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I will not comment on everything heard today - all of the highly unacceptable comments .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: I will , however , make a few comments .
speaker: Mr. Churkin

sentence_text: My British colleague has given us information about the strange statement by our Russian partner here ,   who said   that ,   in case of events taking a bad turn in Ukraine 's south - east ,   Russia would remember the provision to use armed forces in Ukraine given to President Vladimir Putin by the Federation Council .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: He also said   that Russia had an international legal basis for sending its peacekeeping troops into Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: And he referred to the right to self - defence under Article 51 of the Charter of the United Nations ,   which Russia used during the conflict in the Caucasus in 2008 .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The right to self - defence on the territory of another country ?
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Let me remind him   that Ukraine has never threatened Russia , and never will .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Ukrainians want to live in peace and to be left alone .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The highest level of cynicism is the Russian reference to the right of self - defence in a situation   in which it is Russia that is acting as aggressor ,   having occupied Crimea ,   as is brutally interfering in the internal affairs of Ukraine ,   destabilizing it and trying to create an explosive situation in the eastern regions .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Unfortunately , we are deeply concerned   that the scenario that is prepared for eastern Ukraine might be similar to the one implemented by Russia in Abkhazia .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: That scenario might include several steps .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: The United States deeply appreciates the support from our colleagues around the table and from the many States that have called for a peaceful end to the crisis in Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: This is , however , a sad and remarkable moment .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: It is the seventh time that the Security Council has convened to discuss the urgent crisis in Ukraine .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The Council is meeting on Ukraine  because it is the job of this body to stand up for peace and to defend those in danger .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We have heard a lot ,  each time that the Security Council has met ,  about the echoes and relevance of history .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We have heard , for example , about the pleas of the brave democrats of Hungary in 1956 and about the dark chill that dashed the dreams of Czechs in 1968 .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: We still have the time and the collective power to ensure that the past does not become prologue .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: But history has lessons ,  for those of us who are willing to listen .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Unfortunately , not everyone was willing to listen today .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: Under the Charter of the United Nations , the Russian Federation has the power to veto a Security Council draft resolution .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: But it does not have the power to veto the truth .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: As we know , the word " truth " - or " pravda " - has aprominent place in the story ofmodern Russia .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: From the days of Lenin and Trotsky until the fall of the Berlin Wall , Pravda was the name of the house newspaper of the Soviet communist regime .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: But throughout that period , one could search in vain to find " pravda " in pravda .
speaker: Ms. Power

sentence_text: The Government of Ukraine strongly condemns   the aforementioned acts of terror and violence ,   including yesterday 's attempt to assassinate the Mayor of Kharkiv , Hennadiy Kernes ,   who publicly supported the unity and territorial integrity of Ukraine .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: Unfortunately , Russia has not even publicly condemned or dissociated itself from those acts of terror and violence perpetrated by illegal militants since the Geneva agreement .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: I would like to remind the Council   that Russia used to deny   that its armed forces participated in the occupation of Crimea .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: However , President Putin now openly admits   the use of Russian military forces   and praises them for their heroism and the successful completion of the operation aimed at the reunification of Crimea with Russia .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: They have even issued a special medal of honour .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev

sentence_text: And now ,   in spite of numerous irrefutable facts concerning Russian military involvement in organizing and guiding illegal armed groups in eastern Ukraine ,   Moscow denies any Russian military participation just as hard .
speaker: Mr. Sergeyev
